Okay, now that I've had coffee and my MIL is comfortable, I'm going to upgrade the rating to 3 stars. Menu looks nice and I'm excited to try the coffee cake.   Food and service was excellent. They don't do muffins like Egg Works, but they do make a very tasty apply cinnamon cream cheese coffee cake. We might try again for our group brunch and we hope it was just a fluke.

Went here for the first time after seeing a friends review  The food is really good ! The customer service was great Our waitress which I didn't get her name but 'she's the older lady with red hair and nice nails' was very attentive and polite  We'll definitely be back !!

I'm not a real big breakfast fan but this place was top notch. We came on a Sunday morning around 11:00. There was a short wait but totally worth it.   I ordered the corned beef hash with two poached eggs, hash browns and coffee cake. The corned beef was fresh and homemade, not that canned stuff and seasoned perfectly with bell peppers and onions. The hash browns were good but nothing out of the ordinary but my mom had the country potatoes and she said they were "really good" with a smile. The coffee cake was also an added bonus and delicious. It came out before our meal and was nice and warm!  My husband ordered an omelette with sausage (can't remember which one) but he devoured it. He also added country gravy, which I initially thought was a little gross but it was actually pretty damn good!   Service was good and everyone was friendly. You pay at the counter and don't forget to pick up your little chocolate mint in a basket next to the register.

Too crowded for my taste. Coffee cake is nice and warm, food is good, not knock your socks off good. I got the regular grand slam like breakfast and it was alright. Prices are okay too, but u would t go out of my way for this place.

One of my favourite new places for breakfast, the owner Luke goes above and beyond to make everything perfect the food is awesome and they have the best chilli in Phoenix,The service is impeccable, love Jennifer and Trish they are the best, and your coffee cup is never empty, would recommend this place to everyone, great job guys

I like the cracked egg, great tradional american breakfast. Hae been here 4 times and will be back. Its worth driving out to (not that far). Get off the strip, explore Vegas there are quite a few great places like the Cracked Egg.

Stopped in on a Saturday morning after a hike at Red Rock Canyon. Glad we did! Seated immediately. Hostess was friendly. Waitress came and asked if we had any questions which she answered expertly and patiently. Our food came quickly and was close to perfect. I had the Veggie Benedict and my bff/husband had a tuna melt. Fabulous on all accounts. Entrees run about $10 on average. We left very satisfied and look forward to returning and trying the coffee cake which comes in different varieties throughout the day.

Was referred by a friend as a spot that I MUST go to! It was really good, they got my order correct with my specialty add-ons...my MIL likes her eggs runny and she said they were perfect. Now my friend said the coffee cake was to die for...for me it was just okay (hence the 4) it was warm, light n fluffy (almost like angel food), with a raspberry filling (that's the part I didn't like). I'd go back next time I'm in Henderson

Went about 8:00 am today and the place was empty. We had the GVP (?) omelet which had mostly all spinach nothing else. The avocado was brown and the cheese (Muenster) was just one big melted blob. Also ordered the Monte Cristo as I had been craving one...all I can say is greasy, greasy and greasy. Soooo disappointed because I have eaten here before (quite a long while ago) and I remembered it to be delish...Not today...

This is my favorite place to get breakfast. The portions are larger which makes for a great second meal. The texture of the coffee cake is always perfect. I have gotten a few different omelettes and have never been disappointed.
Great breakfasts. Menu has unique items that are reasonably priced with large portions. They are always busy but you get seated relatively quickly. Great service always. Highly recommend.

Our waitress was 5 star. We ordered the breakfast burrito & it was very tasty & a little spicy... Comes with hash browns or seasoned potatoes. Hash browns were way better... Also you get toast or coffee cake if you want it... Chocolate chips in the coffee cake.   Eggs Benedict come in several varieties... We tried the vegetable type & it was good but would recommend clarification to the wait staff as to how you want it cooked. We found the eggs to be a bit undercooked.   Also, if you don't want the English Muffin with the Benedict, you must ask them not to include it.  Vegetable means veggies on top of the English Muffin, topped with Spinach, Tomato & Avocado.
Went today for brunch, egg Benedict was yum. My family also enjoyed their meal . Service is good too

The Cracked Egg is my favorite breakfast spot in Vegas. The coffee cake is ALWAYS good and the scrambles are the best. All of the locations are small and intimate. The staff is always super friendly and happy to make suggestions if, like me, you can't make a decision on your own. They've never steered me wrong.
I have recommended this great cafe to all my friends. The prices are very reasonable. The food is excellent and the service is exceptional.

Pretty good but nothing special. Definitely better than IHOP or Denny's, though. Have a few interesting omelettes and scrambles but nothign to really write home about. Would go again if I'm in the area and looking for breakfast but not making a special trip.

This is my favorite breakfast place in Las Vegas. The coffee cake is the best I've ever had! Beware: it has apples at the bottom, like an apple pie filling, which my husband prefers not to have. He will eat all of the fluffy cake parts though while I try to stab his hand with my fork. It's MINE!  Service is fast and friendly. My favorite breakfast meal is chicken fried steak and eggs, which is perfect here. My husband likes plain season potatoes without onions chopped into it...and that's what they serve here!  I've never had to wait for a seat here. I usually go before 11 am on weekdays, though!

This was our first visit to The Cracked Egg.  We are not local, but travel to Las Vegas regularly.  ATMOSPHERE:  This is a casual and roomy restaurant.  They make the most of their space, but it definitely didn't feel cramped in any way.  SERVICE: Average.  Our server was friendly and offered her suggestions when asked.  She was very busy with many tables.  I was a little disappointed when she dropped off the bill without us asking for it, or asking if we were finished with our meal.  But when I needed a box to take my food to go, we had to flag her down.  FOOD: The Enchilada -- Had just the right mixture of ingredients.  The sauce to pepper to tortilla to egg ratios complemented one another exquisitely without overpowering each other.  The hash browns were crispy (at our request) and tasty.  The coffee cake side was warm, sweet and delicious.  Croissant French Toast -- very tasty.  The bread was a little chewier than I'd hoped for but in retrospect, some croissants are chewy so I'm not sure this is avoidable.  The berries were absolutely delectable - fresh and full of flavor.  Overall, we were very satisfied with this experience and would return.

I order from the cracked egg all the time. I love the food it's always made perfectly, the one time it wasn't they quickly remade my meal for me which I appreciated. Most of the people who work there are super friendly, the servers, and as well as the manager. The only problem I have, and this is what ruins this restaurant for me, is the girls at the front. I always come in, and leave feeling like I was friendlier than them. They never have a smile or a nice greeting for take out orders. Also I personally work at the front of my work and do a better job greeting and asking people how they are once in awhile other than feeling like I'm at a morgue. Other than that great food rude ladies at the front.

Tried this place for the first time today . I have drives in this plaza with tropical smoothie and the other stores multiple times and never even knew this restaurant was here . All the booths were taken when we went here , and we took that as a good sign. We didn't have to wait longer than maybe 15 minutes for one though. They have a good kids menu and good pencils and activity menu to keep the children entertained. I had a breakfast burrito with eggs potatoes and cheese and added spinach and it was delicious. The service was very good and they were very attentive and on top of everything . We were very happy with everything and will definitely be going back

Stopped here with my mom for a late brunch around 1pm and got in right away. The staff was super nice, very attentive, and our food arrived very quickly. We both ordered black coffee and were pleasantly surprised how good and smooth it was. I drank 2 cups! My mom ordered huevos rancheros. I ordered the pesto scramble with seasoned potatoes and toast. We also split a banana pancake. Everything was so yummy and the portions were a good size. We will definitely be back!
Came here for some breakfast.  I had the chorizo and eggs which was good but the eggs could have been cooked a little more.  Other than that the meal was good.
Food is always pretty decent but this past visit the service wasn't great.  They were busy, but could have been better.
This place was great!! Good food!! Friendly people!! If you order the biscuit, it is ridiculous. It was about 4" high and 4" round. Flaky and delicious.

I decided to stop in and I ordered the Monte Cristo which was ok. The hash browns were excellent;  I have heard so many good things about this Restaurant that I will eagerly give them a second chance.  Maybe the Chicken Fried Steak next time.

I cannot begin to say enough great things about The Cracked Egg. I think the first thing that I should start with is the fact that after a three year absence from regular visits, I was surprised to see so many familiar faces. The food is always so good here - breakfast or lunch and the friendly staff just adds to that, "I'm know I'm going to return" fact. My favorite part of The Cracked Egg is by far and wide the coffee cake! It's so good!!! Make sure to sign up for their rewards program to get offers and coupons. A great local restaurant that should not be missed.

So this is only 1 of 2 of The Cracked Egg locations that I have tried.   I have to say it's not a very warm and welcoming feeling when you walk in, we were seated by a hostess that didn't look to sure about what she was doing.  Got our drinks right away by a really nice guy. Ordered our food from the waitress shortly after that. It wasn't very crowded and she came back to the table to double check about something we had ordered.  The food was ok, it was as ordered but some of their stuff is very bland. Burnt toast.  Overall a decent place for the price and amount of food you get, I think I just prefer other locations rather than this one.

I went here for the first time on Saturday, and wow. I actually asked the manager if someone's mom was back there cooking. The food was delicious. They even make their scrambled eggs with cream cheese just like I do. I think I'm in love!   There was a 15 minute wait when I went on Saturday, so today I opted for the takeout. Since everyone was ordering the chicken fried steak, I figured I'd give that a go. It was so good! Crispy and smothered in naughty, rich gravy. It also came with scrambled eggs and hashbrowns plus a delicious piece of coffee cake that I shared with a co-worker.   Up until now I thought Farmer Boys was the big thing for breakfast. They now have some stiff competition!

Over prices food with little taste. The hash browns are mushy and the corned beef hash had absolutely no flavor. They also charged $3.75 for a small cup of orange juice. Very disappointed in this breakfast. On the upside the customer service was decent.

Family owned and absolutely delicious!  They have lots of different items to choose from on their menu. I plan to be a regular here and am so happy that I found this place.  The service here is friendly, fast AND accurate.

Ordering whites-only omelet and fruit instead of potatoes should hint you that I eat healthy. There is no need to soak my Denver omelet in oil and cover it with cheese (not listed on the description).  Sorry that I didn't mention that I don't get my toast with lard (or was it butter?). Yes, I promise to let you know beforehand and not inconvenience you.  An omelet and a kindergarten-sized cup of OJ for $15? Really?

Our breakfast was great!  We tried a little bit of everything. I was hoping the Monte Cristo would have been more filling compared to other restaurants but the flavor was perfect!   The wait was longer than estimated, but they finally squeezed us into a booth. Service was not the greatest but it was a busy Sunday..
Great breakfast spot. The weather was perfect so asked to be sat in the patio area l. The food was good and service was fast.

Oh my goodness this place was amazing.  We ordered carry out from this place and I got the tuna melt which was AMAZING.  It has hard boiled egg in it which was different but actually really good.  My boyfriend had the croissant french toast with fresh berries and it was sooooo good!  We will definitely be back.  We have small kids so it isn't always convenient to eat out so ordering out is the best option and this place was great, they included everything that we were going to need for our meal.

Lovely service and yummy food.  I ordered the egg white/turkey scramble with seasoned potatoes and coffee cake.  All were very tasty.  The coffee cake *may* be made from a mix....tasted like a mix cake, but I scarfed it down anyway.  Great place for a casual, fun breakfast/brunch/lunch!

I've lived on the same side of town as this restaurant for the past 4 years and this was the first time I have tried it.  Boy was I missing out because the food was amazing!  I had a hard time choosing, but I settled on the Tropical French toast, three large slices of texas toast, battered and fried, topped with toasted coconut, macadamia nuts and bananas and served with a side of syrup.  My husband got a Monte Cristo which is a turkey, ham and swiss sandwich dipped in french toast batter and deep fried.  He also got a side of seasoned potatoes.  The service was great too and we can't wait to go back.  Maybe we'll even bring the kids with us next time.
We like this place. Nice menu and good food. I got the sunrise special which was just right for a smaller meal.
Great food. Busy place. Omelettes are huge and we should have split 1.  Good night place for breakfast.

The best breakfast on this side of valley.  Friendly staff, clean tables excellent coffee.  Always crowded but that proves their greatness. My wife loves the coffee cake.  I have a passion for the corned beef. Bring your appetite and plan on taking some of it home. Very full plates.

At 1st look, I said, "Hmmnnnnn shall I dare?" Then I was greeted with an amazing waitress (Raven) and I asked for her recommendations for the Best Omelette.  She called out "Poncho!"    *FOGETABOUTIT!!!*  I'm a Fan.

Breakfast too start the day not really in my vocabulary. BUT breakfast after any brick day or workout day nothing better for recovery meal. At The Cracked Egg not only do they offer great breakfast options can order lunch at the same time. I have been too another one of their property on my side of town. Always had great experience from the food, service, and one of my favorite go too breakfast restaurants.   I ordered "The Enchilada" omelette. Instead of toast ALWAYS go for the coffee cake. The coffee cake no matter which one they offer (on this day think was cherry) not only is it fresh, steamy hot, moist, and nice BiG size piece. Awesome that you can substitute your toast for coffee cake! The seasoned potatoes so addicting really could go carb crazy have whole plate of it. I love the seasoning not sure what it is except perfect blend, just want too keep eating them, and perfect compliment with anything eggs or in my case omelette. The Enchilada lot of stuff going on inside the omelette. The enchilada sauce felt like that made all the ingredients come together in perfect harmony. Top off the omelette with the cheese. One of the better omelette ever had for breakfast. The portion size does not end with the coffee cake. Between the omelette and the generous amount of seasoned potato hearty and leave stuffed.   The restaurant is much bigger in size then the one that closer on my side of town. It had more open air feeling too it cause of the size. The interior has the same vibe as the other location. Truly most important is the food is consistent with other location. Great breakfast/lunch spot!!!!! Our server was awesome the whole time staying on top of everything from our drinks and making sure everything going well.   Not often in Henderson but no doubt if in the area need too get my breakfast fix in The Cracked Egg is the spot. I looked forward too the next visit!

The service was fine, the atmosphere was good.  I would not have even bothered to write a review, except the food made me sick.  Two hours after having a South Shore Scramble, it came back up.  Naturally, I'm pretty annoyed about it and wanted to share.  Hopefully this can be inspiration for TCE to evaluate it's food supply and prep.
Best breakfast joint in Summerlin! Reasonably priced and the menu is strong! Only downside, if there is one... place gets packed! But thats a GOOD sign, yeah?Ask for Victoria!

Okay, I am not a huge breakfast person, but I feel there are better options around. I know everyone likes this place so remember, this is just my preference.   Girlfriend and I went on a Sunday morning, waited less than 10 minutes for a table. Our waitress was not not great, she spent more time socializing with her friends/family in the booth near us.   We both ordered biscuits and gravy, cause we love it and we were really disappointment, the gravy had no flavor, part of my biscuit was cold.   I would not go back because of the other options in the area, but I never say never.

The food at this place was great! I took my family from out of town here for breakfast and they loved it. Really great food and not overly expensive. The bus boy was also incredibly nice and so attentive.  The only reason this place isn't getting 5 stars is because our server seemed bothered  every time we asked for something. When we asked for more ketchup she snatched it from us without saying anything and then came back and slammed it on the table. She was also clearly annoyed when we asked her to split the check 2 ways.  Great food, but the server could have been friendlier.

Traditional American breakfast place with decent prices. Definitely go for the side of potatoes instead of hash browns. Coffee cake is light and their coffee is good. Portions are huge. If you're in town, this is a safe bet and can accommodate large parties. With a party of 6 we only had to wait 5 minutes or so on a Saturday morning. Not too shabby.

I had the croissant French toast topped with fresh berries and bananas. That was really, really, good. It was so unique. My friend had the peanut butter stuffed French toast which wasn't so good. Too much peanut butter, it stuck to the roof of my mouth. The coffee was weak like they are trying to save money on coffee grounds. Don't waste your money on coffee here!         Their coffee cake that comes with some of their breakfast entrees left something to be desired. It tasted ok but was too dry. I liked the chocolate chips in them though but still too dry for me. Hey chef - add some sour cream to the batter. It would help with the texture!         My BF had the Joe's scramble with hash browns. The scramble was really good but the hash browns were ok.          All in all I thought this place was ok. The service was good and I would go back just to get the croissant French toast. It was sooooo good! It beats going to an IHOP any day.

Great restaurant, friendly people and FAST service.  I was surprised to find so many items on the menu.  Came here for a late breakfast and it was busy but didn't have to wait anymore than 5 minutes.  I would return again.

NOT much of breakfast eater but my cousin from Sac in town and decided too meet up with my brother and my nieces at their favorite breakfast joint. I have been too few times just never got around too reviewing it. One thing really like about The Cracked Egg location so close too the house plus if this one busy then go five min down the road too there free standing restaurant. (I never been). It kind of small place so depending when you go there chance wait. We all meet up on weekend and good thing went early because by 10am the place was insane and line out the door. Go early or late breakfast/lunch crowds not your thing.   The Coffee Cake the bomb. I went with chili cheese omelette. It was really good! It had right portion of chili and cheese. The seasoned potatoes without doubt MY FAVORITE things on the menu. Sure you seasoned potatoes at any breakfast joint but the thing stands out for me is the seasoning mix they put on them. I have no idea it is. All I know is potatoes are addicting could eat plate of potatoes be in complete bliss. I put some ketchup on them but really tasty eat them by themselves. They nice HOT. Crispy on the outside. I also had the sandwiches on the menu are solid and makes for great breakfast/lunch. One thing after spoiling myself with Red Velvet Pancakes at BabyStack wish they had some too. It one type of pancakes they don;t have but have other yummy options comes too pancakes. Everything on the menu is solid had few things on the menu and loved it!  The service had always been great! Even when its super busy the service always been great, staff if very friendly, and great way too start the day with meal at The Cracked Egg. =))

This place is great!  I have been there for both lunch and breakfast.  Food is larger portion and great.  As everyone has said, the coffee cake is to die for.  Service is good.  Never had a bad time here for meals or service.

Consistently very good. I wanted to try something different and this time I went for the pesto scramble. I normally get pancakes or French toast . Now I don't think ill ever order anything else. I personally can't eat eggs without tobacco and I was able to eat the pesto scramble plain.  Defiantly wanting to go back soon

I've made two trips here. First time with my husband, we came on a Saturday morning and sat outside. I got Tori's tortilla with turkey sausage subbed for the chorizo. I got the coffee cake which was good..I was expecting something denser but it was super light-textured. Another  yelper suspected a cake mix but I bake a lot and it seemed house-made legit. My husband got French toast and eggs...I had a bite of his French toast and it was good. My burrito was excellent...packed with veggies and scrambled eggs and cheese...I was super happy they have green Tabasco too.   Second visit was with my mom on a weekday morning. We were seated quickly and were soon drinking coffee. We both ordered a special - sweet potato skillet with cranberry sausage and eggs. We also got coffee cake. Like the first time it was super fluffy and had a good flavor but I'll just get toast next time and save some calories for eggs and cheese ;)  Skillets were good...I would have preferred more veggies and fewer sweet potatoes but I am a big veggie fan so take that Into account. I would have also liked something more acidic thrown into the mix so I ended up asking for my fave green tabasco again.   Service was good, nice variety and good quality of ingredients. Next time I plan to try lunch.  They offer coupons every month on their website but make sure you check that out before you go as they need to be printed.

I have lived in this neighborhood for about 20 years and have eaten here when it was Fast Eddies. I never really liked that restaurant, but I'm a breakfast guy and with the change, I wanted to try it. The service was good and they took my order very quickly. I love chorizo and eggs and I'm very particular about how they prepare the chorizo. This was the best chorizo I've had. It was crispy, not greasy and had the perfect amount of spice. Best I've had anywhere! Also to top it off, they had French vanilla creamer to go with my coffee. I'm very particular about that as well. I'm excited to try another dish on my next visit.

The coffee cake is awesome. I think it was pumpkin raisin bread. Not sure if that is their regular coffee cake or if its a seasonal cake. I went twice to the same location. The first time I tried their Southwest Scramble, menu said chorizo and jalapeo. Sounded pretty good at the time. It was ok, not what I expected...Not much chorizo and the jalapeos were the pickled kind, wasn't expecting pickled jalapeo with eggs, but it wasn't bad.....you get a nice portion of potatoes. The second time I went back I ordered your simple bacon and eggs, I was less impressed the second time around. My food was barely warm. The servings were a little skimpier this time, but the coffee cake was still the best part. I may go back, but probably won't be a regular spot.....still searching for that perfect breakfast place.

This place gets only 1star as well because of the waitress was nice. One of the hostess as we walked in was rude and did not even smile. I commented for her to smile, the more she gave me this dagger look. We were excited about this new place but with what happened, it will be a while for the next visit.

Just landed in Las Vegas at 6am, finally checked into our hotel room, and boy were we hungry!! So of course, we jumped on Yelp in search for a good breakfast place :)  Finally we founds The Cracked Egg on Yelp. I was super excited because breakfast is my favorite meal of the day!   The Grub. [[ CLASSIC EGGS BENEDICT $10.25 ]] http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-cracked-egg-las-vegas-2#_JzB5Wo5TQvPGwzEXxZZ4w This Benedict comes on a grilled English muffin, Canadian bacon and two poached eggs smothered in hollandaise sauce!  [[ COUNTRY BENEDICT $11.40 ]] http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-cracked-egg-las-vegas-2#k7ucRnegPlLeKZ6F1iDl3g The Benedict comes on a biscuit split and topped with patty sausage, two poached eggs and smothered in gravy! [[ HAM & CHEESE OMELET $9.35 ]] http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-cracked-egg-las-vegas-2#V_EOo-gE_LcPEzn-Y4Rbbw This omelet is simple and delish!   Overall, I would definitely recommend this place to others.

I love breakfast.  I particularly love breakfast when someone else makes it for me - enter diner breakfasts!  We've been going to this location of the Cracked Egg sporadically for nearly 10 years now.  I started off always having their solid eggs and turkey sausage plate, but now that my diet is more plant strong these days, this time I opted for the Veggie Skillet - and I'm sooooo glad I did!  Fresh broccoli, mushrooms and spinach sauteed and served over the Cracked Egg's signature seasoned potatoes - topped with two eggs over easy. I requested no cheese - and didn't miss it at all.  So fresh and so good!    One thing I was happy to see was that the wait was much shorter than I remember for a Sunday - about 10 minutes. I have a feeling that's due to more breakfast options opening in the area.   We tried to go to Babycakes but they had an hour and fifteen minute wait!  Bad for fans of Babycakes, good for fans of the Cracked Egg!
Consistently we have had excellent service and the food is delicious. It's my family's favorite breakfast and brunch restaurant.
Good food. Service a little slow but not a big deal. They are at least nice. I come for the food.

This place is a perfect mixed of down home and modern west. The breakfast options were your classics with some staff originals. I love there scrambles. The portions are smaller than most breakfast places and their prices a little higher but over all I had a great experience and differently recommend this spot.

I mean, REALLY, the coffee cake is enough to get my mouth watering.   I had breakfast here AGAIN this morning with my friend and once again, I was thoroughly impressed.   Today's coffee cake: apple. The waitress said it was cherry, but it was apple. And it was AMAZING. Warm, soft, melt-in-your-mouth goodness. I can't get enough. I would come here for the coffee cake alone.   I'm a simple breakfast eater: I eat eggs over easy with toast, hash browns, turkey sausage, and a side of avocado. That's it.   My friend ordered the sweet potato skillet - not something I would usually order. But, I snuck a bite from her plate and OHMYGOODNESS: FLAVOR EXPLOSION. Sweet potatoes with onions and apples and muenster cheese and bacon and eggs? All of the things you'd never expect in a skillet, but when combined to make the perfect bite, produce the most epic of flavors.   I will return. As usual. For more coffee cake. And to order the sweet potato skillet.

Hadn't been in a long time, but nothing has changed. The food and service were still very good. I like the atmosphere, location and many breakfast choices. I personally like the eggs Benedict as well as the oatmeal overload.

My wife and I came here for a quick breakfast before heading to Hoover Dam. We had the following:  The Veggie Skillet with Corned Beef $10.90  The Sweet Potato Skillet $10.50  Coconut and macadamia nut pancakes $8.95  My veggie skillet was pretty good. I loved the mix of broccoli, mushrooms, spinach and tomatoes with the fried potatoes (and meat of course). My wife gave her skillet 6/10 bc she said her potatoes were not so crispy. I wouldn't recommend the pancakes as the coconut is not fresh coconut but coconut from a prepackaged bag. That kind of coconut is too sweet and with added syrup made the dish too sweet for my tastebuds. The one good aspect here is that the skillets came with their signature coffee cake (or toast if u prefer). Their coffee cake was pretty good. The texture was so light and soft and way better than Starbucks. After 4 or 5 bites however, it does becomes a little too sweet so I suggest sharing one with another person.
One of my favorite breakfast spots in all of Las Vegas! Every item I have tried has been fantastic. Definitely would recommend going here.

I love nearly everything about this place! I always make sure to get the coffee cake and I have enjoyed all of the different kinds they come up with, although the fruit ones have been the best by far! Everything I have tried has been good and my parents love to come here when they visit from out of state. My only complaint is one staff member that has continually hit on me when visiting. It doesn't matter where I sit, that I completely ignore him, that I am in the middle of taking a bite of food... the awkward conversation is forced on me even after claiming a boyfriend and not interested. Management should be clear on things like this happening with employees while they are working.
Just ok. Overpriced, slow service and questionable portions.

The coffee cake is delicious, no doubt. Yesterday morning I had the carnitas omelet. Very bland and very light on the 'carnitas' part. Not my favorite meal here. Will not be back anytime soon. Can definitely find better and similarly-priced (if not cheaper) breakfast eats in town.

We had to take my car into the shop early on Saturday morning so we considered grabbing some breakfast in the area as well.  After checking my Yelp! bookmarks - I was happy to be reminded of the newer Centennial location of the Cracked Egg as we'd been going to the original Cheyenne location on and off for about 8 years now.  This location is a lot less crowded with a shorter wait time and a much larger seating area - all decorated in a traditional country-kitsch motif.  I liked the fact that they have enough room to set the tables further apart here, it makes the space feels much more open and airy.  I'm a big fan of the Cracked Egg's Veggie Benny and it was equally as great here.  Two English muffins topped with spinach, poached eggs and hollandaise please - diet be damned!  I prefer my breakfast with hash browns rather than fried potatoes and they do a good job here - taking the time to let the outside get all nice and crispy while the inside remains soft and buttery (if there's one thing that makes me sad, it's undercooked hash browns).  The service was friendly, welcoming and efficient.  I'd definitely come back to this location again, even if it is a little farther from my house - just for the shorter wait.

Always a stellar time! The 'Cheers' of the breakfasts joints, the awesome service is only outdone by the delicious menu. On the menu today: -Joes scramble with hash brows  - Big Bad Wolf with hash browns  Both entrees come with a side of the most delicious warm and moist coffee cake of my life!!   Select main entrees have a choice of toast or coffee cake, always choose coffee cake. Lol :)   With indoor and outdoor seating available the resteraunt is always clean, the service is always incredible and the food is always worth the trip!

Why is food in Summerlin so terrible! Well, it's not terrible, it's just the same crap other restaurants are serving. For example, there is another breakfast place I can't remember the name of (i think Egg was also in the title) that uses the same potatoes as this place, meaning they all get it from the same vendor. The waitress was really pushing us on these crappy, frozen potatoes that looked like they came from Vons. The meals are big portions and ready to give you a heart attack. I just wish the food here wasn't so bland and unoriginal. I like diner food, but jeez, don't serve me the same stuff as every other schlup in Vegas.
Tried this place for breakfast today and it was great! Our waiter was friendly which we appreciated as good service is hard to come by these days! We will definitely be back when we are in town!

Delicious breakfast spot! We were in town for a soccer tournament and dropped by here for a late breakfast. 15 minute wait at 10:30 on. Friday morning was a good sign. Great service. Great food. One star off for the pancakes being a little too chewy instead of fluffy and melty like I think they should be. But 5 stars for the Sweet Potato skillet. Like the best version of breakfast raclette.

This is my second time at the Cracked Egg (Henderson Location) and the first time all I could remember was the fact that the food was delicious; hence my desire to make a return trip.  Walking in to the restaurant with my mom we were greeted by the cashier and told the wait would be 5 minutes; no problem. When my name was shouted (as if there was a fire mind you), the "hostess" snatched the silverware and menus and raced off to the table.  She did not so much as look back to see if we were following her, nor did she even say anything to us as we were seating ourselves. Why? Oh yeah, that's because she was already back at the hostess stand before we even pulled our own chairs out.  This atrocious moment in customer service left an extremely sour taste in my mouth prior to even being helped by our server; who's service was also sub par.  Thankfully the food was the only redeeming quality and the friendly cashier guy.   I thoroughly enjoy the eats at the Cracked egg however we will not be returning to this location again.

OK I like the place too.  But let's not go crazy.    The eggs are fresh, but they also seem to shy away from actually seasoning anything.  My egg sandwich (i forget their cute name for it) was good.  Bigger than it needed to be and served on a croissant.  They really should grill that croissant a little so it doesn't get so soggy.  The seasoned potatoes are good, but could be hotter in my opinion.  The biggest problem with this place is the service.  After waiting for your table you are greeted by a server who seems entirely overburdened.  There is certainly no passion and for me that kind of ruins things for me.  After I wait 30 minutes for a table, I am excited to sit down and eat.  Having the serve kill that excitement is just disappointing.  Also, this is not the cleanest place I have eaten.  the booths are dirty and the place seems a little dingy.  The toilet was broken... but no one from the restaurant knew... nor when I told them.. did anyone care.  That's sort of how I feel.  I don't really care about this place and I think my days of waiting for a table here have come to an end.

This place doesn't know the meaning "first come, first serve." My boyfriend and I waited for about 35 mins for our order to be taken. Three to four tables were already sat after us. Two of them got their order taken before us then another customer came in and sat down at the counter. We were patiently waiting until someone could notice us waiting at our table. After maybe 10 mins, I noticed the customer sitting at the counter already had her meal in front of her while four tables including us never got our meal yet. I've worked in a restaurant before, I know how everything works. No matter how small a meal is it doesn't come out until the first table that orders gets their meal first. The waitress even tried giving us an excuse on the customers meal that came out before any of ours. Overall the situation just made the experience at his location pretty bad.

Huuge fan of the Cracked Egg!  I've gone on weekend and weekday mornings.  Weekday mornings aren't too bad, but weekend days can have quite the wait sometimes (30-40 mins).  I either get the California omelette or the mexican skillet, depending on my mood.  Both are just too delicious.  I love their seasonsed potatoes!  Their portions are more than enough for me, unless I'm absolutely starving.  This is so much better than your Dennys and IHOPs.  Fresh and a wide variety of food, and the prices aren't bad at all.  The toast always has plenty of butter, and their coffee cake is yummy as well.  I've been here more than I count, and it never gets old.

Stopped by here because on a rare occasion, I felt like having breakfast.  The service was pretty slow though, the food was really good though, a little better than the ordinary.  Had the eggs benedict, good hollandaise sauce and the eggs were perfectly poached.

Its always superr busy when we go have breakfast here, so just be prepared to wait a little. The coffee wasnt all that great. I really like their potatoes here. The seasoning on them is delicious. The pancakes were really good just also really expensive. For two people our bill was $36 bucks.

This is THE spot for breakfast in Vegas and I am a frequent flyer- you'll typically catch me here on a Saturday/Sunday once a week chowing down on a country benny.  I don't need a menu!  Seriously, you've gotta order their country benny.  The yolks are perfect and creamy (I'm salivating thinking of it now- it's almost pornographic!) thanks to a perfect cook every time!  The gravy has just the right amount of sausage, plus no paprika or green chiles or any other weird additions that you'll find in other breakfast joints.  The biscuits are always fluffy (once I had rock hard biscuits and they replaced them immediately) and I just love the rich combination of yolk, gravy, biscuit, and sausage.  I wish they were open 24/7, but I'm saving more money by only going in the mornings.  The coffee cake is fresh baked and always delicious.  I've never tried any of the cream cheese types, though (no thanks).  I've sampled some other things on the menu, but only when my boyfriend orders because I just cannot part from my one true love, the country benny.  I love you, Cracked Egg.  It's an unhealthy obsession, but the tongue and stomach wants what it wants.

My teacher friend said she LOVES The Cracked Egg, so I stopped in last weekend.  All of the reviews on yelp say you should try the coffee cake... I say you should skip it!  It's more plain cake than it is the topping (aka, the part we all love).  Also, know that you cannot request a flavor.  I ordered the Country Benny and it was savory and satisfying.  The sausage gravy had great texture (not too thick/not too runny) and flavor, which is difficult to find on this side of the country!  The biscuits were soft and the egg was cooked perfectly.  I wasn't impressed by the seasoned potatoes, but after eating the main entree, I didn't have much room for them, anyway.  My companion ordered the Mexican skillet and seemed to enjoy it- I didn't try it, so I can't comment.  I would visit again, but I definitely think I'll skip the coffee cake next time!

We've come here many times and I get the same thing every time, what I specifically come here for...the cordon bleu skillet. It's amazing! They took it off the menu, but if you're going in looking for it and mention it to your server, you can still order it. My boyfriend has tried other meals and he's never had anything bad to say about any of them. If you are getting a meal that lets you choose between I think toast or the coffee cake, definitely choose the cake. It's delicious!! You won't be disappointed. It is sweet though so be prepared for that. They have different flavors throughout the year and they've all been really good. It does get really busy, especially on the weekends so make sure you plan ahead to wait a bit. On a positive note tho, even when the place was packed, after ordered, we got our food super fast.

Loved this place! Just a few minutes off the strip and it was worth the drive. The service was good, much more relaxed yet still friendly which I appreciated. The service was super quick and the food was delicious! I loved the country benny, definitely a must order.

So yummy! We came because Mr. Mama had a 45 min wait and it was only a 15 min wait here... Long enough for us to look at the menu and make our selection.   Our server, Liz, was so friendly and if we had won at the casino we would've tipped more, but we gave her a 30% tip.   French toast was ok, but the coffee cake was sooooo yummy!   California omlet had a half avocado, which was more than I expected. Perfectly ripe and wish I had taken a pic!  Season potatoes were perfect, no ketchup necessary.   We plan in returning every time we come to Vegas and tell everyone we know!

Loooove The Cracked Egg!  My go-to breakfast place EVERY time.  You get coffee cake or toast with your breakfast dish... the coffee cake is usually phenomenal!  It's just dependent upon my mood.  They've had the same people working there for a while now and now that I think of it... I don't believe I've EVER had a bad experience with my service.  Whether that be waiting on refills, waiting on food, the way I was treated.  I know most people love hash browns... but TRY the seasoned potatoes!  They are amazing!  Sooo good, the seasoning is to die for... a great addition to any dish.  I've tried skillets, omelettes, scrambles, sandwiches.... and have never been disappointed.  The only time I didn't absolutely looove something was when it wasn't something that I normally wouldn't go for anyway.  All in all, it's definitely worth checking out if you have never been here.

As much as it pains me to admit it, I was wrong. I was going through life thinking that the best eggs benedict in town could be found at the Peppermill. Oh how wrong I was!  Given that it's right down the street, Boyfriend and I decided to give The Cracked Egg a shot. Our 5 minute wait to be seated was great for 10:30 on a Saturday morning. Once seated, our drink order was taken almost immediately; actual drinks followed shortly. We ordered about 5 minutes after being seated. Twenty minutes later, food arrived! I had the traditional benedict. Boyfriend had the country benedict. I was floored by how delicious my food was. The eggs were wonderfully runny, the hollandaise was excellent and the Canadian bacon was smokey with no gristly bits. My side of hashbrowns was very tasty. Always a plus when there's enough egg yolk and hollandaise to dredge hashbrowns in!   Service was quick and friendly. Food is seriously good, if slightly on the pricey side ($32, including tip, for two people). This probably won't be a weekly spot, but we'll definitely be back!

Perfect place to come for an awesome breakfast!! It's off the strip and had a warm feel. The staff is friendly and accommodating. Get the Coffee Cake!! It is a must have...You're welcome! I would definitely come back when I return to Vegas. Enjoy

Was on vacation from Chicago looking for a place to eat while we were driving around exploring found the cracked egg very impressed food fresh and good when we return to Las Vegas will definitely go there again for breakfast. Server recommended a couple dishes she was spot on on everything she recommended

My husband and I LOVE this place! We have been coming since they opened. We used to travel to the Rainbow location until they opened this one up near where we live. The food is delicious! They have the best eggs benedict in town and I have tried almost everything in the breakfast menu and everything is great! The atmosphere is great and they have a great staff! Love the service!

My husband and I LOVE this place! We have been coming since they opened. We used to travel to the Rainbow location until they opened the one up near where we live in north las vegas. The food is delicious! They have the best eggs benedict in town and I have tried almost everything in the breakfast menu and everything is great! The atmosphere is great and they have a great staff! Love the service!

This is definitely a new favorite breakfast spot. My wife's favorite breakfast is eggs benedict, so unsurprisingly she ordered the California Eggs Benedict. The poached eggs were served on top of an English muffin with fresh avocado on the side and hollandaise to top the eggs off. The house fries were their version of hash browns.   I had a little more trouble deciding, as I usually try to taste new things. After much deliberation I decided on the El Patron Skillet. This cosists of a bed of country potatoes, cheese, chorizo, pickled jalapenos, and eggs done your way (I ordered mine scrambled). Salsa and sour cream are served on the side. You also get a choice of tortilla, toast, English muffin, or biscuit. I decided on the biscuit, which was huge!  My wife was pleasantly happy with her breakfast. Not many places do eggs Benedict to her liking, though she is not too picky. As for me, everything was delicious! The biscuit was not as fluffy as I hoped but nonetheless it was good.   The service was awesome. From the minute we went into the establishment, which resembles an old diner, everyone smiled and welcomed us without making it awkward. We felt their friendliness and overall attitude was genuine. We will definitely be coming back to this place. Thanks for the great food and service.
Very fast, fresh and awesome food. I ordered Toris Burrito and loved every bite! I highly recommend this place! The next time Im going to order the crosiant!

Maybe I'm a serial optimist.  Maybe I have to go in to an eatery with a more neutral mind.  I had pretty high expectations for a place that has the word egg in their restaurant name.  I imagined pretty big egg portions for the price.  Alas, it was not.  I had the Northshore scrambler, lots of filler stuff mixed in the egg and it tasted good but if only it were, say, a little bit bigger...maybe by another inch?.  With the Northshore you have a choice of hash browns for diced potatoes.  For some reason, my potatoes arrived cold.  Well, maybe that's overstated.  But, it wasn't hot like my eggs.  Perhaps it's cooked in bulk and left i an aluminum tray.  I also tried the Croissant French Toast with berries.  I'm expecting something way better than IHOP.  The bread was hard upon arrival and it was also cold.  About half the blueberries where sour and half the strawberries were as well. I'm thankful they give you lots of syrup to drown it out.  The highlight of the meal is the nice warm coffee cake that several reviewers state is awesome.  Yes, it is.  I wanted another slice.   The staff are prompt and courteous and checked on us frequently. I like that since it started to get busy as soon as we arrived and server attentiveness usually goes down as the number of customers increase.  We tend to bring a crowd soon after we  arrive, not cause we're famous or even know these people who follow us.  We just seem to be one of Murphy's Laws.  Whether we are at a drive thru at Jack In The Box or in line at the M casino buffett....geez.  Will I go back again? Yes, but it won't be my first choice on my mind.
Coffee cake is amazing. Hash browns were great. Do not have Mexican food here if you know what real Mexican food tastes like. Waffles are the thing here. Coffee is great. Good service.

The wait was only 20 minutes for a Sunday morning, which was better than I expected. The food was delicious with lots of vegetarian options. The service was fast and friendly and my coffee cup was never left empty! I'll definitely be back soon.

First time.  Very nice place.  Got in pretty fast on a Saturday morning.  Got busy shortly after.  Reminded me of an old 70's Bob's Big Boy.    There is a back built-on area, booths and tables with TV's on walls.  Kid Friendly.   Menu is HUGE.  I don't mean as in items, I mean HUGE.... like a foot and a half long. Food was tasty!  Unfortunately, I was super dehydrated from a kick-butt concert the night before and wasn't able to eat much.  I will have to go back when I'm in town again, just to sit at the counter!  ;)  We had an awesome, fun & friendly server.  Easy Parking.

My boyfriend and I came here because it was a nice stroll down from my house - the neighborhood feel was great - and it was sure busy!  We got seated immediately at a two top, although the weather was lovely enough to sit outside. The menu averages as a basic breakfast and lunch place with a traditional coffee cake offered as a side.   My boyfriend ordered a classic eggs & bacon which is served with toast and potatoes and I was split between the Ole Benedict and chili skillet, choosing the latter. The food came out quick and hot within 5 minutes!   Our waitress was decent if you include the business of the restaurant. Helpful and gave us attention when needed. Overall the food was great, enough cheese to satisfy the best fanatics. But nothing over the top in quality to make me a regular.  It's nice that it's close in the neighborhood as walking distance but I'll probably go back in a few months if I get a craving. 3/5

My favorite breakfast joint. Beginning with the unpretentious decor, the Cracked Egg delivers a modern throwback to a time when having breakfast was a community event. Please wait to be seated, gives you the opportunity to take everything in and reflect back to a simpliar era.  Clean and comfortable booths with tables for larger crowds. I found myself still wanting to sit at the counter stools like I did as a child in a drug store soda fountain.  I saved the best for last. The food is by far the best diner food for the price. Enjoy

I am a breakfast guy and this is my kind of place. It is a one off restaurant that opens at 6 AM and serves GOOD food!   I like to find a place that has corned beef hash that is home made. None of that stuff from a can. Most places will tell me when I ask if it is home made. Well at this place it is the real deal. I will put this place on the go to breakfast place when we are visiting friends in Las Vegas!

Great  breakfast spot... I had a slight issue with my breakfast and the staff where friendly and fixed the issue immediately. They even brought the chef out so he could see.   Absolutely great customer service food was great and all staff where extremely friendly and professional... I will definitely return and recommend this to my friends.

1- kudos for not making it weird that I am a female eating breakfast alone. So many places are so confused when you do this.   2- Coffee was hot. Not tepid, warm, hot. Delicious and hot  3- I got chicken fried steak because, well, I'm on a kick. Hopefully, I break it soon because it's not the best breakfast on the health list, but man, it's sooo good.   4- Price was reasonable, speed was good, and food was delicious.   They have a good menu to choose from with some different items. Normally I try more stuff, but when I get on a kick, nothing can stop me :D It is worth coming in for a nice good breakfast. Friendly staff and I will be back for some other menu items.

This place is fantastic. The service was friendly and prompt. The food options were plenty. The coffee was great and the waitress was not shy about refills. I got the Bubba Gump omelet and my hubby got the volcano. Bring your appetite! He's a big guy and couldn't finish the meal. I voluntarily participated in gluttony because I hate that hollandaise sauce separates when it is reheated. We have been in town a few days and have been striking out on my yelping. This was a win for our late breakfast. I guess if I'm going to get picky I should explain why not 5 stars. My second round of coffee wasnt hot so it kinda killed my coffee momentum and my pancakes were a needing a bit more syrup and were slightly tough around the corners. However... That's just me being picky. We will eat here again the next time we are in town!

3.5 Stars!  The Cracked Egg is a quality breakfast spot!  The specialty is their homemade Coffee Cake that rotates through a variety of flavors.  Most are great!  The owners are also incredibly nice, and truly put the customer first.  With several enjoyable entree options, the Cracked Egg is a place I will gladly go for breakfast.  I usually end up with the Benedict Ole, Southwest Scramble, or Cracked Croissant.  This is a great spot Monday - Friday...but can be crowded on the weekends for obvious reasons.

Been to this location many times (and the S. Rainbow as well). Attentive and friendly service. If with a regular customer, the waitstaff pretty much already knows what they want. Food arrives in a timely manner.  Overall, everything I've ordered has been tasty. Large portions. The spicier dishes (eg. anything with chorizo and or green chile) are too mild for my tastes, but like that there is the option to have something with some non-Anglo flair. The coffee cake I had as my "toast" option on this past visit was a bit of a disappointment: taste and consistency of something that came out of a Betty Crocker box.  Nice breakfast place. And if you go on a regular basis, don't forget to sign-up for their loyalty program to get discounts on future meals.
Awesome breakfasts.  We go to the Centennial Las Vegas restaurant often.  I particularly like the Torie Tortilla!

I went to The Cracked Egg with my wife and father in law for breakfast and had a fantastic meal.  While I'm not a big fan of coffee cake it was by far the best I've ever had.  The real surprise for me though was the potatoe skillet.  The potatoes were browned perfectly with bacon and scallions mixed in.  The service was very quick and the restaurant was surprisingly clean during the busy breakfast hour.

I've lived next to this place for 15 years & never thought to go inside until a friend invited me. To my surprise, it was a cute setting with motivational quotes on the wall & such friendly staff. Inside was clean & quiet. The food tasted great! I got the California omelette & a cup of coffee (not diluted w/ too much water). I recommend this place if you want a good & quiet breakfast!

Love this restaurant! Portions are huge! GLUTEN FREE HEAVEN! They have a great gf menu and I have been a couple times and never gotten sick! (Still be careful of course!) Everything is delicious they're gf muffins are to die for!
Excellent breakfast, excellent service, huge menu, senior menu, excellent coffee sold by the bag if you want, all my favorite sauces at the table, bright, clean, I loved it

I don't care who you are, but you can't deny breakfast at random times of the day if it's offered to you. That's where The Cracked Egg is a blessing in disguise.   Your average diner atmosphere, choose among their filling and stuffed omelettes, salads, sandwiches and other breakfast options. (Tip: the pesto omelette is a pretty tasty and healthy post-breakfast dish that tastes less like brunch and is even more perfect for lunch.)   Did I mention their salads are huge? Yes, huge. So huge, in fact, that you may not want to finish it in one sitting unless you plan on unbuttoning somewhere or another.   As far as pricing goes, you'll dine on an affordable diner budget. Pay at the counter when you're through, and be thankful you could escape and pretend you're having a Sunday morning brunch instead of a weekday back-to-the-office lunch. Hey, it's what I did.
The most amazing breakfast EVER!  Comfortable, open-spaced cafe/diner atmosphere. Peanut butter french toast- enough said :)

My absolute favorite breakfast place in all of Las Vegas.  I am so glad they have multiple locations now!  I've been eating here during my Vegas visits for quite a few years now.  I've never once had even a mediocre breakfast here- it's always fabulous!  Fast, comfortable seating, cheap but doesn't taste like it!  Apple filled french past us the bomb! They also have great turkey sausage, ripe avocado and sourdough toast for healthy add ons.    Kid friendly; no problems getting a clean high chair here and plenty of other kids in the restaurant...but still quiet enough for a serious chat if need be.  Lively but not crazy loud atmosphere.  Plenty of parking.

After reading all of the yelp reviews I was excited!  Location- It's located right off of the 215 and green valley in the smith's strip mall building. Lots of parking and easy to find.  Ambience- It's clean and simply decorated. Very open with booths and a small counter area to eat at.  Service- Considering we were the only table here I did expect more. Our server was friendly enough and provided efficient service. Can't complain.  Food- We ordered the Monte Cristo w/ hash browns, The Carnitas omelet w/potatoes and blueberry coffee cake, and chocolate pancakes w/ side of bacon. We all shared the coffee cake. It was moist and fresh but we all agreed that the blueberries did not compliment the coffee cake. My son enjoyed his Monte Cristo but said he wouldn't eat it again. My omelet was dry, flat, and tasteless. I did expect so much more. Maybe my food choices wasn't the best, but it was recommended by the server.   3 stars for being clean, decent service, having a great coffee cake recipe (subtract the blueberries), being reasonably priced, and having a good selection of items on the menu. It's not a bad place, it just wasn't for me.

Not sure where I should begin with this review, the 4 stars are a bit of a stretch. The service was very good and we were seated quickly. My eggs were cold, has browns were barley done and the pancakes were okay. The area were we were seated, the waitresses make toast/english muffins, thats's very different. This would NOT be my first choice for breakfast, lesson learned.

This is our #1, go to breakfast place! The food is always amazing, the wait is not usually too long, and the staff is absolutely incredible! I have never found a thing to complain about and we enjoy our visit every single time! They are timely, efficient, and well above average. We absolutely love our neighborhood breakfast place and will even stop by on occasion for lunch too! Thanks for being amazing, Cracked Egg!

I work on S Rainbow near another "Egg" restaurant and had breakfast there every day I worked. I found The Cracked Egg with the help of Yelp. I went to try it even though it wasn't as convenient.  This place is awesome, first time was great but waited to try again. Service is great, friendly staff and food (both things I've tried) is tasty, well prepared and so many things to choose from. It's to the point that I'm looking forward to work because it starts with breakfast at The Cracked Egg. Food: Carnitas omelette.. A      Corned beef skillet.. A      Can't wait for my next item.. Oh, do yourself a favor and get the coffee cake.. Decedent..

Good homestyle breakfast. You can tell by foot traffic it's a local favorite.  Diverse amount of items to order for all tastes.  Portions are on the large side,  so guaranteed to leave satisfied.  Scrambles, Omelettes, skillets and benedicts just to name a few.

I know a lot of people don't care about the ice in their drink, but having worked in a hospital where black specks in ice mean the ice machine needs cleaning I look at the ice here & it is absolutely crystal clear! Not only does clean ice taste better in your drink, it makes it colder. My husband will not take lemon in his tea because most people don't wash theirs, but here not only are lemons washed, so are the bananas etc. They use tongs when buttering the toast too! So many restaurants have kitchens that after seeing them you wouldn't want to eat there, but we enjoy sitting at the counter occasionally just to watch the smooth operations of a well kept, organized kitchen! Armando is the manager & will correct any problem you may have, if any! We eat here at least 2-3 times a week & thoroughly enjoy all the staff along with the delicious food. And don't forget to ask what the latest flavor of coffee cake is being served at the moment... delicious no matter what flavor!
Nothing like getting treated nicely. It's got a nice family warmth to it. Great food and great customer service! Come try this place out!

This is no tourist joint as it's way off the strip. What's great about this place is it has a buy 1 get 1 free coupon up to 10 dollars in value from the Las vVgas coupon book. Coffee is 2 dollars and 15 cents a cup. I had Luisa's scramble...3 eggs with sausage, peppers, onions, fresh shrooms, and melted Muenster cheese on top. Came with home fries which were like Ore-Ida, which I didn't care for that much. Also comes with choice of toast or cofee cake.   The scramble was big and tasty...I would get it again, but would try the hash browns instead of the potatoes/home fries. A bit pricey without the coupon at 9 dollars and 95 cents. This place is clean and the service was fine.   Pretty funny sign in the bathroom... see my picture. Overall a pretty decent experience but definitely kind of pricey without for a basic diner kinda place. They open at 6 amI and  you can sit wherever you want. They have tables, booths and a bar top.
Great breakfast spot. Some of the menu reminds me of small town country cafs from Texas. I love the Country Benny. A great twist on poached eggs and biscuits and gravy.

You like eggs? Do you crave everything egg?  Then why haven't you been to the cracked egg!?  The staff is friendly and helpful, the food is delicious, and the wait to be seating is like waiting for Christmas morning.   We had the coffee cake (which was a seasonal pumpkin cake), huevos rancheros, and the build your own skillet. I slurped up the huevos rancheros like it was the first meal I had in weeks. My wife enjoyed her skillet with the demeanor of royalty.  I'm sure it was quite a site for those around us.   Any way, great place with great food and great people.  Can't go wrong.
Been coming here with family for years. Food is always delicious. But almost $4 for a small glass of OJ. I could have gotten a whole gallon for that price. Kinda crazy
Only downside is it's always busy. We had to wait 20 minutes on a Saturday morning. Food is good, and service is great. We had Lisa and she checked in on us numerous times. Will be returning!

Worst omelette ..got California omelette..menu said fluffy omelets but mine was flat and only had bacon in half of omelette. Over priced for what I received. Waitress was nice but she never came back to see how my breakfast was

Service is always amazing but today was extra special.. We slept in and woke up starving we didn't realize that it was almost 2pm (closing) we didn't even make it to the restaurant door when we decided to go back to the truck.. The manager on duty (light blue shirt didn't catch her name) ran out and grabbed us and invited us in! Food was amazing!! Chocolate chip banana coffee cake was great today!! Thanks to the whole staff! :)
fresh coffee cake with your breakfast!  fast service very friendly good prices you really can't go wrong. love it here.

Great service (our server was Liz). Great prices. Food was very good too. Definitely recommend getting the coffee cake over the toast with your breakfast meal. Had the big bad wolf omelet and it was good. The seasoned potatoes were great too. French toast was cool, but I've has better. But overall this place is great. Would definitely recommend it.

Great place to grab a hearty meal.  Like many reviewers added, this place is far enough off of the strip that you feel a little more relaxed while eating with the locals.  The menu is plentiful and there are many choices for all types of eaters.  The prices are also fair and the wait service is also super friendly.  We went around 11am on the Sunday of Memorial Day weekend and had no problem being seated right away (party of 3).  If I had one complaint it would be about the coffee cake that everyone else raved about.  I wish that they had a variety to choose from per day vs. having a special cake each day.  When we went they had the cherry cream coffee cake and it was just okay.  It had a nice flavor but it was a bit undercooked which gave it a sticky feeling against the tongue.  The food and atmosphere were good enough so we'll definitely head back the next time we are in LV.

Yummy! This was a delicious! I had the veggie omelette and my husband had the poncho omelette, which is chorizo with pico, sour cream, and avocado. They were both very tasty! I ordered the home fries, he ordered the other potato. I liked the home fries best. Our waitress, Penny, had a great personality! She was warm and engaging. I am a huge fan of pancakes, these were fluffy and tasted almost nutty. I liked, but didn't love, them they tasted almost manufactured in a way, and looked too perfect. As if they had mean made by a machine and shipped in. I also didn't love the taste of the coffee, but I'm kind of a coffee snob. Overall it was a great experience the omelette and customer service was excellent, and I will be back!
Rainy days = no lines! What a delicious way to spend my Sunday. The good was excellent and the service was amazing.  So many smiles as soon as you walk in the door. The enchilada omelet was great!!!

Service was good, food was  average, will be hard to go back.  It's a typical old Fashion diner where the servers make the toast.   Our server coughed into her hand and immediately went over to make some toast without washing her hands          I witnessed no servers ever washing her hands while making toast.  We opted for the pancakes instead.    Owners need to come into the future and have cooks and servers wear gloves or wash hands to protect the health of the customers or quit touching the food.

I have eaten here many times and I have never been disappointed.  The only thing I have been disappointed in was the coffe cake. Although it is always warm, sometimes it seems like a lot of cake without moisture. However, today it had glazed fruit on the bottom that made it perfect.   I ordered The Greek omelet. It was a three egg omelet with spinach, tomatoes and Feta cheese. The edge of the eggs were a bit crisp but the ratio of vegetables to Feta cheese was perfect. The portion size was appropriate for the size and sent me home with leftovers.   I am not a fan of the seasoned potatoes as they are a bit bland and salty. I had hash browns instead. They seemed a bit under cooked.   Overall, you will have a positive dining experience. They even have a gluten free muffin now.

Crowded on weekend mornings, go expecting a wait outside. If you order eggs get no yokes, or whites or beaters because the real eggs are often iffy and will ruin your stomach for the day (not the freshest eggs).  On the plus side, the service is friendly and the hash browns are darn good.
This is our first time here, we will FOR SURE be back! The food is AWESOME,  atmosphere is very nice, clean and roomy seating.

Keeping this short. I am a fan of their scrambles and monte cristo. The food quality is better than babystacks. The service is solid as well. Even when they're incredibly busy, the food comes out in a timely fashion.
So good! I loved the eggs benny and the potatoes were seasoned perfectly. Service was great as well and I loved the coffee cake. Will definitely be back!

We love the staff here! We've been coming just about every Saturday and they always remember us/our names/our orders! Carol is so sweet to greet us when we walk in and when we leave: not just a general "hello/good morning" but something genuine.  The FOOD - you MUST get the seasoned potatoes! I've personally tried a variety of omelettes and all the other types of breakfast dishes and I've yet to have anything I didn't like. Ethan likes the "Jayden" off the kids menu, but he subs our the ham for bacon and no cheese. The kitchen staff always gets it just right and never makes us feel badly for customizing an order (thank goodness, bc kids are difficult at times!) haha.  This place is always busy, so don't be surprised! They seat you pretty quickly, so don't worry!

My waitress Diane was amazing! She was quick to come take my order but didn't seem to bother when I asked for more time. She checked on myself and my 10-month-old often and had an amazing attitude. Just totally nice and pleasant! The food is good, but the customer service is the reason I keep coming back to this location!

Cracked Egg gets my vote for the most underrated breakfast on the NW side of Vegas. While there is a 30 min wait across the street at Babystacks, we are welcomed on a Sunday morning with the option of dining indoors or out!  The coffee is strong, the service is great, and the food comes out pretty quickly and hot!  I love that there are not so classis breakfast options with peppers and chilies. A huge variety of omelets, and of course some basic eggs and bacon as well.  On my most recent visit, I went with the special on the board which was a fried French toast with berries. Literally, the BEST French toast I ever had! I devoured all 4 thick sliced and was STUFFED!  My daughter got one of the specialty French toasts on the menus, and hers came with 6 slices. Not sure what the difference was, maybe because mine was the special. Either way I am not complaining at all, both were excellent!  I feel like the staff has all been here for a while, and they got it down well! I also love that some of the dishes are names based on the surrounding neighborhoods. (North shore/South shore etc)  The dcor, reminds me of someone's grandmothers kitchen. I love the sign that says, "We have no Wifi, pretend it's 1995 and talk to each other".  Delicious, home-style cooking in a neighborhood setting, perfect for everyone!

Place was ok, I ordered North Shore Scramble and my boyfriend ordered South Shore Scramble. Just standard food, nothing surprising.   Our waitress was very nice and offered my boyfriend a sub. when he asked for no avocado, that never happens.   I personally do not like fruit in my coffee cake and wish the waitress told me there is Apple in it before I ordered it.   If you're looking for a good breakfast joint, go to Egg Works/Egg & I
This place is always great!!! Delicious food! And great service! I would definitely give it a try! We go there after a night a drinking whenever we visit Vegas lol!

My girlfriend and I have eaten here several times, and for some reason the service is almost always spotty. Food is great but the servers seem to be always be in a panic. Today we had a server named Vaneza and she was so sweet from start to finish. She deserves to be recognized! Thank you for the wonderful service vaneza!

Was in the neighborhood the other day and decided to stop in for lunch.  Haven't been to this location in awhile and was shocked.  The quality of the food, along with the portion size, has gone downhill.  Also, the food was marginally warm.  Food should be served hot!  On the plus side, the service was good.

I've been here about 10 times. Each time, the food is great. They are totally consistent & constantly busy. That's always a great sign. They have a different coffee cake every time & it's always great. My favorite so far has been the peach one.

First time here and I must say, this place is good! Everything was made well and their cracked croissant was delicious! I will definitely visit this place again when I'm in Vegas again! It's similar to the broken yolk in Cali.

Where to start... this brunch place is my absolute favorite in Vegas! We love in CA and every time we are here we stop for brunch. The potatoes are so delicious and all their egg creations are great. The stuffed french toast is heaven, I get hungry just thinking about it.

Solid food for breakfast or lunch. My colleague ordered the tuna melt with seasoned fries. I ordered the tropical French toast. :O... Sorry mouth was watering thinking about how good it was...  The servers and greeters were very friendly and though the place was busy during the lunch hour we were seated quickly. I took in the sights and found French toast on the menu so my mind was set, just had to figure out which version I wanted to try.  The Tropical French toast comes with toasted coconut, macadamia nuts and topped with sliced bananas. I think there was some powder sugar in there too but the food seem to disappear rather quickly! The seasoned fries my colleague enjoyed came with ranch to dip them in and also had he same problem... poof they were gone!  Will definitely come back and try over menu options. Some funny signs on the wall when paying your bill at the front counter. Enjoy the pics :)

Love, love, love this place.  I've been to all of the locations.   When I go to Vegas it's my first stop.  Clean and bright on the inside.  Service is quick.  Food is fresh and tastes great.  The best coffee cake and potatoes anywhere!
It's sorta like Denny's but the menu was more creative... and they had real orange juice. I wouldn't mind going back again but it will be a while before that happens.

This place was great! Fast friendly and efficient. Food was yummy as I had the French toast with over easy eggs and seasoned cut potatoes, all of which were delicious. My husband had an omelette with potatoes and toast which he said was also very good. We also had the coffee and it was some darn good coffee I have to say. Our server was amazing and our total meal only cost $25 ($30 with tip). Highly recommend!
Great breakfast! North Shore Scramble!

Since breakfast is my most favorite meal of the day, I've tried my fair share of b'fast joints in Vegas; hands down, the best & most consistent b'fast place. The atmosphere is rather simple & quaint, I've liked some things more than others but never had a single complaint about any of the food (the biscuits & gravy initially got me in the door but my latest obsession is the Veggie Benny) & their coffee cake is pure delicious'ness (though I do sometimes wish they'd keep it ol' skool with the raspberry one they had all the time a couple years ago). The only downside is the wait but there's a wait because it's a quality restaurant (so I make sure to plan accordingly).
Excellent food.  Wife and daughter had to try the coffee cake. Omelet was awesome. All in all it was a nice experience. I wpuld definitely recommend it to friends.

The food was amazing as usual. I always get the north shore scramble and sub spinach for the grilled onions. My husband loves the coffee cake it is so delicious. The food was cooked fresh and the wait was reasonable for the amount of people there. I definitely recommend cracked egg to everyone. They are always so friendly and the food is always good.
I ordered a custom veggie scramble and it was great. I requested fruit instead of potatoes and they provided colorful, fresh fruit. Pleasant service too!
Amazing food!!!! If you're in Vegas and don't want to eat buffet style food, please do come here!!! Amazing breakfast

Bland service. Bland food. Over priced breakfast. I was willing to look past all of that as I frequented this place three to four times a week since I live too close for it not to be practical. When I was turned away because u wanted to bring my 5lb dog into the patio on a Sunday morning and get service only to be rudely turned away, that was the last straw. I will never be a patron of this place again! Rachaels kitchen is down the street and they are dog friendly!

The best breakfast place in las vegas! It is really busy but thats because it is so good. They are always fast and friendly. The best food ever!! I am addicted to this place. You won't regret going here for breakfast. It is worth the wait.
This place is delicious! Great customer service, Carlos was our waiter he was always on top of it, great food! If your in Vegas you must stop here!

What you would expect from a country breakfast place l. Big portions and good quality. Usually long wait on the weekends but I guess that's not their fault people want to go there. If you're looking for a good breakfast in a chill environment this is your place but definitely not anything super special

First timer here. Went inside to check in. Hostess informed us the wait is 10 minutes . We waited bc we want to try their menu,seems the foods here are good  since all tables were filled up. There were 2 chairs available for the people to sit on while waiting to be called ...we were standing by the door and close to the cashier's side. There's not enough room for you to wait inside esp this cold weather.  We got to sit after 15 mins...got out order after 10 minutes I think. Soup was okay just bland( I know there's salt and pepper available) the food that we ordered was good and delish The place is neat also. Their waitress is not bad. But the only thing that we didn't like was the service. The food came out but no one came back for the second time to check if our order is good/okay and or refill  my coffee and water...poor service at all..she only brings  the coffee and water when we asked.
You're normal breakfast fare, with free potatoes and break, i picked coffee bread. Warm, sweet and goes really well with coffee.
First time there .great service yummy food I had the south shore scramble. Very good . Will be back for sure. Great coffee

I really want to like this place, but it was just very forgetable and overpriced.  It was a cute place and the servers were fine.   Basic issue is that the food wasn't special and it was overpriced. With tax and tip I walked out of here paying $10 for a bowl of oatmeal. It wasn't steel cut oats, just regular Quaker Oats you add water to and it was served with brown sugar, milk, cheap cereal stale granola and a cup of berries, mostly blackberries. It was a healthy portion of oatmeal, but it should have cost closer to $5. I did try the coffee cake, which was good but not out of this world.    I would rather go to the Egg and I or Bread and Butter for the same price. You get a lot tastier food.

We came here by default because the ever so popular babystacks was over an 1 hour and 20 minute wait.   The wait wasn't too long here, we waited a good 15 minutes on Sunday - Mother's Day to be exact.
