We ordered:  The Cracked Croissant - $10.75 we love buttery croissant breakfast sandwiches, so this was a definite for us. We chose sunny side up eggs and the runny yolk was rich and delicious with the sandwich. We also chose the sausage patty and a side of soggy hash browns - I'm thinking of asking them to make them well done and crispier next time. Overall I really enjoyed this dish. It was simple, but everything combined made for a great (expensive) breakfast sandwich. 4/5   Cakes & Eggs Combo - $8.50 I chose sunny side up eggs (comes with 2), bacon (comes with 2), and substituted the regular pancakes (comes with 2) with the Coconut macadamia pancakes (comes with 2) - bad decision.  The sunny side eggs were fried to perfection - both eggs had an extremely luscious and runny yolk. The eggs were very sweet and fresh. I wish the bacon was crispy, it was rather soggy. 3/5   Now onto the pancakes, they had an extra cost to substitute them ($1.50 or so) for the coconut macadamia pancakes. So not worth it! Although the pancakes were fluffy, they were also very dry. The pancakes had the faintest coconut flavor (actually, I barely tasted it) the "coconut flavor" was more like a prank. It did have dry coconut flakes, which was not texturally pleasing and only 7 small pieces of macadamia nuts throughout the entire pancake! It sounded better on paper than what was actually brought to the table. I wasn't satisfied or happy with these pancakes - they were a lie. 1/5  It was pricey for what we ended up getting. My favorites were their sunny side up eggs and the sausage. You can get that anywhere!
Food was amazing and spectacular service.  Very friendly staff.  The menu had a lot of variety.
Fun breakfast joint. Good food, main attraction are the friendly chatty wait staff. Feels like a cheerier, nicer looking Mel's diner. Recommend the omelettes with side of pancakes.

I got the country benny and coffee cake. The benny was ok, the eggs were still wet from poaching which made the mushy. The country gravy was bland and nothing special. The coffee cake was served hot but other than that it tasted like plain white cake with strudel on top. The waitress was very pleasant and service was quick.

This place is very cozy and has friendly service. The wait time hasn't been that bad the times I've been here. I usually get the eggs Benedict. Their hollandaise sauce is very good. The corned beef hash is my boyfriends usual choice and he loves it. It's become one of our regular breakfast places.

This was the busiest I've seen this place. Usually I go and we get seated right away. It was about a 15 minute wait which isn't bad. They have decent food and decent prices. Really wish they had more combos though, I like my breakfast to come with a little assortment. Here I always spend more because breakfast potatoes don't come with the pancakes and egg combo.. sometimes I get a side of coffee cake too because that doesn't come with the combo either.

We've eaten numerous times here and I can say the food and service is great. But TODAY the service just to be seated SUCKED... We asked for a booth for a party if 5, 2- booths were empty, guests that arrived after us got seated??? First of all don't say we wouldn't have fit in a booth since majority ALL the booths are the same size and 2nd don't LIE to my face and say the party that you just sat came before me!!! It will be awhile until I'm stepping into this restaurant.
Decent food, friendly service. If you're in the mood for breakfast this place hits the spot!

Second time here.  First time was ok, so I decided to try it again.   Service is great among the older adults. . A few young kids at the front, don't acknowledge you  until you are right in front of them for several minutes...  There always appears to be a long wait, but it's not. They move tables quickly, and you will be seated within the time they say.   Our server, who ironically I had the first time was fantastic!   The menu offers a large variety of breakfast items - skillets, omelets, and  eggs anyway you like... Along with it you get hash browns or skillet potatoes, toast or coffee cake..   OMG - the coffee cake, some of the best you will every put in your mouth.. Fresh, moist and served warm...    If you are looking for an exceptional place for Breakfast this is not the place, but  it is good food, with reasonable prices.

Was looking for a place where we could sit and enjoy a nice breakfast with my future father-in-law and fiance. After a slow service start at the door, we were seated after 30 minutes.  The food was excellent, the coffee was amazing. Fiance and I got the Green Kale Omelet special and Dad got the Build Your Own Skillet - all were happy.

I ordered the "Big, bad wolf" omelet and it was okay. There was too much cheese on the omelet, that's for sure. And the other half of the plate were some mediocre has browns. There was really nothing special about it, which I thought it would be. I really feel like I ordered the wrong omelet and I am willing to give this place a try again.  On the other hand though, my grandparents ordered "the club" sandwich (they both only ate half of the half) so when I got home I tried the sandwich and it was about of this world!!! I mean it was super delicious. 3 pieces of bread, loads of avocado. It was just delicious. I would never have thought a sandwich would be better than an omelet at a place called "the cracked egg"!   I should also note that, this place was busy, and VERY loud, so this is not a great pick if you need to chat with whom ever you are with!

This location is so much busier than all the other ones in town! The Cracked Egg is by far my favorite breakfast chain in Vegas. Now.. I love potatoes. If we go out to eat, I will have all my sides potato related. Hash browns are my favorite potato form.. When you come here GET THE SEASONED POTATOES as the side. Trust me. Don't ask. Just do it. It's so mouth watering.  Their country fried steak hits the right spot every time. The steak isn't huge, but isn't small. It's the perfect size. Now again.. Make sure you get their COFFEE CAKE. Yes. Do it. You can thank me later! Their corned beef hash is perfect but does get cold a little faster than I'd like. The big bad wolfe is their best omelette too. It's off a small menu so you wouldn't find it on the original one!

This is my favorite place to eat breakfast hands down! There's nothing I love more in the world then a good brunch ya hear? I always order the Veggy Benny, my husband switches things up. The Veggy Benny, in my opinion, is basically made of magic. It's spot on and I have nothing but rave reviews. My husband loves their south shore scramble. He recently tried their monte crisco, basically a ham and cheese sandwich dipped in french toast batter and deep fried, he said it was meh and should be served at a carnival so I wouldn't recommend that dish unless you're a carni, I feel like carni's don't read reviews though. The potatoes that come with your breakfast have a great spice to them. I've had the same ones at various other breakfast hubs but they're my fav so I'm happy. Now on to the famous coffee cake. First off all you yelp readers should know that I absolutely hate cake in general. I don't have a sweet tooth and I'm just not down with the fluffy cake consistency. For some reason though the coffee cake here is irresistible! They switch up the flavors every day, chocolate chip is my fav. I've never tried crack (hi mom) but this coffee cake is so crazy good that I believe it may be just as addictive as crack. Defiantly. Maybe.

Chile verde was awesome - really awesome.  Pancakes and eggs were both reliable. Potatoes were yummy. No cappucino, only coffee, but good coffee.  We had to wait for some time on a Sunday morning, but I would wait again.

Ok, its been 3 years since the last visit.  Had breakfast arriving at 6:20 am.  Again hope management or the owner reads this post.  -No one to greet us, waited 5 minutes or so, sat ourselves. -Noticed only one very busy super nice guy named Juan working his butt off. -Within 20 minutes, Juan (by himself, no one else in the dinning room) was handling 14 tables  and over 35 diners by himself.  -More people coming in and no one to set them.  Juan running around trying to accomplish everything....greeting some of the people, running water and coffee, serving, busing, etc.  to now almost 20 tables with over 50 diners...(yes I am counting, my wife told me to stop).  But I was amazed by watching Juan do all these task.    I hope Juan gets paid as a greeter host, server, food runner, bus person, and cashier because he certainly was doing all of these jobs almost seamlessly.   Food prices have increased quite a bit.  Had the Chicken, gravy, eggs, hash browns, toast.  -Eggs were good. -Their gravy is not bad, I would say good...but not as good as Mr Mama's! -Chicken was not good, mostly hard breaded batter.  I remember the chicken as being much better. -HASH BROWNS...well awesome, probably the best that I have had here in town!  This place has so much potential and I really want to like it.  Saves me over 12 miles round trip from going to Mr Mamas (Rated #1 on yelp I believe) on Jones and Russell.  Oh, by 7am a young lady showed up to help Juan, whew!    **********   FIVE STARS TO JUAN!   ***********

We are eating at the cracked egg the place is awesome friendly people awesome food  great place to take the family prices are great all around the best place to be in vegas  on 9921  west Charlestown blvd
Love this place! Great for kids. Great menu,price is ok. Love the South shore, get it ever time.

This place should change it's name to F*CKING AMAZING BURGER TOWN.  In fact you herd it here and now you cracked bastard a name change is in effect.  I've been to this place a number of times and have always ordered the same thing, which is the Blue Cheese Bacon Burger.  It is by far the best burger I have had in Las Vegas to date.  OK people before you get carried away I am not saying it is the best burger in sin city I am simply saying it is the best burger I have HAD in Vegas.   My wife and I had made our first visit to this fine establishment about a year ago, let me start off by saying I am not a breakfast person. Now I know what your thinking, but hold the slings and arrows for just minute and let me explain myself.  It is not that I am apposed of eating a scrumptious meal in the morning, in fact I am quite fond of it, however for every waffley, syrupesc, eggtastic creation in existence I always seem to find something much more appealing on any lunch or dinner menu.  Now my wife on the other hand being the complete opposite as one of those breakfast for dinner kind of folks, this is the perfect place for us.  So now with that being said if you are looking for a great place that serves both breakfast and lunch with no time restrictions this is the place for you.  My wife has tried everything from the biscuits and gravy to the eggs benedict, to a southwest scramble I was particularly fond and everything has been extremely above par. Also I will say again they do make one tasty burger which , of course, is served with french fries that are also out of this world.  So yeah I'll end by saying,"Go to The Cracked Egg".  You will not be disappointed.

We left our car at the dealer and walked over. We were seated fast at 9am breakfast rush. The food was great and Lisa was a fantastic waitress! She came around often and we were completely satisfied and didn't wait or wanted anything else. The coffee cake was awesome! All around I totally recommend!
Their potatoes alone are a 5/5. It's so delicious! I had the chicken fried steak and it's amazing! Great portioning sizes too! Can't wait to come back.

This place has the best breakfast. When I get breakfast, I don't want Denny's, not Ihop, but the Cracked Egg. The country fried steak and wolf omelette is so good. DO NOT GET THE HASH BROWNS. The potatoes are where it's at. Even though there's multiple locations, it doesn't feel like a corporate owned place. I highly recommend this place.

I wasn't expecting too much coming here, just a simple place to have some brunch before going shopping. The food was ok, nothing fantastic or terrible, just ok. I wasn't really pleased with having cold toast, though. But what really got me was our server. After we had finished our food and before our plates were cleared, our server brought a nearby table their food, then got in a conversation with another table and his back was to us. He talked so long that the first table FINISHED their meal and he was still talking, ignoring everyone else. All we wanted was our check. Finally a third table asked if he could please check on their food and he was not pleased at being interrupted. He informed her that he has other tables, not just her, and stormed off to the kitchen. Rude. And to top it all off, 30 minutes after leaving both my husband and myself (we ordered different foods and different drinks) were extremely ill. Gut wrenching horribleness. I doubt I'll go again, I'll find another diner.

Great bday breakfast. Mo ordered the Cowboy skillet. I ordered an omelet with hash browns. She picked the order up. Her skillet was missing all of the onions and peppers. Her potatoes were rock hard. She couldn't eat them. My omelet was a seared to death scrambled egg mixture. I had fluffy omelets in the past from here. Oh and my hash browns were slices of dried potatoes with black spots. Thanks Cracked Egg! Not!

The Cracked Egg is a fantastic place to go to for breakfast or brunch. I have been in here several times with a few different people and I always order pancakes whenever I'm here. Usually it's busy every time when we come here, but it's always worth it!

Best breakfast place in town (coming from a person who could eat breakfast food 24/7, 365 days a year). One thing to add. Always get their seasoned potatoes on the side. Always. They won't tell you what's in their seasoning because it's a secret. Believe me, I tried. Was told the coffee cake can bring you closer to God. Good prices for fantastic food. Clean and comfortable. Cute decorations. Friendly staff. Would give 10/10 stars if I could.

What I ate: Veggie Benny, coffee cake, bite of chocolate chip pancake Visit date: September 25, 2011 First time? Indeed.  Hurray! Finally! Some good food on my Vegas trip. I had the Veggy Benny - the Veggie Eggs Benedict, that is. Um, delicious! A fluffy biscuit, grilled tomato, spinach and poached egg, served with Cajun style potatoes. Their hollandaise is amazing. I started dipping the potatoes in it.  My bro-in-law's coffee cake came as an "appetizer". I had a piece. I was so cakey, moist and warm. And it had some kind of fruit it in...cherries? Who knows. It was fabulous. I also tried my niece's chocolate chip pancakes. Yum. She was also a happy camper.  All the kids (niece and nephews) enjoyed their bacon. And syrup. And the bacon in the syrup.
Monte Cristo sandwich is my favorite thing ever, I even call and order it to pick up sometimes!! When I do dine in its always a great experience, great attentive servers.
Sometimes busy but worth the wait! Love the food I get here every time. The staff is friendly and service is great even when it's packed!

Food looked exceptionally good but two of us rated the taste/preparation as three star. I primarily went for the gluten-free but since they cross contaminate the grill, deep fryer and toaster - that makes no sense to me. Although seemed busy, this GF sensitive person will not be back.
Perfect morning spot for yummy food! Ask for Erin, she's the best, she will remember you every time with all your special requests! She's a true GEM!

My wife and I have been regulars here at least twice a week. The service and food, we have never had to complain.It also helps with their coupon. Today, after a great lunch, I tried to pay with their coupon and was told it is NOT accepted today due to the holiday. I asked what holiday and I was told Nevada Day. Yes, the coupon said no good on holidays, but I thought this was not a federal holiday, but a state holiday. I asked to speak with the manager, Juliana Yunis. With an attitude, she confirmed the above. No apology, just turned her back and walked away.  Do I dare walk in on All Saints Day?  As I said, the service and food is great, the manager needs to take a management course and at least smile. Left bad taste and will not return.

Came to Phoenix for business and stopped here for some foos. I ordered the 2 eggs with waffle and hash brown and it was very good. We came in before closing and they were very nice and gave a fast service. Will definitely come here again on our next trip.

I should have reviewed the Cracked Egg a long time ago. It's one of my favorite places for breakfast or when I want breakfast for lunch. The food and service have always been great. If you haven't been get the coffee cake, the type changes every day it's always good; and the seasoned potatoes are also a great option.  The omelettes and waffles are really good too.  Had a really minor issue on our last visit and they went WAY out of their way to fix it. It's great to see a restaurant that cares so much about taking great care of their customers.
Probably eat here at least 3x a week whether it's with friends or family. Can always count on great food and great service that's what brings me back.

this place is a quaint little place that we met friends at.  Went based on their recommendations a lot but this place is very efficient. the staff was great and helpful, always responding to us quickly.   the food was good and came out exactly how we wanted it.  there are many options on the menu for all taste buds.  I got the fruit side with my eggs and it was a nice change with grapefruit, watermelon and honeydew rather than your typical fruit mix.  It was all nice and fresh too. Per their recommendation we shared a piece of the crumb cake.  Wasn't your typical crumb cake, more like a light fluffy piece of cake with some cream cheese bottom and icing on top but it was well balanced and the cheese wasn't overwhelming. My understanding is the flavors change too, will have to see.  They do have a frequent rewards/point card that they tell me gives you good coupons.  Would definitely go back.

Rock solid and consistently good.  While not my favorite breakfast place in town, it's probably the one I go to the most because it's the perfect blend of convenience, tasty food and an always friendly staff.  Location.  Parking right at the restaurant can be difficult.  If you dont strike gold and find a spot in front of the restaurant, just park in the large lot that spans the front of the shopping center facing Charleston Blvd.  Getting into the parking lot is easy, but getting out can be tricky depending on where you're trying to go.  The Charleston - Hualapai intersection can be a challenge.  The Food.  As mentioned, the food is consistently good.  Over time I've tried all but one of the omelettes (the Carnitas is my favorite), three of the "scrambles" (try the Southshore Scramble for something mild, or the Southwest Scramble for a little zing), and three of the Eggs Benedict (the traditional Eggs Benedict is my favorite, with a side of bacon).  They also have amazing salads for a breakfast place.  I've never ventured into the pancakes, french toast or other similar breakfast items because I love eggs for breakfast enough that I never seem to stray away from them.  My wife and friends routinely get these other items though and have never been unhappy.  If you have a gluten sensitivity, there's a significant menu for you as well, so dive in!  The Staff.  In the end, the Cracked Egg is a large chain, and there are a number of similar breakfast chains out there.  I've been to a few.  (I might like breakfast.)  Big chain restaurants are..well, big chains and honestly it's hard for me to give them a rating higher than a three.  In fact, I usually don't review them unless they stand out for some reason.  In this case, the staff at this Cracked Egg location is what makes this a four star review.  So go, enjoy the food, and let the staff take care of you.
Best breakfast in town if your in vegas loved the food it was extremely delicious. I highly recommend this place as a good spot to eat if you want bomb food will be coming back
Always friendly service.  This is one of my favorite breakfast stops in Vegas.  The coffee cake is something to add to any breakfast, trust me.  Simple home cooked start to your day.

Once again my favorite breakfast spot does not dissapointment service is good food is excellent and cooked perfectly to order. Hands down my fav spot for breakfast in las vegas. The coffee cake is always fresh and a great substitute for the traditional white or wheat toast. I think I have said enough. I'll be back soon
Love coming here the omelettes are so yummy!! I always get fruit on the side.. It's nice they have gealthy options on their menu
I have been coming here for a few years. And it doesn't matter what I order is always good. Super friendly staff.

Service deserves a 5 star! Our server was an older woman and was on top of it! Coffee was refilled, check-ins were timed appropriately and knowledgable with the menu and gave us options with salsas.  The portions were perfect for the prices that we paid, and the taste was actually pretty good! I have to say that I preferred their potatoes over Matt's big breakfast because they were toasted evenly throughout (not burnt on one side) - they could have been seasoned more but regardless, they were good. The eggs were cooked perfectly and they tasted like real eggs, the hashbrowns were plentiful and again a decent sized portion. I had the Belgian waffle and my husband had the pancakes both were good - we've had better but they were decent. For it being a last minute decision we were very happy with this restaurant for breakfast. It definitely felt like the neighborhood restaurant - homely feel. :)

I love the Cracked Egg! We stopped by on our way out of town, and I'm so glad we did!   The coffee is always good, the coffee CAKE is always good... and service is always good! It's the best little breakfast joint a girl could hope for!  Last time I went, I got the egg white omelet, which is something I've never had before. I expected it to taste... healthy. However, I was very surprised at the amazing flavor, because it had peppers and salsa to go with it. It was delicious! And less guilt! (Don't worry - I made up for it with the coffee cake scarfage).  Our whole group loved all the dishes we got, and left with a full belly and smiles on our faces... Now to stay out of our food comas for the car ride back to LA...

Food was delicious! I'd like to give this place five stars, but I can't. The girls at the front are rude. Instead of worrying about the customers and being prompt - they chit chat with one another and act like you're not standing there. We saw our server one time. She took our order and that was it. Had to ask the hostess to get my bill for me. She seemed annoyed, but did it. When I went to pay I handed the cashier my money and she just sat there chatting with her co-worker. I ended up walking out without my change, receipt, or a thank you.
First time here and I will return next time in Vegas.  Really good place for breakfast.   Highly recommend this place.
Great service and food. Portions are good, been there many times, never an issue.

We drove all the way out here to try Babycakes not knowing they'd have an excruciatingly long line, so we turned to Yelp to find something nearby that would satisfy our breakfast needs.  Up popped Cracked Egg.  We were already in the area anyways, and reading all the great reviews, we decided to head on down.    Much shorter wait ... about 5 minutes.  Still nice and busy.  Kind of a random strip mall to be located in - almost industrial looking ... but then again, considering it seemed most of the restaurants outside the strip seemed to be in this kind of environment, I think that's just how Vegas rolls?   Ambiance inside was nice, however, and the servers were super sweet and helpful.  The three of us girls were starving so after a thorough gander through the menu, my friend ordered the Veggie Benny (Vegetarian Benedict since she hates Canadian bacon), I ordered the Country Benny (because my fat arse really wanted some gravy), and my other friend ordered the Croissant French Toast.  Got to choose from either hash browns or seasoned potatoes.  My friend asked the server if they made their own hash browns or if they came from the frozen industrial stuff.  Unfortunately it came from the frozen variety, so we opted for the seasoned potatoes.  Luckily, the seasoned potatoes are delicious - so no sacrifice there!  We also ordered ourselves some orange juice and coffee.  Came with your typical diner - accompaniments (half & half creamers and sugar).  Considering all the crap that's in that weird half & half, we decided to ask her for some milk, instead, and luckily, she was super cool about it :)    My country benny was very good...super fulfilling, too.  Wish the gravy were just a tad more flavorful - it was a bit bland for country-style gravy, but hey..I'm a gravy sucka and as long as it was smothered on my biscuit and sausage, I was still a happy girl.  All in all, I'm not sure if I'd go out of my way to eat here again, but would definitely not be against it if we happened to find ourselves out round these parts.

Went to breakfast this morning and got some eggs Benedict.... Literally the best eggs Benedict I've ever eaten. Food was amazing and the staff was really friendly, considering how busy it was. I've honestly been going here for years and never wrote a review, so I decided why not throw them five stars. Highly recommended.

This is the place to go for good breakfast food. We always have to wait a bit but it is definitely worth it. Like everyone else has said, TRY THE COFFEE CAKE! Everyone that has tried it with me raves and we fight over who gets the last bite. Service is great and everyone is very friendly. I'm glad this is near my house. It rivals Egg Works for sure.

Came in and was told 20 minutes for seating. Sat down for around 30 minutes, noticed that the seating hostess never even added our names to the list by calling names far after us. Unproffessional. Next time I would rather waste my 20 minutes at a better business. When I was finally seated, she didnt even know my name to be seated. Say goodbye to a loyal customer!
Lots of food for your money.  Great friendly service.  OJ was expensive but that maybe an AZ thing.
This is one of the best breakfast you can have in the valley. There is nothing fancy or pretentious. Just farm fresh ingredients prepared excellently. Kathie our server is the best. .

The Cracked Egg has been my go-to breakfast place for the past decade. I religiously order the PESTO SCRAMBLE and always choose the seasoned potatoes. My boyfriend has tried a vast majority of their breakfast items and is never dissatisfied. Their service is on point and I've never had to wait more than 5 minutes for a seat. Love love love this place!
I loved every morsel of my food!! I was super greedy and not afraid to tell everyone reading this review! If you're on a diet.... order water!! Thank you for the great food and customer service!!
Service was top notch!  Very attentive staff.  My husband enjoyed the corned beef hash.  My eggs Benedict was ok.  The facility is pretty old, run down and bathrooms were scary.

Me and my boyfriend come here at about 12:50 , and we waited for our food forever . we seen 2 tables sit 30 minutes after us and they got their food 10 minutes of them being seated . we didnt get our food for probably 45 minutes . they either need more cooks or a faster team .

I love the food here because it is always made to  order perfectly and is delicious. Unfortunately, no matter what time of the morning or early afternoon, weekday or weekend, I have eaten here, the food takes forever to arrive.  It is always packed! Do not go here if you are in a hurry.  If service and delivery time were faster, I would give it 5 stars.  With all the business they have, and on weekends the long wait time for a table, you would think that they are raking in the money and could afford more waitresses and more cooks. But I will still keep on coming because I do enjoy their food

I know this is going to sound crazy because this is a breakfast place but do your self a favor and ask what soup they have for the day and if it's the baked potato soup GET IT !!! I ordered the Mexican scramble (I think that's what it was Called ) it was good had Jalapnoes and chorizo and cheese tons of flavor and went great with the potatoes . My next tip is you get a choice of toast or the daily coffee cake which comes out warm and is a huge square that you could share if you felt so inclined ( I destroyed the whole thing ) this place was busy but they handle it well our food came out fast and it was all delicious . If your in the area stop in !

Came here on a Friday morning because it's one of the only breakfast spots in henderson and waited 45 minutes for a table because the manager kept setting tables before us. We had 5 children all of whom were crying because they were so hungry and she did nothing but give me attitude when I asked how much longer after 30 minutes. Food is mediocre at best and NOT worth the 45 minute wait

I have only eaten here once and it was delicious! My daughter had the mini chicks I think it was called and I built my own burrito. The food was so good and cooked just right. All the drinks we ordered tasted a bit off and they were just normal drinks so I am not sure if it was just their machine. The wait on a Sunday morning wasn't too bad, about 25 minutes. Our server was attentive but not intrusive and all the other staff were friendly as well. The only negative spot was two of the staff were vocal about some disagreement they were having with another staff member. It made it a bit a bit awkward.

We came during a busy Sunday breakfast and even though the place was packed, the service was still great. My coffee cup was never empty and the biscuits and gravy I ordered were some of the best I've had. It was my first time dining there and I'll definitely go back.
The food is pretty good, but things don't arrive as ordered always. The servers are friendly and generally, it's an average diner. It's slightly over priced.

Delicious food and fast service!  My boyfriend and I ordered chicken fried steak with a coffee cake, and a Californian omelette.  The coffee cake came out first and it was piping hot! It was a lemon cake and it was absolutely amazing. It tasted homemade and felt very nostalgic. The chicken fried steak was your standard affair. Delicious sausage gravy and yummy well seasoned potatoes. The Californian omelette had slices of bacon folded into the omelet, topped with a couple slices of cheese and a half of an avocado.   It was very busy but the staff worked fast and efficiently that everything was still piping hot. It was our first time here and it's only up the street from our house. I don't know why we haven't gone her sooner.

Great place!!  We just moved the area and we will make this a "go to" breakfast stop for sure! Big place, diner setting. Family owned. HUGE HUGE HUGE breakfast skillets, omelets and many kinds of pancakes and waffles from which to choose!. Our waitress was the best!

Wide selection of breakfast/brunch items- anything your heart desires from your standard scramble, to omelet, or even breakfast skillet. Everything is pretty standard though, nothing to make this place unique. I would say that the quality is better than IHOP or Denny's but sometimes the wait isn't worth it.  This specific location is a little on the small side, so we had to wait about 30 mins to be seated on a Saturday morning.  Coffee cake is good :) Very moist with blueberries. And it's included with your meal. Yum.
Had Breakfast  here this morning! Fantastic.... try the Big Bad Wolf ! Great service ... good food !! Las Vegas this is good food!

Gluten free menu is excellent -- a lot of choices and awesome pancakes -- forgot to add the service is great the people who work there are always quick and very warm. Recommend this place to all my gluten free friends

I eat here about two times a week. I LOVE LIZ she is the best server in the place. breakfast, lunch, oatmeal, eggs, burgers youj name it it is all really good. I have been going here for about two years.....YUMMMMMMY

In terms of the decor and atmosphere, it's decent. Food wise, I only remember trying their savory plates! So far, it's been quite delicious! :) I recently tried the Chili Rellenos Omelette, the omelette had a lot of flavor to it and you just can't go wrong with seasoned potatoes at any breakfast place! Right? Their menus are unique looking (like a newspaper)! It can be pretty loud and crowded. I wouldn't say this is one of my top favorite breakfast place, but it's an overall good breakfast place!   P.S. Wait for food can be kind of long sometimes

This place is great. The options are incredible and they even have Gluten Free options! The wait can be a bit long so definitely choose your timing wisely or plan to add your name and shop at one of the nearby stores.
I just love this place! din in or dine out! the food is good fun and if your good you can find out about their secret hidden menu! (cordon blue bowl anyone!)

The service and the food here are phenomenal!! I've been here 2 days in a row. Both days, Liz has been our server. She is super friendly and really shows that she loves her job. She is a true credit to the restaurant and the industry itself.   In regards to the food, I think my buddy gave the best review I've ever heard. After taking the first bite of warm homemade apple coffee cake, he looks up and with a giant grin says, "This bite made me smile. I feel warm inside!"   The food here is the epitome of comfort food. My first day, I ordered the Carnitas omelette with a slice of their homemade chocolate chip coffee cake (they have a different flavor of coffee cake every day). The carnitas were so tender and the eggs were cooked to perfection! I held the peppers and onions, but added avocado.   Today I ordered the bacon cheeseburger skillet with hash browns instead of the country potatoes and a slice of homemade apple coffee cake (told ya they change the flavor every day;). It was amazing! In addition, every time I see skillets, there's usually a pool of oil at the end of meal. Not here my friends! Just pure deliciousness! This is a must stop spot for the Vegas vacation!

I can't believe I haven't written a review for this place yet. I've probably been here more times than I can remember.  The layout of the restaurant is a bit weird. I like sitting in the section off to the side rather than where the door is. The front section is a bit cavernous and feels "warehousey" I am aware this is not a word, but it seems like the best description. Despite that, I am willing to tolerate it cause the food is good.  I think my favorite dish here is the Chicken Fried Steak. Smothered in country gravy and served with your choice of  eggs, potatoes and toast. The steak is nicely breaded, superbly crispy and mouthwateringly yummy. I like to step it up a notch and sub the toast for biscuits with even more gravy. And of course I like scrambled eggs (when I like eggs) and the seasoned potatoes. My second "usual" is the Monte Cristo.   You know the saying, "stick to what you're used to." I should have heeded that one morning. I tried their raspberry french toast. Eww. Not happy. Not sweet. So unappetizing to me that I barely made it through one slice. Their presentation is a bit lacking but really what can I say. As far as local breakfast places go, I'm usually not in it for the presentation. Heck, most of the time I'm not even awake enough to appreciate it.  The portions are pretty generous and the service is quick and friendly. My bf likes it, I like it. The hot chocolate is good. All in all, a win win place for me.

I just moved to town and this is already my go to for a great meal. They only serve breakfast and lunch and wow do they :) it's sooo god I can't wait to try the monte cristo next time! This time I had north coast scrambler -- yummm A+

My family has been coming here for about two years probably about 2-4x's a month. Same location. It's always been pretty good breakfast and service but the last handful of visits the service has gotten worse. This last visit I walked in the front doors and wait behind a couple of people in line to put my name in for a table and some older whites guys walks up and bypasses the line to get a name if first. The only response I get from the hostess is "were you waiting to put a name in for a table?" In pretty sure I had a WTF look on my face.   I only mention "older white guy" because I do see this white privilege entitlement around town. Mostly by "older white guys" and other middle aged white guys I would assume is the off spring of the older ones. Many times I confront them about cutting in line for things and they just throw their hands up like "I don't know."   So in short, my family will frequent cracked eggs a lot less.

I've dined here quite a few times, so it's safe to say this place is A-ok in my book. It's your typical sit down breakfast/lunch place with omelets, pancakes, skillets, sandwiches and burgers. The portions are fairly large and the prices are decent. We always have left overs no matter what we order.   I've tried breakfast and lunch items, but honestly nothing really stands out as "wow I need to order this again." The only thing worth mentioning is their COFFEE CAKE! It's served warm and it's so so soft. The flavor changes daily but my favorite has got to be the strawberry or the pumpkin. Even if I order a burger, I will still order me a side of coffee cake, it's that good.   The service is hit or miss. I've had servers who looked happy to be there. However, I've also had servers who hated their lives and it showed. On our last visit, our server seemed to be rushing through the motions. No biggie though. The one thing I'm definitely not a fan of is the waiting area. It can get congested really fast. With customers having to go to the register to pay, that just adds to even more congestion.  I'm not in any rush to eat here again. But I wouldn't be opposed for someone suggested this for breakfast.

Went for a breakfast meeting and pretty typical breakfast place. The server was very nice but very aware we were there for a business meeting so was very good about finding spots to come check on us and refill our coffees. I got the The manager ( she was dressed in casual attire and had keys ) was VERY unpleasant. She seemed very cold when she dropped off our food not saying anything and a little annoyed. Her expression never changed... Usually not a big deal to me but when its early you want smiley faces around you serving your food. Otherwise it just sets the tone for a bad day. It left such a bad impression I probably wont be back... I got the "Lighten Up" which was okay but really not worth the $9 for eggs and country potatoes.

My favorite breakfast joint. Always packed on the weekends but the menu is big and delicious. The skillets are perfect and if you get a half order its even a better value. Their loyalty program coupons make it super affordable. The wait staff is wonderful just wish they had call ahead wait list cause it gets jam packed in there..but for good reason!

Yummy coffee cake, ok food that lacks flavor development. HORRIBLY SLOW SERVICE. Oh and their fresh squeezed orange juice....isn't. Servers are aloof.  Won't be back. The Ann Rd location kills this one. The highlight was a really nice, polite and helpful busboy.
The food was okay. The crumb cake they serve hot was amazing but the eggs Benedict was just average.

This was our first time here and will be back. The food and service were great, especially because we went on a holiday and the place was really busy! Our waitress was friendly and tge service was fast. I had the Southwest scramble with the seasoned potatoes,  and my boyfriend had the LA Carnitas. The food came out hot and cooked exactly how we requested it. The portions are good not too much and not small either we both enjoyed our food and thought it tasted great so we will be back. Next time will try the coffee cake that we've heard is delicious!

Just finished a delightful breakfast.  I would definitely go back but still doesn't beat my favorite place... Blueberry hill pancake house.  Love the new location of this place. Fast and pleasant service. Never had to wait or ask for a refill on our water and coffee. Coffee cake is a great choice. Moist warm and not overly sweet with the right amount of icing.  I've had the monte crisco at the different location which I do love but this time had the egg white scramble. Nice flavor and a good serving size.  Will be back.

This place has great food and really nice servers, BUT it is a struggle to order vegetarian dishes.  We wanted to substitute veggies for meat on an omelet, but were told no because their policy is meat for meat substitute only.  This is the first restaurant that hasn't accommodated vegetarian needs. I would have given a higher rating had it been different. We won't be coming back because we can't eat here.
They will go above and beyond if you're not happy. Ashley the manager was super helpful. They also have a gluten free menu with great options.
Great food and extremely attentive service. They have an extensive variety, including Greek food as one of the owners is Greek. We really enjoyed this place and highly recommend it.

Awesome place to grab brunch on the weekend.  Brace yourself...there will be a long wait, but it is well worth the wait.    My friend and I ordered two egg dishes, the Greek which had feta, tomatoes and spinach and she ordered the Denver which had spinach, cheese and bacon in it.  Both of them were absolutely amazing!  The Greek was very tasty and super flavorful.  I think the spinach could have been left off, but it was still good.  Both dishes come with your choice of hash browns, toast and coffee cake.  Get the coffee cake.  They have differently flavors every time you attend and its not like normal coffee cake found at Starbucks.  Its super fluffy and light and the flavors are super amazing.  The oreo coffee cake was great!  I would totally come there again the next time I come back to visit.

I have been here twice. Both times the service and friendly demeanor was exceptional. The food was great!  Little story: the first time I was at this location I had planned to meet a friend here. I was waiting and waiting. the server brought me a coffee... finally i decided that my friend and I had mixed up our locations so i went to the front to pay for my coffee and the person at the cash register (i'm assuming the owner or at least manager), so "no problem, honey, coffee is on us" - I was blown away by their generosity and realized that this is the way all businesses should do business... no where else I can think of would be this kind.

Great mexican skillet. The chorizo was a great combo with the seasoned potatoes, jalapenos and eggs. I got mine over medium so the yolk makes it a little saucy!   Coffee cake was just ok though. Very sweet and not really flavored like anything. Like a white cake with a little jam on one corner of the bottom. Next time I'll get toast or something.  My breakfast companion had the eggs b. He loved it. I tried a taste and thought the ham was much to smoky for me.  We will definitely go back though.

Decided to finally try this place out. It's a cute little place to have breakfast with a great variety of foods to choose from.   I got the Country Benny which is biscuits and gravy with poached egg. It was really good but I couldn't finish it. I would have liked a little bit more gravy to compliment the amount of biscuits there is.  My beau got the Carnitas omelette. It was pretty good. Only complaint is that the vegetables (onions, bell pepper) needed to be cut in smaller pieces.   On beautiful days like today you can actually sit outside to eat.
Love to eat here for breakfast when i get a chance too! Very friendly and excellent customer service. Love their coffee cakes before the meal. 4 stars because it should be bigger!

Server was great but the tall large blonde hostess or manager? needs to smile and have a personality.  We love going there but her dismissive attitude was not fitting to a normally super friendly place

Another reviewer (Kish M.) states, "Remember, there's only so much that you can do with eggs, toast, and bacon" - and yet, somehow, this place managed to fuck up every variation my family tried. You have to work at it, really hard, to make Eggs Benedict unpalatable. You have to expend concerted effort to make scrambled eggs so dry and unappealing that even my kid, the scourge of all eggs,  won't eat them. I don't even remember what my wife ordered, but she gave up after two bites, because it was revolting.
The breakfast was great! I had the California omelette with seasoned fries. The fries were the best I ever tasted!

A little disappointed as this place has relatively good reviews. Here is my justification for my rating. I ordered the bowl of fruit and I did not expect it to look like the picture, obviously. When I got it, it had bananas, grapes and strawberries. The bananas were overly mushy and the grapes were a little to wrinkly. Strawberries seemed fine.  My wife ordered biscuits with gravy, 3 eggs and 3 sausages. Now here is where the big disappointment was...the biscuit was hard and tasted a little rancid. The biscuits seemed they might have been a few days old just sitting around. I place my faith that this was not the case, but there was certainly something wrong with the biscuit.  The sausage tasted a little off. Not in a bad way but off.   The eggs, well that is hard to get wrong when cooking it sunny side up.   Overall, if you're going to charge $5.49 for a bowl of fruit, it should be of better quality. Bananas that were probably going to be thrown out that day should not be served like that. It's summer, so throwing in some melons would have been great.    The service was good and are waitress made sure to check up on us here and there which we appreciated, but the quality of the food that was served should not have been that poor. I might give it one more shot down the road so hopefully that experience will be better.

I usually love coming here, it was my go to for breakfast. But I was EXTREMELY unpleased when I saw my order and several other orders being MICROWAVED!!!! $15 breakfast for microwaved food? Really? Different management or what because who pays for a microwaved breakfast...? Maybe you guys should hide the microwave from the guests..how embarrassing
Pretty good food. Much like many of the other breakfast places. I wish there was something that stood out.  I will come back and try some other stuff on the menu.  The wait staff was very good.
1 angry hangover + 1 large, steaming bowl of fresh, made in small batches says the chef oatmeal + berries, granola, brown sugar and milk.. = less painful reality and happy food belly.

Owners great us like we are family every time we go in! They seemed to have gotten rid of that other waitress I had mentioned in my last review! Food is ALWAYS amazing and service is more than great! We come here almost every weekend and they know us and some know our order! Great place!

This place has the best coffee cakes ever! Always friendly service, and very fast and attentive! Staff always has great attitude considering they have to be there early hours and have to deal with all the grumpy old farts that come in they still hold it all together!

The Cracked Egg is very similar to other popular "egg" breakfast joints but I don't believe they're under the same ownership. The restaurant is in a space that used to house a hipster slider joint so there are still remnants of a once trendy space.   The service and menu is pretty standard for this type of place. I would recommend trying the croissant French toast if you're not in the mood for eggs. Eggs are the star here. The coffee is not. It's so weak that it tastes like hot water with an almost indistinguishable hint of coffee.

Delicious food served fresh and hot! The warm coffee cake was a treat. The menu was large and varied. Friendly helpful staff. Fun decor to inspire you and encourage fun conversations. Will definitely return often.

This whole chain is just incredible. There are a few things that I didn't like about this location in particular so ill start with those.  Cons:  -Its a bit crowded on the inside and the tables seemed smushed together. -It took forever for us to get our check, which is always frustrating. -The line at the register took FOREVER.  Pros: - Food was awesome, always is. - The muffins are just so soft and when the butter melts on them you instantly want more. -When you have the waiters attention, they are all yours. They focus on you and your order. But then again maybe that's the hold up. Whoknows.

Had the cinnamon pancakes and they were very good.  Loved every bite. The coffee was just okay. Order something a little darker. The potatoes were cooked crispy the way I like them. Bacon was good quality. A good spot for breakfast!

This is a decent place for breakfast.  It has all that you want in the typical American breakfast, eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, waffles, you name it.  It's fine.  The portion sizes are decent, and the price is what you'd expect.  Nothing really stands out as amazing, but nothing to sneeze at.  The decor at the entrance of the restaurant is cool, somewhat vintage, which I like, including a sign that "Unaccompanied children will be given an espresso and a new puppy."    The location is what makes this a great option.  It is on the corner of Charleston and Hualapai in Summerlin, a prime spot if you're on your way to Red Rock or live in the area.  Not that many free-standing breakfast joints around.

Our dining experience was amazing! Our server was very kind and our food came quickly, even though it was a full house. Our food was flavorful and filling. The coffee cake that was available for the day was Lemon, I was a little hesitant to try it but I'm glad I did! It was delicious!

I wasn't ready for the goodness of The Cracked Egg. To be fair, my friend did forewarned me that I would love it. She knows me well! I was hooked. All three times that I visited the Cracked Egg there was no wait time, one of those days was on a weekend.    The space is clean and spacious.  Super friendly and accomodating staff.   What I had and recommend...  - The eggs benedict - French toast - Bacon, egg, and cheese on a croissant. - Coffee  Warning: No wifi; which means people have to talk to each other. I loved that. Get off the phones and eat up people.  I can't wait to go back to Las Vegas just to go to The Cracked Egg.

The Cracked Egg is very overrated.  For a breakfast place, it's just okay.  There are many other coffee shops in Vegas that serve a better breakfast.  I ate there twice only because I had a groupon.  I would not eat there if I had to pay full price.

Food was acceptable, I would rather go to Dennys and will next time.   Eggs were great, the thick bacon is not very thick, they don't have hash browns and the waffle was thin but again,  overall it was good.
Loved the biscuit and gravey with poached egg...omg so good. Service was fast and food was hot. Cant ask for anything better.

I have came here twice with my boyfriend! It reminds me of an older 50's diner. It's reasonably cheap, quick and easy. The service is great. But both times sadly, the food has had an issue. Like the temperature being cold or the eggs cooked wrong. It's just small things, but they could be better.
Nice little place in LV. Had the biscuits and gravy - gravy was pretty good. Drive a bit to try it out!!!

The food was bland and the staff was rude. This place may have been best years ago, but has gone down hill. After our meal, we felt sick.  Bring Alka seltzer if you do decide to test your fate and eat here

I enjoyed. Would have enjoyed even more had they had mimosas  lol - but that's just me tho.  Very friendly server, food was really good. I'll be back. I have a pic but this silly Yelp app won't let me add it.
I come here at 12 for lunch sometimes , and it a great place, the Turkey melt is what I always get. Their season potatoes is a must! . Would always recommend to anyone .

If you want breakfast I'd say go to Denny's or IHOP instead. They seem to nickle and dime you here, so be aware of that. I wanted a waffle topped with lovely fresh fruit. Sadly I was underwhelmed. Bananas and strawberries were ok. The blueberries looked like a normal blueberry's embarrassing cousin. It's what I imagine the blueberries in a boxed muffin mix to look like. By the time I was done with my one waffle my boyfriend had annihilated his omelet, hash browns, and pancakes before I could try anything of his. Damn ectomorphs. He said it was all great though.

LOVE! I've never had anything that I didn't like. I'll get a skillet of some kind and get the coffee cake usually. You get so much food! I'm always so full when I leave! I'll usually take the coffee cake home and save it for later. Everything is cooked well and flavored very well. The staff is always very friendly and always checks to see how things are. Not very expensive. Perfect little breakfast spot.

I come here all the time and never had a bad meal or horrible service :-) They are wonderful with children too! My toddler started getting restless and the waitress came right over with goodies in hand to help calm my little one down :-) Yummy food, sweet and attentive servers, good prices, why eat any place else? Plus when your done eating just go across the drive way and hit some golf balls on the painted desert golf course :-) Perfect Sunday morning

I was driving around looking for a breakfast spot and found The Cracked Egg on Yelp.  All sounded great so I stopped by.    The restaurant was very clean and the hostess very welcoming.  I ordered the Big Bad Wolf Omelette and of course after reading the Yelp reviews the coffee cake.    The Omelette was huge!!  Cooked to perfection and the meat within so delicious!  The coffee cake was amazing to the palette!  No wonder so many mention it on Yelp!  I can't believe this place isn't just 5 Star rating all around just for the coffee cake!     The Cracked Egg will definitely be one of my first stops on my next visit to Vegas!

Brunch used to be one of my fav. meals EVER. But, since moving here, we've noticed that LV is not as much of a brunch town as some of its Northeastern, Midatlantic and Midwestern neighbors (We miss you Chi... SNIFF). So, when one of my girls suggested the Cracked Egg for brunch recently, I couldn't say "I'm in" fast enough.   I knew that there were others, like me, who missed brunch when I saw a line the size of India outside this resto. But, when I had my first bite of the GVR (the avocado, muenster, egg white combo is stellar!), I realized that people line up not JUST because they miss brunch BUT ALSO because the food here is delish!   Whatever your reason for coming to the Cracked Egg, you will be in for a treat. Service is great. The food is tasty. And, for a reasonable price (it came to about $100 incl. a 20% tip for 8 of us), you will have a great brunch.   A word to the wise: these folks will accommodate your meal to suit your request so don't be shy to ask. Also, if you order toast and don't want it to arrive pre-buttered, make sure to preference "Dry" toast. The same is true for "Light" cheese, egg whites (in place of eggs), and subbing the potatoes (the seasoned potatoes are awesome!) for fruit or cottage cheese.

I came here on a Sunday morning for brunch. We sat outside since it was a nice warm day and thankfully, there were misters. I got the Southwest Scramble and iced coffee. The portions here are big so I had trouble finishing my plate but it was delicious! Service was a little slow at times but they were busy that day. I just wish they'd have more people on the staff to check on people outside, as well. That being said, it was a great breakfast over all and I'd definitely come back to try more on the extensive menu :)
Diner-style breakfast in a clean, nice atmosphere. One of my favorite breakfast places in Las Vegas. They have a huge menu, many of the breakfasts come with delicious, warm coffee cake. Sooo good!

The food here is great.  I made my own skillet and the stuff weighed like 3 lbs, and I happened to finish it all.  The service was excellent, the quality was amazing, and the coffee cake was pretty damn good.  It is a little pricey just for breakfast, but I believe you get your bang for your buck.  They have a pretty good selection on their menu.  I'll definitely be back there again next time I'm in Vegas.

Atmosphere is pretty typical of a breakfast place. I wanted their breakfast special of two eggs meat potatoes and toast. Since I don't eat pork, I asked if we could have turkey bacon instead. The waitress thought it would be okay if it was a dollar of charge. And that was fine with me. But when she asked the manager, the manager said no. You have to take the special as it is. I do understand that perspective however since I don't eat pork that was my only option. I went ahead and ordered it with the bacon and gave the bacon to the Cook's. I just feel it was very poor customer service. It doesn't happen that often I'm quite sure there's no difference in cost. Our waitress was wonderful however. She constantly kept it would make sure that everything was okay.
Raspberry stuffed french toast.......enough said
Biscuits and gravy was gross! Not to mention way over priced, over $30 for 2 people, come on now
Great breakfast spot.  The Coffee cake is very soft and moist. I want more! Cracked egg sandwich was good.   Lucy scramble was normal. Overall,  good breakfast  spot.

I've always enjoyed a good breakfast. Mom always said that it's the days most important meal - here, breakfast never fails.   I've been going to this location for a few years now. Im there for lunch half the time, and the other half is when I call in for a pick up.   Denny's doesn't even come close. The reason I like it here is because I like Cracker Barrel. So if you're looking for a Cracker Barrel alternative - find your nearest Cracked Egg.
Food is fresh fresh fresh!!! Taste lean and clean . The restaurant has a nice ambience. This was my second visit and even more satisfied

Great Breakfast and Lunch options and the AC is perfect!  The pancakes are amazing. The servers are super nice and easy to tall too.   They have colors and drawing for the children. Also has a diner style bar for seating. Perfect for families and couples.

The food was the quality we always expect and the service was awesome! Thanks Juan for being attentive and happy. He was always by the table to service but not too much that it was annoying. Great Service! My in-laws were very impressed! Good way to start our Sunday.

Hungry fam was in search for good breakfast place in our new area. I think we found it. Wasn't as busy, sat our family down of 5 on arrival. Our waitress "Tracey" was amazing and really nice. She took our orders by memory and repeated it back to us accurately. She recommended the peanut butter and jelly coffee cake which was the BOMB. It was moist and warm. I could go back for just coffee and coffee cake. My husband and I shared a country fried steak with gravy, didn't know we could do half Hash brown and half seasoned potatoes and that's what we did. Country fried steak was good, it wasn't as heavy. So I didn't feel bad eating it. The kids got the banana choc chip with eggs and bacon. Also the Monte cristo which was some sort of ham and cheese stuff French toast if im not mistaken.   Overall, the experience was great. Great food, great staff, food was quick, reasonable price (maybe a tad higher) but with all said and eats...we will be back!   Thank you Yelpers for the pick! Happy eats!!
Always has an amazing staff.. food is always up to par.. great prices and even better environment.. definitely my favorite place to eat breakfast!

I love this place!  I have been for breakfast many times, so I have not tried their lunch menu yet.  The food is Fantastic, the prices are great & the staff is always friendly.  They have great healthy options & rediculously delicious UNhealthy options too :) Even when they are crowded, we never have to wait too long.  Plus as a bonus, there is usually a 'BOGO' coupon in the LV Weekly!
As solid as a place like this gets. This is run of the mill breakfast diner food consistently executed very well and with great service.

We have lived here 5 years before finally trying this place, and do not understand what the fuss is all about.  Fairly disinterested wait staff, not friendly at all.  French toast was thin and soggy.  Potatoes were bland and boring with too much Lawry's seasoning.  My eggs were runny. Daughter's scrambled were ok.  Am 100% sure they microwaved the coffee cake before bringing it out. Every item was horribly overpriced.  Not giving lowest rating because coffee was good and Portuguese sausage were good.  We will not eat here again.

As others noted, I too noticed a considerable lack of good, creative brunch spots in Vegas.  Most places are the same ol', same ol'.  Eggs, bacon, hashbrowns.  The Cracked Egg doesn't deviate too much from this standard. It mostly offers typical breakfast fare - an assortment of omelets, pancakes, scrambles, etc.  If you're in the mood for something relatively unique they do have plenty of options for interesting omelet combinations, a delicious benedict ole (heart attack on a plate), and their "coffee cakes" - a standard side with many of the menu items - are divine (and flavors vary daily, it's not your typical coffee cake, they must use smooth as silk cake flower and maybe add in sour cream or something to give it creaminess and tang).  My favorite standard is the huevos rancheros.  A simple tasty sauce covers refried beans, eggs how you like them, sitting on a flour tortilla and topped with melted cheese and jalapenos.  It's simple, but they do it well.  Not too much cheese (I really don't need to eat 12 oz of cheese in a given meal like some places believe), medium spicy peppers, and plenty of beans, just how I like it!  It's not the most unique food you can find (although it's as unique as any I've found in this city) nor is it on the top of the healthy list, but it's satisfying and consistent, reasonably priced, and has become my weekend go-to place!

You know I have been here over 25 times, and revisted the other day.  They lost a step somewhere, or I would give them a 5star here, but I do love the food, its super breakfast filler, 4stars is recommended, service is stellar, sometimes a wait on weekends, but not more that 20 min.   I like the benedicts, and the griddle meals and omelets.  Heck the Oatmeal is good.   $10 a head.   4star reliability, simple old time breakfast with spices and fresh oj and coffee.

I LOVE BREAKFAST. Well, I love food in general, but breakfast is happiness. I LOVE a great breakfast restaurant. After being torn away from Walker Brothers in Highland Park, IL when we moved to Vegas, I was desperate to find a comfortable, relaxed, no hassle breakfast eatery. Cracked Egg is one of them.  Their menu is great. I love that they have many different options: salad, soup, chili, omelet, chicken sandwiches and even burgers. I'm the kind of person that could eat a Thanksgiving dinner at 6:00AM, so variation is key. However, the more important is their massive gluten free menu. Cracked Egg's GF menu is one of the largest I've ever seen at any restaurant. PLUS, I could eat their seasoned potatoes and/or hash browns. I stuck with the hash browns because there is a small chance of cross contamination, but I was not disappointed; they were delicious!  It took me 15 minutes to make up my mind as to what to eat, and of course, when the waitress came to the table I changed my mind last minute and got the North Shore Scramble. Holy freaking happiness. Eggs were cooked perfectly, not runny but not dried out. All the ingredients were fresh, and those hash browns may have been standard, but you have no idea how great it was to 1. Eat hash browns without getting gluten-ed and 2. Too many places mess up hash browns and make my frown like a sad panda.The bacon was nice and crispy and gave it nice saltiness. I considered ordering another dish, the chili skillet, just to ensure the explosion of my stomach, but alas, I could not eat anymore.  My fiance ordered the standard eggs with kielbasa. Oh that kielbasa melted in my mouth - it was pure fatty processed foody goodness. I don't care what it's made out of. The kielbasa was great when smushed inbetween slices of toast and eggs. Thankfully, he gave me a couple bites of the kielbasa before he gluten-ed up his plate. I'm a huge fan of them cooking it on the flat top/griddle. The outside had a great snappy crust on it and was not too greasy. Oh, yummy pork product, I love you.  I will absolutely come here again, probably for their chili skillet. Yes, their chili skillet is gluten free. Gluten free chili at a restaurant other than Wendy's?!? YES PLEASE!!! Chili and I have a love affair every football season, but I think I will cheat on it soon and enjoy it at The Cracked Egg in a couple weeks. Or maybe I will have one of their sandwiches that is wrapped in lettuce instead of a bun. Yes, this way I can rationalize eating 400 calories of moo-cow...because it's wrapped in veggies! Thank you Cracked Egg. Good service, delicious food and a great restaurant environment. Love.  P.S. Anytime you want to make gluten free coffee cake, please let me know and I will taste test it for you!  P.P.S. They have GF pancakes. I know exactly what I'm getting next time!

The food & service were good. My steak was tender & flavorful The coffeecake that came with was really fluffy & delicious. The portions were big, they have turkey sausage (big plus) & the prices are fair.

I like this cute breakfast restaurant more than a few of the other similar pancake/omelette/Benedict places we've been to. Felt cleaner too. Our server was one of the sweetest.. the type of girl who will brighten your morning without over doing it. She was more than helpful, again, without overdoing it. Wish I remembered her name.. brunette with a pixie haircut and i think she had a small tat on the back of her neck.. tiny frame, sweet eyes & smile. Sorry .. girl crushing for a split sec there. Anyway, we went on a Sunday and the wait was long of course but it was worth it. Love the booth seating and the service overall was perfect, especially on such a busy morning. Oh and our meal was delicious. I had the Veggie Benny and hubby had Buttermilk Pancakes, scrambled eggs and an order of bacon & sausage. Omg soo good.

We discovered The Cracked Egg two years ago on a prior visit to Vegas.  After a great experience we added it to the itinerary for this trip.  Aside from the Home Goods-Happy decorating choices, everything about this place is great.  Food portions are huge, quality is spot on and bellies were full!  We had a server named Amanda from San Diego and she was truly just a joyful human.  Always smiling, accommodating and helpful.  The best service we have had out this entire week in Vegas.  If you read my reviews, I'm not easily impressed but credit where its due...here's to Amanda, great food and great service!

I wanted to try this since it reminded me of a couple other "Breakfasty style places" here in Las Vegas, but this is super close to home.  I have had two great meals here! And look forward to more!  Once was on a weekday, it was delightfully quiet, had great service and the food came out really quickly! Not a single complaint!!  The next time was on a Sunday, definitely not quiet..Because clearly the food is good! Not a problem, put our name on the list, sauntered over to StarBucks in Smiths (10 steps away), and headed back. With in minutes we were seated! The Cracked Egg does not crack when they are slammed! That is a good sign! OK, maybe the young male host looked a little shell shocked, but I assume he is new? But worry not, the seasoned girls kept it ALL together! Like a well oiled breakfast machine! A coffee station upfront while you are waiting could be a nice touch, but now I am just being nit-picky. I would happily go back anytime!  Over all, rock solid 4 star food! Great service! And an easy price point. What is not to love about all of that?

Good gravy!  Good God!  You get a TON of food.  I am still full and i ate there in December.  The omelette I ordered had a TON of avocados on it.  Usually they put like 3 and call it a California Omlette.  But no.  They put like 7 slices.  And did I mention the gravy and biscuits?  Off the strip, waaaay off the strip.  Thats how to appreciate Vegas.

First time customers, and I won't be our last. I had eggs , corned beef hash and home fries, the wife had spinach eggs benedict and home fries- we finished both our plates. Our waitress was awesome!! We will definitely be coming back. Its really hard to find excellent service, and a good breakfast at an affordable price. The cracked egg just became our new favorite place, we can't wait to try out the other menu items.
First time visitor and we will return! Good service, great selection of food for reasonable prices

The Cracked Egg, I want to like you so bad!  The service here is actually really good. They staff was super attentive and I never had to ask for a water refills, but my server was very sassy in a TV sitcom sort of way. She tried to make little quirky jokes every time she came to the table, but they just came off like she was mad at the world and we were the cause of it. Like I said very TV sitcom-ish.   The decor here needs to be updated desperately. It has a cafeteria look; very open and very cold, but with a country grandma style. By this I mean there's random farm and rooster decor on the walls. Which makes me laugh because roosters don't lay eggs. It's Science!   The food is tasty, but basic. I was here with four other people and I tried everyone's dish... I ordered the Buffalo Chicken Salad; the salad for the guy who never orders salad. This was great in my opinion, big chunks of chicken coated in buffalo sauce on huge bed of fresh greens w/ eggs and tomatoes. My foodie friends ordered the "Veggie Benny", "The Cobb", and the "Pesto Scramble".   The "Veggie Benny" was the star in this line-up. This plate comes with spinach, avocado, grilled tomatoes and two poached eggs. The eggs were cooked perfectly, the hollandaise sauce was creamy, but lite in an interesting way, and the hash browns were golden brown and crispy. I would most likely order this if I came back to the Cracked Egg. The other dishes were forgetful and don't need to be mentioned in this review.   This place needs a design overhaul and few updates on the menu. These simple changes could really elevate this place...Where's Robert Irvine?!?  Pro Tip: The baked goods in this place are steller. Try the Blueberry Muffin/Coffee Cake

I had breakfast here today and was very pleased with everything. The server was very friendly a little slow but I can understand being it was so packed on a Sunday morning. The wait to be seated was said at 15-20 minutes and it was about 15 minutes I'd say. But I ordered the raspberry French toast and a side of sausage links, it was very delicious! I have never seen where someone took French toast and between the bread is like a raspberry jam or filling. Was topped with fresh raspberries that tasted like it came right off the plant! Very goooood! Then the sausage was the nice big thick links which I love and they were delicious also! Came to around 14$ for the meal not including the tip so to me was worth it. I also liked the place it self with the decorations and the way they have it set up ;). Definitely will be coming back to try the peanut butter French toast next!

I literally live a block away from the cracked egg so I come here often when I am craving some good breakfast food.  There usually isn't a wait unless it is Saturday or Sunday morning between 8-12.  In that case, the most you usually would have to wait is 30-45 minutes to get a table.    Everything here is very affordable ranging between $7-15 dollars for a large portioned meal.    My favorites at cracked egg:  The Monte Cristo Turkey, ham and swiss cheese sandwich dipped in french toast batter and deep fried. served with hash browns or seasoned potatoes.  This is absolutely amazing and hits so many of your senses that it will confuse you but it is delicious!    Coconut Macadamia Short stacks are a great side to add to any of the meals.  If you are looking for a healthier option, the oatmeal overload is a HUGE bowl of oats, loaded with nuts, raisins, berries, and granola on the side.    Another one of my favorites is The Country Benny:  a biscuit split and topped with patty sausage, two poached eggs and smothered in gravy  Overall, I am a big fan of the cracked egg.  The service has always been friendly and prompt.  The food is good and affordable.

This is a great little place for breakfast. They offer lunch items, too. Although, I have only had breakfast. the atmosphere is great & small. The staff is friendly & prompt. Everyday the offer a coffee cake (instead of toast if you prefer) & it is never the same flavor. Its nice to have something different everyday, You can also get all egg white at no extra charge. I highly recommend this place. My son only wants to eat here for breakfast. Which is fine by me.

I am a creature of habit and this is my spot.  2-3 times a week for me. Been going her for over 10 years. I also like consistency which is what I get.  This would be my diner if I had a TV show about me.

It's really more like 3.5 stars.  Better than 'OK' but not like I'm a total Fan... I mean... it's a really good breakfast but they don't serve bloody marys... so.... ya know.  Service: Got there a little before 8am... there were a few people in line but we were seated quickly... and the busser got us our coffees and waters really quick... and then we waited for like 15 minutes.  Our waitress was slammed and she was 1 of only 2 working at the moment. She was really nice and efficient. Our food was delivered quickly... and hot.  Food: Taste.... right on!  I ordered the Veggie Benny... and it came with lots of avocado slices which I love!  The side of potatoes were 'ok'...nothing special... they need seasoning or something but I don't really need the extra starch... so I left them.  The hubby had the croissant breakfast sandwich and that looked good... I didn't get a taste because I was too excited about the yummy avocados on my dish.  The FIL got the oatmeal overload.... WOW!  It came with fresh berries, cream, raisins, brown sugar and almond slivers on the side... and a huge bowl of oatmeal.  Looked Great and he was happy with it so thumbs up.  Will I be back?  For Sure.  :)

I live next to this place and I feel lucky.  It's a great spot for a great, fresh breakfast.  The veggies are always fresh and not pre-frozen like at some other spots and their pancake options are delicious.

The corn beef hash was just so so. The corn beef was not "hashed".Waitress should have warned me not to order the hash brown because there is already potatoes under the corn beef.  Should have sub it with fruits.  This breakfast place  is exactly what this area needs. Flooded with natural light,  cheerful and airy. Waiting stuff was friendly.  Next time I'll just order eggs over easy, toast and coffee. Other stuff on the menu looks too heavy.

Service was pleasant and quick.  Ambiance was light and airy, with comfortable booths.  They had a great kids menu, where they can draw and color.  Food was a little bland.  I had the veggie croissant, bf got the pesto scramble with chicken.  Friend got the carnitas omelette.  It was good but heavy.  Coffee cake was good.  It was about $10 an entre.  Overall, just okay.

Walked up and huge line of people, didn't realize they were all waiting to pay their checks. Seated after not even waiting 5 minutes, ordered just a regular breakfast of sunny side eggs/bacon/fries/toast. My friend got a chicken/jalapeo skillet. Waiter was attentive, refilled our teas. Food was decent. My only complaint was the bathroom, there's a sign it's under construction but stinks sooooo bad. Almost smells like a funky sewage smell. I walked in -got a whiff & walked right out, such a gross & nauseating smell. I know they're in the process of renovating but made my stomach churn.
Food is AMAZING. Service is very nice! Location is beautiful and clean and very comfortable. Hard not to hang out all morning  10/10

First of all I would like to start off by saying how much I used to love the Cracked Egg. My boyfriend and I basically go every Saturday...so with that being said, I was REALLY ASTOUNDED by what happened today...  BUGS IN OUR FOOD. THE FOOD-ON THE PLATE-EVERYWHERE.  My boyfriend ordered the croissant french toast, and I got one of the egg scrambles. All was fine, and then I saw a little brown bug crawling on the side of my boyfriend's plate. I looked closer, and saw literally 5 of them...and then more...I immediately told him to stop eating. We called our server over and she took the plate away. I then decided I couldn't eat because I was so insanely grossed out. The server then brought over our check and charged us for everything except my boyfriend's meal. I DIDN'T EVEN EAT MY MEAL (A FEW BITES) BECAUSE OF HOW DISGUSTED BY THE BUGS I WAS.  The manager didn't even come to our table to apologize or anything. The server just took my boyfriend's meal off the check and that was that. So my boyfriend decided to find the manager. After 5 minutes of searching the small restaurant for her, she came out and seemed ANNOYED to talk to him. She had a smug "don't care" attitude. My boyfriend is wayyyy too nice in my opinion...and the manager said that this is "the food industry and that bugs happen". !!!!!!!!!!!! What!!! management should never ever tell their patrons that. My boyfriend then asked her how she would feel if she had bugs in her food and her reply, "well, i grew up around animals so I wouldn't have cared." !!!!!!! What!!!!!!!!!!!! Finally after the manager made my boyfriend feel like an idiot for "politely" complaining, she said, "ok, if it'll make you happy, i'll take off your girlfriends meal too." That wasn't even it! It was the principle behind everything!!!!!!  I teach service recovery in the hospitality for a living and that was the most piss poor excuse of a manager I have ever encountered.  NEVER EVER going there again. I'm extremely disappointed.

EDIT: I had a lot of gripes at first, but I've been back since with a pleasant experience. The parking was only bad the first time and the food was better quality. My wife loves the Benedict.  The first thing I noticed was the terrible parking lot. There are way too many businesses in the shopping center for the size of the parking lot.  Parking aside, I heard great things about this place, so I was looking forward to breakfast. Also, the place was packed, so I assumed the food would be good. It was.
