The portions were big, and the service was good.  Their breakfast was a little better than IHOP, but priced twice as much. A breakfast for two was $28. A couple of basic omelets, potatoes and drinks for $28? How in the world does this place justify these ridiculous prices?   Advice to management: You blew it on the location with the parking lot, but there's nothing you can do about it now. Cut the price and cut the portions. No one wants to take an omelet home for leftovers.  Fix the value, and I'll give it 4*, because the food was as expected and the staff was pleasant.
I'm a lover of Corned Beef Hash & Eggs so I thought I would try it. Far from the best and I think they skimp on portion for what they charge. Service and coffee was Great

Top of the line breakfast! Been going there for 4 years straight. Love the stuffed peanut butter jelly French toast. But my favorite will always be the orange marmalade French toast yummy!! Great service great environment great attitude.

I want something other than the Omelet House and Jamm's to run to for breakfast, and I decided to finally try out the Cracked Egg.  Located in a small business center, this breakfast place is busy and we had to wait for a few minutes to grab a table.  When you walk in, it's a typical breakfast diner setting with interesting trinkets and artwork around.  The menu is nice and simple and the service is great.  I ordered a denver omelette and my husband grabbed corned beef hash and eggs.  We had to try their muffin cake thing, and it was goood.  I know they microwave it to heat it up, but it still tastes pretty awesome.  As for the breakfast items, they were not greasy, nice and hot, and very yummy.  Everything was seasoned well and cooked perfectly.  I've yet to eat lunch here or try anything else on the menu, but once I do I'll be sure to update my review.  If you want a nice, quick breakfast for a reasonable price--and a great dessert cake muffin to start--grab a quick eat at this place.  it's worth the trip.

Best breakfast I've had in  years id say!!! Super clean, super neat, wonderful customer service, and for the first time you get what you pay for!  Not the cheap diner places where everything tastes the same, and not  the fancy shmancy brunch places where you pay $40 for eggs!  To bad is 260 miles away for me, but for sure anytime id go to vegas id stop there!

Came here for brunch on a Friday morning and my party of 2 was seated right away. Service was generally pretty quick even though the place seemed packed. I got the chile verde rancheros and at first sight it didn't look like much. It just looked like a big blob of food haha but every bite was delicious. Kind of tastes like a chimichanga lol overall, a great place for breakfast/brunch. They have a huge variety of food to choose from and the staff is really friendly.

My brother and I just had lunch there. Fast friendly service. had the mushroom swiss burger and substituted salad for usual fries. The burger was great, but the salad could have used a better dressing. The burger and a drink or just over 11 bucks.

ummm coffee cake sooooo fresh and delicious!!! WOWZA! this place had some amazing food and great fast service! I loved my breakfast coming into town meeting friends there was a perfect way to start my Vegas trip. The menu is filled with so many selections that the average Joe would have a hard time deciding which to choose! You want a good affordable breakfast, or any other meal this would be the yum spot!
Love this place and we go all the time. Awesome coffee cake and delicious egg dishes! Always hard to choose which one to get - they're all so good!!

If you don't want to deal with the buffets on the strip...this is the next best place to have breakfast. At first by the environment you'd think that the food would be sub-par at best...boy I have never been so happy to be wrong. This place is amazing!

I just love their pancakes here!   The service here is usually good. We've been coming here every weekend for breakfast and the staff knows us already. But there are times that we will be seated with servers who are not as attentive.   But the food is always good. No complaint so far.

I have been here for breakfast a few times and it is average at best. Small and somewhat bland portions with ok service.  Looking around for another local cafe as I am relatively new to the area. Anyone have any suggestions??

Every time I come here it gets better and better. I've loved everything I've eaten from here! Everyone is so nice too.  The coffee cake is a must. Even if it's a flavor that doesn't sound too appealing, they do it WELL.  I come here every time I'm in Vegas. They need to open one in California and I'll go broke
It's a small place but the food and service are great. Be prepared to wait on the weekends because it is a popular spot. I can't leave without getting the coffee cake...it is amazing!!!

Ordered the veggie Benny and husband had the big bad wolf. Watched food sit in the window for just over three minutes while server was chatting with a colleague. Food was not seasoned with the exception of the cayenne the server added while still in the window. Eggs were not poached properly. In the interest of time, informed server but did not want meal remade. A sever that overheard me came over and argued with me, then my server came back and argued with me as well. I find it distasteful when servers argue with a customer in any circumstance. I was appalled that I was treated this way considering I did not request a new meal, a discount or even an apology. Will not return.
The Service is great, the Food is awesome. Coffee cake yummy, pancakes fabulous . I recommend this place whenever u r in Las Vegas!
Went there for the first time with my buddy. Ordered waffles & eggs for myself cause I love those things. It was great. Server was pleasant.

I love this place for breakfast, and it has some of the best New England Clam on fridays.  I am a big fan of the hangover special they have occasionally, and have yet to have a dish I didn't like there.  You have to try the coffee cake.

The place was busy and the food was okay. The staff was friendly and the food was ready very quick. For the price, you can't beat it. The eggs lacked a certain flavor/texture that I like, but overall the meal was good. I would go back.

i am a breakfast girl. morning, afternoon, and my favorite...night! i went here for a late breakfast one morning after the boy constantly hints that he craves it. he use to be a regular here apparently and i caught that as soon as we walked in. the servers knew him and remembered him (by name) all the way to what he orders. he loves the lowfat scramble without any green chilis. i ordered the veggie benny. (i'm a sucker for the benedicts and i love veggies.)  the waitresses and waiters were all very nice and attentive. the food came quickly. we had a bagel and banana in the meantime to snack on. when my veggie benny came i was in love with all the bright colors of it. pretty food! the only thing i didn't care for was when they said "smothered in holliandaise sauce" they really meant it. it took away some of the flavor of my fresh spinach and tomatos sadly. next time i will have to make sure to ask them to go easy. we shared my seasoned potatos and those were pretty good. greasy but good. i would give it 3 stars because it was pretty basic and for the holliandaise factor, but the service made me want to come back. everyone was very nice and the bill was cheap.

Standard breakfast and brunch only establishment.   So far have only tried a GVP omelet, club sandwich and the huevos rancheros. Nothing special taste-wise, but the service was fairly fast, as is the common expectation in these types of eateries.  Expect a 10-20 minute wait on weekends. Never been there during the workweek.
Tried the Pancho Omelette. No regrets there. Staff was friendly and helpful with the entire process. I will definitely try them out one more time before I skip town.
Great service, seated us right away. Food delicious especially the coffee cake! Would visit again

This breakfast place is absolutely " gross" and certainly not what peopled  "Jacked"this place to be this great breakfast place . My omelette was tasteless and cold . And the infamous coffee cake......really .. I will not return  The service was poor . The food is overpriced, and certainly not worth the Drive. The reputation of this establishment does not meet the quality. Extremely disappointing!,,,,,,,
Service was slow prices to high and they don't care enough to give a military discount or senior discount

This place seem small and a bit confusing. Its in an area that you usually won't find a sit down restaurant. I guess its an okay location, but it looks like a place would be fitting for retail stores like Radio Shack or GNC. Doesn't really fit very well, but it is a nice place.   Inside was a bit decent, a bit roomy and seems clean. When we did get to our booth, we did find it odd that one side is roomy then the other side of the booth.   The staff seem kind of nice. The one who sat us down in our booth, didn't seem to happy. But the waitress that took our order was upbeat. The busser on the other hand, had issues. I'm sure there are a softer way to put dishes in a bucket, instead of making clanging sounds, to the point where it irritates our ears and makes us twitch every time he drops a plate in the bucket. So that was kind of annoying, either he doesn't know how to be gentle with dishes, or he's not really happy that he has to make the dishes clang and make us twitch. Uncool, unprofessional, and uncalled for.   The only thing that's making this okay, is the food, the nice setting and the waitress being nice. Otherwise I would of probably experience better if the staff look like they didn't want to work.   The food on the other hand, I really enjoyed. Had the steak and eggs and cooked to my satisfaction. So I give the cooks a very good recognition as well.   I guess, if you don't mind some of the staff being unhappy and there for the food. Then I would recommend it. Otherwise, I would try something else, if you want to be in a more upbeat kind of place that won't make you feel uncomfortable.

You need to try their coffee cake. It's so good!!! Great Breakfast & Brunch spot. Love the cafe style atmosphere. Always busy on a Sunday after church. Very homey, and relaxed. Food is yummy. The skillets are a must-try. I have yet to try the pancakes or french toasts...maybe during our next stop I will.

Visiting from L.A. and just happened upon The Cracked Egg so went in for breakfast. The food was very good and boy did you get plenty of it. Would definitely come back and also recommend it. My waitress Tori was wonderful. Very friendly and attentive, she made sure I had everything that I needed and kept my water glass full even though they were quite busy.  So nice to have a pleasant waitress and good food to start off the day in a good mood. Thumbs up to Tori and The Cracked Egg!!!

I live at SW but went to this location. Good and fast service. I tried the pesto scramble and she tried the Lucy and we really liked it. The atmosphere was just kinda dark for a bf place. Would go back.
Great omelletes!  Even though the wait was painfully long, definitely worth the wait.  It is an A+ alternative to the chain breakfast diners!  Will return!

Had the gluten free turkey Pesto sandwich. The bread was delicious and had a perfectly made Pesto sauce. May have to go back on this trip to have again. Also got the side of fruit. Had delicious pieces of watermelon, cantaloupe and grapefruit. As we were leaving it was really filling up. Popular place for great reason!
The service here is good but the food isn't anything special...  Its a great place to grab a quick breakfast. Typical breakfast menu plus some healthy choices.

Our go-to breakfast place.  Always a wait, but always worth it; eat outside if you can stand to, you'll be in and out in no time!  Menu is so great, I always have a favorite at every restaurant but here I have to decide between so many yummy things!  The coffee cake is wicked good and hits the spot for breakfast dessert ;)
Love everything about this place. So welcoming. Food is great. This is my go to breakfast spot.

I've been there many times. Service is good and the food is ok, nothing special though. The last time I was there the hash browns were crispy but tasted as if they had sat around for a while, not fresh. Sometimes it hit and miss. It's close by so that's the main reason I go there.

Breakfast is my least favorite meal by far and I'll only go out for a weekend breakfast meal about 5 times a year. But when I do go, The Cracked Egg is one of the places I'll go to. Whenever I try to go on a Sunday the lines are out of the door so I recommend Saturdays. The restaurant has two separate dining rooms so there's plenty of seating, especially if you don't have many people in your party.  Their menu has a ton of variety. With most of the breakfasts you'll have a choice of toast or coffee cake and potatoes or hash browns. These are essentials for any solid breakfast spot. On this last trip my boyfriend and I shared the macadamia coconut pancakes and the green scramble. The pancakes are so good they've inspired me to try to recreate them at home. There's plenty of coconut shreds in each bite with the occasional crunch of macadamia nut. The dish comes with three huge pancakes and we were each only able to finish one. The green scramble was also delicious, filled with broccoli, chiles, spinach and chicken. The star of this show was for sure the green salsa. I could drink this salsa it was so fresh and yummy. I would order any dish on the menu that has this (they seem to offer a lot of Mexican inspired breakfasts).   The Cracked Egg is the perfect every-so-often stuff your face full of breakfast food and lay on the couch of the rest of the day. I can't do it very often but when I'm ready for it again and craving those coconut macadamia pancakes I will pretty much always choose to come here.
Went on a Saturday morning....no waiting, got a table immediately.  Food was great and waitress was awesome.  Better than other Cracked Eggs I've been too in Vegas.
Stopped in with my parents for lunch had the North Shore Scramble, it's was better than I expected. Our service was good overall I would recommend stoping by if your ever in the area.
Had the Joes scramble with a side short stack, food was good hash browns were not the best but overall good food!

Got to start off by saying that their mocha coffee cake was to die for and its been the only thing on my mind these past few days. It comes to your table with legit steam still, super hot, moist & delicious. I ordered a Denver omelette and it was great. I do have to say that Egg works Denver omelette was just the slightest bit better BUT.. The coffee cake and delicious potatoes at cracked egg will definitely be the reason I come back!

This is my first visit and I will definitely be back! The menu has a large selection and build your own options if nothing suits you. The service was wonderful. Friendly, quick, drinks consistently filled with out asking, and the waitress was the perfect amount of interaction with us.   The home fries were a type of mashed potato and had a good taste. My omelet was delicious and my friend enjoyed her chicken fajita skillet too, calling it hearty and delicious. We finished our plates.   We also split their ultimate French toast and it was incredible! I highly recommend it.

Delicious food. Good coffee. Very friendly. Food portions were average for Las Vegas, my youngest had pancakes with eggs and bacon, pancakes were large, fluffy and moist. Hubby had corn beef hash with over easy eggs and it was hash as I have never seen it, like cut up slices of corn beef, tasted pretty good and not greasy at all. Older daughter had egg burrito with chorizo, she loved every bit and opted for fresh fruit in place of potatoes,  pieces of watermelon, cantaloupe and grapefruit. I had scrambled eggs with green onion and cream cheese, side of hash browns and in place of toast; coffee cake, coffee cake was amazing. Super moist and perfect amount of cinnamon, delicious. My eggs with cream cheese and green onions were flavorful and moist. Coffee hot and strong, service fast friendly and server stopped by many times to refill beverages. Bathroom cramped but very clean. Only 4 stars because I feel the price was a bit high. Over 50.00 for our meal. I don't know if that is average for off the strip, but for us So. Cal family it's a bit high. With all that said, will go back again.

Such a disappointment.  I really dislike giving a less then favorable reveiw of a restrurant when there are so many positive reviews. So let's start off on a good note. The staff at Cracked Egg are warm, friendly, and  accommodating, which is why I feel terrible for calling out their food as bland and tastless.   We really wanted to like the cracked Egg so badly, but the way to begin a meal is not with brunt black toast, over- cooked eggs/bacon, and undercooked potatoes. The entire meal from beginning to end just wasn't good.  I wasn't expecting a 5 star meal, however, I would have expected food that wasn't burnt or overcooked.

I been coming to "Cracked Egg" for some years now. I been to mostly all the locations around the Vally! And I can say that I've always had a great and good experience! The service the staff always very great at customer service and very welcoming! Not to mention the food here is amazing!!!!!! I will always be loyal customer

Right down the street from my brothers spot.   Good Breakfast. "Synthetic ambiance". It'll be years before flavor meets flavor here. Know what I mean? Just imagine if Pork Store Cafe was serving food in a newly built office with booths. It just wouldn't be the same. 3.5 stars, rounded up because the digestibles were crackin.

I ordered a Mexican Skillet and my friend ordered a Western omelet with egg whites. Both of us got toast, which came already buttered. The skillet was delicious. I substituted hash browns for seasoned potatoes because I prefer a little crisp and it was perfect. There was a little bit more cheese than I preferred but still palatable. The coffee was good- even came with fresh vanilla creamer. Good service and good food. Can't ask for anything more.

This place would have gotten 4 stars if it weren't for my omelet being made wrong . When it was made correctly it was amazing. The coffee cake was so delicious I don't understand how some reviews say it's bad . The service isn't the best but it's not horrible. I just wish my omelet would have been correct so I could have eaten with my fianc but u had to eat alone since I had to wait for a new one to be made.
The best brunch or breakfast spot in Vegas! I have to come and eat here at least once when visiting Vegas! Great friendly customer service snd outstanding food!

I thought that this breakfast & lunch cafe was so-so. My omelette was a little on the bland & dry side, yet I ate it anyway due to having a huge appetite after being in a casino all night.   This cafe is on the busy side, and seats fill up quickly. Seating is somewhat limited within the front of the restaurant. I wound up sitting at the bar area where servers tend to leave silverware & napkins to be rolled next to my plate. Not cool. They apparently didn't get the hint after I pushed the silverware container away, remaining oblivious as to the reason why I moved it.  Check out needs to move faster. Only one cash register, and the line can get long to the point where your butt is in someone's face due to where they are sitting. That's no exaggeration.   Altogether, Cracked Egg is not bad. Its 24 hours, so it has that going for a local venue.

Ive been here once and it was probably the greatest experience ive had a breakfast place. It was my first time at a breakfast place and this is what youd expect after watching alot of 80s and 90s movies that have diners. it seems really authentic and just "diner" is a good word for it. The food is very close to home, u know, the whole, scrambled eggs, toast, bacon, and it overall made the breakfast experience greater because it was so familiar...   Id reccomend this to any family looking for a good breakfast place that is casual but if youre looking for something fancy, id look elsewhere. Also, a good date spot!
Nothing out of this world. Food was good, did not eat there so I really cannot comment on service. I will say this, they were pretty fast.
Excellent food and plenty of food. The carnitas omelette was delicious. I will definitely come back here when visiting Las Vegas.

We came to the cracked egg after a morning run. We chose them because of the good reviews and they were open before 8:00. We were not disappointed. They have a gluten sensitive menu that we ordered a blueberry muffin. That and both of our omelets were very good. They do have a kids menu but our little guy just ate off our plates. All in all very good!

Having this place right around the corner makes me very, very happy! It's definitely a solid breakfast spot for when you don't feel like cooking but also don't feel like going to far. I wouldn't say you need to venture across town to check this place out... Definitely not that phenomenal of a breakfast spot but it's enough to satisfy the taste buds!   The first time I went, I was feeling adventurous and wanted to try something I had never had before! This being said, I went with the Monte Cristo. The dish in and of itself is out of the ordinary and I honestly REALLY enjoyed it! It was weird but a good weird! I would definitely get it again.   My second time (and third... And probably will again on my fourth visit) here I got the bacon cheeseburger skillet. I love this skillet! It's the perfect mix of lunch and breakfast in one plate!! Want a cheeseburger but want eggs and potatoes too? Boom! It's all right there in your skillet.   One day I do plan on trying an omelette of theirs that has polish sausage in it (being Polish, that'll be a real taste challenge!). When I do I'll be sure to let everyone know how it is!   The thing that makes this place truly awesome, is the service. I've never had a bad experience with the service here! Granted, I've somehow managed to get the same server the last two times I've been, it doesn't matter. From what I could see all the staff is friendly and on their game!   Like I said, not the kind of place you need to venture across town for, but if your in the neighborhood or live around the corner like me, than it's worth a stop!
No veggies patties and the corned beef hash was subpar at best. For a diner so close to the state border, they really seemed uncomfortable with out of towners. Great coffee tho.

It started off rocky for us, place was packed full I was shocked we walked in and were seated right away.  Country themed, clean, calming and relaxing.  I really didn't care for the Corned Beef hash & my boyfriend's French toast was kind of sad, and too dark. We asked for the Manager,  Ashley was so nice she asked if she could get us anything else we'd like... we were unsure.  I decided I was craving French toast and I really can't eat it because I'm allergic to wheat.  So I ordered it for myself but really I was planning on eating two bites and making the bf have it since his first order was just bad.  The French toast was delicious the second time around, nice golden brown.  By that time the place has cleared out and I decided maybe I will get something I can eat since they passed my "french toast test". Let's be honest if a brunch place can't nail French toast I wouldn't of stuck around.  So I wasn't crazy about the Corned beef hash serving I had, I figured I'll come back and try it another day maybe without onion next time and decided on the "garden omelet" it has mushroom and spinach on it.  I ordered it from the Gluten Free menu, totally loved the fresh ingredients veggies and melted cheese.    **They're Gluten Free Menu is the biggest I've seen anywhere ELSE!**  We plan on going back and bringing more friends/family here because I prefer this place over the Egg & I.  I want to try the coffee next time too. I don't know what I was thinking a soft drink with Lunch.

..the menu is extensive and the food is very good... not gourmet (for that you must visit 'Kitchen Table' over on Horizon Ridge & Valley Verde).. .. but all items at TCE that we've tried so far we would readily order again, and the service is always sharp... ..if we can say anything needing improvement it's for management to get more involved when patrons get unruly, and just 'carry-on' uncontrollably.. ..today there was a group of young teens just completely out of control.. creating a noise disturbance that could be easily heard throughout the entire restaurant.. no one from the restaurant made any motion to limit their behavior in any way..  ..sorry.. that's just not acceptable.. we all are not going out to eat under those circumstances.. would hope/ and expect they pay more attention on behalf of ALL their customers in the future.

The Cracked Egg you have done it! Won my future business! I've been trying to find a couple more breakfast places to go to on a regular basis and it's been super difficult! I seem to live by tons of these breakfast places however the past few that I've been to have been hard to beat my all time favorite Pancake House!   This past Sunday as always I treated my mother to Sunday Brunch and told her that we would try a different place. The Cracked Egg was chosen based on the other errands that had to be ran in that area of town. When we pulled up I just knew the wait was going to be ridiculous based on the amount of cars that were parked outside, boy was I wrong! As I sat patiently waiting I couldn't help but notice all these cute little pictures and signs that had some interesting quotes on them. Less than a 10 minute wait we were seated and provided our menus! Customer service here is very good! Every staff member was smiling and greeting us and the whole vibe just seemed to be pleasant.   The variety of items on the menu is pretty good! There are tons of things I wanted to try but because an omelet was what my taste buds were screaming about I decided on "The Big Bad Wolf" Mom ordered "The Garden Patch". Who doesn't love cool names for the items they order? Some probably find it cheesy (no pun intended) but I love the creativeness! You get an option of potatoes, toast and coffee cake with any of the omelet's. Since I was already drooling over the previous YELPER's pics of the coffee cake I went with that of course! Something cool that they do is change the flavor of them every so often. Mine just happened to be apple! Yum! When our food arrived everything looked and tasted great! I had to give them a couple extra brownie points for nailing my request for egg whites on the omelet! Majority places NEVER get it correct and I always have to end up sending it back. Can't be trying to kill me with all that cholesterol!   Check out was great! Our cashier was friendly just like everyone else we encountered that morning! Asked how our dining experience was and even welcomed us back as soon as possible! I noticed as I was paying for our breakfast that they have a rewards program and when I fill this form out I could get $8 off the next breakfast! I can't wait to return! Awesome job guys!

So this is the second time I been to this location and I remember why I didn't go back now.The food is not bad but it also is not anything to boost and holla about either. It's a little pricey for the for the taste of the food being so mediocre.   The place is small so it gets loud here very quickly as it starts to fill up. There is no outside seating either so that does not help with how loud and how packed it gets. There is no waiting area really, there is about 2 or 3 chairs if those are taken then you can go outside and sit at one of the 3 picnic tables if those are not full otherwise you stand around outside or sit in your car.  This time I got the build your own skillet with hot links, chorizo, bell peppers and spinach. The problem with was that the chorizo was dryer that sand at a beach the potatoes that come with it was not seasoned at all they tasted really bland (like I put them in a skillet waited to they were cooked and then started to eat them right away) then there was literally like 3 leafs of spinach in the whole thing, had me upset.  Then there is the coffee cake that's suppose to be on point, ummm no it is not. It tasted like white cake with some melted chocolate chips and some time of cream cheese glaze (what you would find on a cinnamon roll) it's served nice and hot but that's just trickery to make you think that you are getting a fresh slice but in reality they stuck it in the microwave before they bring it to you. Oh and the orange juice is the same price as a gallon in the store which I normally wouldn't have a problem with but the fact that it is such a small glass is where I run into the issue for that items.  The best part of the whole experience there was the waitress that waited on us. She prompt with everything and extremely nice as well. Also the food and drinks amen out quickly as well.  Well thanks for reading and have a good day.
Fast and friendly service mixed with great food. Wait times can be long on weekends, but well worth it.
My daughter and I eat breakfast here once a week.  The service is fast and friendly (even if they are busy, it's worth a short wait).  The food is absolutely excellent and I love the warm atmosphere.

I'm going to give this restaurant five stars mainly because I think their overall rating should be a solid four. We enjoyed good service and delicious food. I ordered the enchilada omelette minus the tortilla chips, and it was delicious. I substituted fresh fruit in place of the hash brown potatoes and it was the perfect way to end my meal.  We arrived around 9 AM on Saturday morning and we were seated right away. By the time we left there were a lot of people waiting for a table. I recommend this restaurant for a great breakfast, and we will come back again!
Such a bad experience! Served orange juice with a piece of floating blue plastic! That's great! Next, serve me protein pancakes with a side of hair! Won't be coming back!

My husband and I make it apparent to come here at least once a week. We absolutely enjoy the atmosphere, the people and the food! Their country potatoes are my favorite! I'm a huge breakfast foodie and this place is at the near top of my list. Every once in awhile they trial new specials such as their chicken and waffles and cinnamon roll pancakes. SO DELICIOUS!!!!!!

Daughter and I ate here for a late breakfast. I LOVE biscuits and gravy, but it often times doesn't like me. I took a chance this day. It was AMAZING!!! And best part, NO tummy ache. My meal came with hash browns and two eggs(I know, not a lo-cal meal, but so very tasty). It was busy, but service was prompt. I was so into my meal I don't recall what the daughter had, but she ate it all! We will be back. A must try! They have lunch, too.

We came here during the lunch break of our workshop. The food was diner-quality but we had a good time. The server was kind, she divided the bill between the eight of us, and paying was a quick process.

5 visits and it's always been great! The servers have all been friendly, helpful and cheerful. The food has been great and I've been getting from different parts of the menu each time. The only thing to keep in mind is you may have to wait 20-30 minutes during the busy hours, that's not incoming but keep it in mind (I've overheard others complaining about it while we've been waiting)  We come here almost once a week and we'll continue to do so !

Salmonella outbreak be damned, I'm eating my runny yolked eggs anyway.   I went to the Cracked Egg around noon on Sunday and had to wait about 10 minutes for a table. My plan was not to eat too much because I knew I had to save room to stuff my face at the M buffet later that evening. After reading all the reviews about the big portions, I split the croissant sandwich and seasoned potatoes with my mom. It was definitely a knife and fork sandwich especially because I ordered the eggs over easy. There's a reason why you can't get an over easy egg mcmuffin. It was a delicious, cheesy mess.  I particularly loved the seasoned potatoes, which were super crispy. I can just imagine eating a whole plate of them with gravy! The bf also raved about the hash browns, but I think the seasoned potatoes were better. I also had a bite of my dad's coffee cake which was a bit too sweet for me. It looked like a cornbread square and was less dense than the coffee cakes I'm used to.  Overall, definitely a good place for breakfast or lunch. I mean, even in Vegas you can only eat so many buffets afterall...

So my husband took me here for a special occasion. It was him, myself, and my 18 month old. I was really excited to try The Cracked Egg as I love trying breakfast places, and I wanted to compare it to some other local places we have been. I wanted to love the experience so much, but I couldn't. I didn't feel that relaxed, comfortable, local feel. As in, the service was below average. I understand places such as here get busy but I worked in the restaurant industry for years so while I can be flexible and understanding I still expect good service. Our server hurried over and asked immediately wanted to order. I asked a couple of questions, we asked recommendations (she did not give us any). I wanted to do a build your own because there were a few extra things I wanted to add to my skillet. She told me just order the corned beef hash skillet off the menu instead of doing build your own (in an annoyed tone) and said it cost less (which it did not, and she said it in an insulting way as if I was trying to jip her or something). I took her recommendation anyways. I love corned beef hash, I order it almost every breakfast place I go but this was not up there compared to some other restaurant's in the areas of quality, taste, and value. I will say the coffee cake was to die for!! I absolutely loved it. The texture, temperature, and flavor was perfect. Our server wasn't seen again the whole meal except to come over and grab our plates (I wasn't done yet) and give us the check. I felt rushed in and out. I just sadly wish our dining experience out on this occasion could have been better. I was disappointed.

It's no wonder this hidden gem was so packed when I got here! The service is great and the food is phenomenal!!! This is going to be one of my favorite places to eat. They have a loyalty program as well. I'm sure it's a seasonal item but you MUST order the pumpkin coffee cake!!! It's so amazing! I about died from the euphoria of just being in the presence of this cake!!! Order it and thank me later!
Okay  But overpriced to expensive for nothing special just average every day breakfast

Gluten-free and Las Vegas doesn't go well together.  When you do find a breakfast place that does cater to the gluten-free people in Vegas, you have to visit!  We wanted breakfast, but nothing on the strip is gluten-free friendly.  We searched online and found "The Cracked Egg."  A local breakfast spot that has three locations in Vegas that indeed caters to people eating gluten-free!  We were excited and drove to the south Vegas location.  After going the wrong way off the freeway, we turned around and found "The Cracked Egg."  It is in a nice little outdoor strip mall/  Easy to find once you get going the right way. Upon walking in, we were greeted by the hostess, told them we would like the gluten-free menu and that we wanted to eat outside on their patio.  If you get a chance and it isn't 100 degrees outside yet, take advantage of eating outside on the patio!  The gluten-free menu is two full pages!  Yes...you can order gluten-free pancakes and french toast here!!  After studying the menus, we decided upon an omelet and a scramble. Both were huge portioned and VERY, VERY delicious!  It's places like this that makes me love breakfast food!  The staff here is very friendly and helpful.  They always had a smile on their faces.  Oh...I can't forget...they have those chocolate mints up at the cash register.  The pricing is a few dollars more than I expected, but it's a breakfast spot and it's in Vegas.  While it may not be on the strip, "The Cracked Egg" is about only a 5-10 min. drive away.  It well worth the drive to have a breakfast that's delicious and gluten-free!

My boyfriend and I came in on a Saturday morning and let me just say that this place was PACKED. We asked if we could sit at the bar without waiting and they said it was first come first serve so we grabbed two seats. The server was very attentive and made sure our drinks were always filled (huge deal for me). She recommended the coffee cake as one of our sides and it was pretty good. Our main food was alright it wasn't anything special and really over priced but the customer service was off the charts! Would maybe go back and try something different! The pancakes are HUGE a short stack is more than enough!

Honestly this place is a joke pancakes 15 dollars that's crazy the workers can't even speak English so that's weird trying to give a family business money but not when they r ripping you off cute place YES .. but the food is not good enough for the price

Today was scheduled to be very busy with little room for disappointments. Cracked Egg representatives did not help prevent my low brow for them today.  It's is for this reason,  that I attribute my dissatisfaction to the led than perfect rating that I've given.   In effort to keeping on schedule, and allowing for preparation for my next stop,  I opted to call in my order. Only to find my calls unanswered on both attempts. The parking lot illustrated  that there should not be many to warrant a busy occurrence such as answered calls. So I found myself walking in to place my order in person. From there, everything  went without a hitch.  Food was made so very timely and there was more than enough staff to accommodate my phone order.   I don't like writing bad reviews so when I do experience less them 5 star service,  I include as much detail as possible. There was nothing wrong with their phones because a test call went  right through while I waited for my food to arrive and my earlier call was mere 40 feet away.   Bottom line, this place still rocks. Just don't rely on saving time by calling in ahead. There may be something that prevents the call from being taken.  :/

We are visiting from Cali and we came here with a party of 8 on a busy Saturday morning. They said there would be a 20 min wait. But we were seated in 10 mins. Within 5 mins had our drinks and our orders were taken.   I am a omelet conisour so I ordered a "Wolf" omelet. It was incredible, oh and instead of toast I ordered the crumb cake. And it was amazing. We all ordered different things and it was all excellent!!   So the bottom line is, the food is awesome, the service is top notch and the prices were very reasonable. In my book, this place is worth 5 STARS!!!!!!!!

I ate here this morning for the first time and I absolutely loved my food ... I had the Croissant French toast cover in fresh fruit and a side of Bacon.....  I already know what I'll have next time.... No complaint

This place would get 5 stars if not for the biggest issue with the cracked egg...PRICES ARE WAY TOO HIGH!! I enjoy the food and it's always busy. The help is nice and courteous. The food is good but not expensive good. The can afford the prices thanks to the upper to high class homes right next door ;).
Food was alright! I think their coffee cake was awesome. Service was not bad, but I believe I have better breakfast options elsewhere.
Awesome place to eat. Very good food. Very reasonable. Fast friendly employees. I love there breakfast. A+++

I went to the Cracked Egg with my son at his suggestion.  I was hoping for a yummy breakfast on a chilly morning.  I ordered the Eggs Benedict with hashbrowns.  The eggs were OK and the hashbrowns were not exactly greasy, but nasty anyway.  The service was good, the country interior was uninteresting and the restaurant very clean.  My son will eat anything and he was less than enthusiastic about his meal as well.
Came here for their gluten free pancakes. Was so happy!!! Best to go during the work week towards closing, otherwise it's super packed.

This place never fails to impress.  The food is consistently delicious and the staff is wonderful.  More impressive, the quality carries from location to location.  I've tried a lot on the menu and yet to be disappointed, even lunch is good.  Mainly I come for breakfast though.  Scrambles, omelets and benny's... oh my!  I think the southwest scramble is my personal favorite.  Spicy and yummy just like me.  If spicy isn't your thing, try the south shore scramble.  Chicken and avocado will set you up for a good day.
The food here is always soo good. The Nutella s'mores stuffed French toast is to die for.

I've dined here before and the food has always been good except for today when I ordered the huevos rancheros. It is the worst huevos I have ever eaten. Service was good just sub par food. I would either improve the dish or take it off the menu..

My BF and I go out to eat every weekend to a breakfast restaurant. We love the cracked egg!! We've tried several different breakfast restaurants and the cracked egg is our favorite. We frequent this location and love all their dishes. We haven't ordered anything we don't like! Everything come out hot, fresh and very flavorful. The only complaint I would have is the fact that they don't use their AC much. I'm not sure if it's because all the windows they have or not but it's super hot in there, temperature hot! I would rate 5 stars if they would adjust their temperature!

I ate at this location for the first time today, and I was very happy with the experience.  I ordered "The Carnitas" omelette, and to say that it would melt in your mouth would be an understatement.  The seasoned pork in this omelette tasted as if it had been slowly marinated over several days, and then put into this omelette.  The seasoned pork and the other items in this omelette created a blend of flavors that can only be described as outstanding.  The servers were of the type that anticipate your needs, and you hardly have to ask them for anything--first rate!!!  The price was comparable to Ihop and Dennys.  However, the service and the quality/taste of the food was waaaay better than either Ihop or Dennys.  I will definitely eat here again.
Delicious.  Got the breakfast sandwiches for me and the wife.  Soooo good.  Worth the ride to Henderson.

We found Cracked Egg on apple Maps for close breakfast places. With a name like Cracked Egg, we thought this would be a trendy new breakfast place similar to "Snooze", "Over-Easy", or Cured Ham." When we pulled up we realized it was a pretty old place with very little done for design or any upkeep. The inside looks like an out-of-date Denny's... and that is not saying much since all Denny's look out-of-date already. This is the look we would expect from a 1 star Chinese buffet.  We got seated quickly despite being pretty busy and had our waitress take our drink order within a couple of minutes. I love good service. I noticed that all the menu's said all the coffee served was "100% Guatemalan Coffee" so we ordered two cups. Nothing about what we drank was exotic nor originating any further south than Mesa. When I asked the waitress the blend of the coffee, she just indicated that it was a cheap house blend and not from Guatemala. After our drinks, the waitress took our order pretty quickly, I ordered Eggs Benedict and my girlfriend ordered Country Fried Steak, both with potatoes, hers with toast.  At first appearance, it looked like the cook was limited to only ingredients what were brown, light brown, or off-white. Nothing appealing about how our dishes looked. A pop of color from fresh herbs or onions or tomatoes  or hell, even garnish would have made this plate look less like an Oliver Twist meal and more like a $20 per person meal.  My Eggs Benedict came with hard boiled yolks (see picture). Immediate turn off. The Country fried steak was dried out and a mess. The menu described the gravy as "Sausage Gravy" but we were hard pressed to find any remnants of sausage, nor any flavor of sausage. It tasted like milk and flour with pepper.  Salt... that is what this meal needed to start with. None of my Country Potatoes nor my GF's Breakfast hash had any seasoning. No salt, no pepper, no herbs, no anything really. My breakfast potatoes bored my tastebuds within the first bite. The potato pieces could easily be mistaken for croutons. No party in my mouth from this place with those potatoes.  Overall, the service is great and impressive, the wait staff takes the time to make sure you have everything and the tag team of servers ensured that we got all our food quickly. The food needs help. DESPERATE help. The blandness of all the food may appeal to the elderly regeneration, but for the increasing foodies population, the experience just begs to have more. The visual appearance of the meal is pretty bland, followed by no seasoning, improper egg techniques and overall, BORING appearance. Food should be an experience not just a necessity. This place would have been great during the depression when the act of receiving food was enough, but in this modern age of taste and abundant choices, this place really falls behind.  The menu needs a serious overhaul, the cooks need to not be afraid of using fresh ingredients, herbs, and seasonings, the owner has to want to be relevant within the restaurant industry and the interior needs help... Bad help.  If you are looking for comfort food with no regard of palate, then this is the place, if you think that a $40 breakfast for two should have something redeeming, this is not the place. The only reasons why it didn't get one star, is because the service was decent.

The cracked egg in Henderson- if you're looking for breakfast and you're in town this is the place. Gets busy during prime time but worth a 5 or 10 minute wait to get in. Prices are reasonable to proportion.  Food is always great but what gets me here is the service.  No matter how busy they get or how hard they work the staff is always friendly and going out of their way to make sure you're happy.

Really nice breakfast joint. Get the coffee cake vs toast. Wow. Just wow. I had the Mexican skillet with salsa verde. Chorizo was perfect. Salsa verde was sweet but fit the dish perfect with the picked jalapeos. You won't be disappointed

A little on the pricy side. 9.00 for eggs and bacon  I decided to stop by here to try something different.  I got tired of eating the same thing over and over again.  I got seated right away which was awesome since i was on my lunch hour.  Imagine my surprise when I saw the sticker price on the items.  9.00 for eggs and bacon.  The bacon was extra crispy just as i like it but i don't think i can justify spending that much money on just eggs and bacon.  The food was good but the price was just too high.

I really enjoyed my meal here, i kept eating even after I was full. I got the crossait (sp?) sandwhich with the seasoned potatoes... oohh god those potatoes were so freakin good ... i will definetly go back again.... the oj was oddly pricey tho

I've been coming  with my daughter, family, and friends for a couple of years now and have never been disappointed. There's always a 10-15 minute wait, but the food and customer service are always worth it.

My wife and I went to The Cracked Egg today for a late breakfast - what can I say? We like to sleep in on Sundays.  I probably ordered badly choosing a sandwich at what is undeniably a breakfast joint, I can't recall the name, but it was roast beef, red onion, tomato and lettuce on sourdough sliced bread with "horseradish mayonaise" - The sandwich was of undeniable high quality, but I was disappointed that I couldn't detect any distinctive horseradish taste in the mayo - it just tasted like standard Best Foods to me. I quite enjoyed the seasoned potatoes that accompanied my meal.  Wife had a skillet of some sort involving scrambled eggs with cream cheese and scallions, some hash browns and toasted English muffins. She enjoyed the lot, although wasn't so impressed with her hash browns - we both have very exacting standards when it comes to these.  Overall we were prettty happy with our meal there - I would definitely order differently next time. For a ten buck sandwich I received something too close to what I could easily slap together at home, but the menu is reasonably extensive and the place was doing a roaring trade late Sunday morning. We will be back for further exploration.
Love this place! My favorite breakfast/brunch spot. Always good food and good service.

This was my first time going to the cracked egg and I must say, I was not happy with my experience. First of all, the service took way too long. Second,  there was a lot of cross contamination going on. I have went to school for culinary so I know all the requirements working in a kitchen and serving food. My server kept rubbing his nose because it was running. Also, he coughed in his hands and then went to vet the toast out and put it on my plate and served me. Then as I'm eating I found an eye lash in my potatoes. The server was caucasian and had tattoos. Will never go there again thanks to him.
I ordered the corned beef and hash and was extremely disappointed by it. I've eaten here before and the food was great! Very let down this time. Probably will not be coming back.

Very nice servers. The food was very good the first visit. Second visit we had a party of 6, nothing was fresh. Food was coming out in spurts, we had to wait 15 minutes for one dish while they served a dish before that to one of our other guests. They were all over the place. I will give them another chance as they were busy but there isn't any excuse for this type of service.

Great place for breakfast!   I had one of the breakfast skillets and everything in it was perfect.  Everything I saw looked incredible.  I will definitely come back here a lot more.  It looks like the best place in town to get breakfast.  The lunch menu didn't look too bad either!  The few downsides of it, is I went on a Sunday at 11am and there was about a 30 minute wait for a table.  I don't know why they have such a small location for the business that they do?!   The service is a tad on the slow side, but they do get the orders right, so that's not a big deal.  However, if you are in a hurry, this is not the place for you.  It is in a busy shopping center to begin with, so the parking can be a bit of a challenge.  And it is very loud in there, so it you're looking for a nice quiet brunch place, this also isn't the place for you.   But if you don't mind these issues, the food is definitely worth it!
Very friendly, every dish was great, quick and hot! We had no problems substituting or adding to out plates and the coffee cake was soooo good!!

There is no better place to go for a great, easy breakfast in Vegas for the price.  They have such a wide selection of egg dishes for breakfast, delicious stuffed french toast, a wide range of lunch selections... total food boner.  The eggs are always done perfectly, the toast is crisp but not burnt, the service is excellent... it's an awesome modern diner.  Also, Cracked Egg is giving Poppy's Frozen Yogurt a run for its money with the jailbait cashiers.
We came here the morning after a wedding with a large group of 12. Cory our waitress was so sweet and made sure our meal was perfect. The food was delicious and we will return to see her soon.
For ever now we have been looking for a a good Ruben in town I HAVE FOUND IT   It was good food, great fries and great service.

I came in a with a Groupon to give this place a try  Wasn't expecting much...  so I was blown away with great service, good biscuts and gravy, and the best Monte Cristo I've had in decades   I'll be back as soon as I can work off the calories
The food was great and I'd recommend the hash browns for sure. The reason it's not 5 stars the waitress wasn't attentive enough but still great place overall

What is up with the hard poached eggs????  I'm going to try to request it runny next time. A weird to thing to request for Eggs Benedict.. The first time I thought it was an oversight. The second time made me believe it's a regular thing, which it probably might be, according to the other reviews. Cmon, when the word 'egg' is in your title AND you're a breakfast place...  It's a shame because the chorizo eggs Benedict was very flavorful.   Service is generally very good and the area is clean despite the hustle and bustle.

I've been to the 215/Rainbow or 215/Green Valley locations 20+ times.  As you can tell, my family and I love this place.  Great food, I love the chicken fried steak and hash browns.  Some family members love the coffee cake and others love the Eggs Benedict.

Great omelets and absolutely the best coffee cake I have ever had. Ask them to split an omelet and you will still have plenty of food and room for the delicious coffee cake. Very friendly and efficient staff as well. Nice to have a good local breakfast place. This is what Original Pancake house used to be.

This place is so good. The skillets are by far the best I've ever had. They make a new batch of coffee cake when they run out and it's always a different flavor. I wish I had known that before I came because I ended up with strawberry peanut butter and it was definitely very different. It wasn't bad but it wasn't what I was expecting. This little place is about 5 minutes from the strip and it was packed when I came on a Monday morning

One of our favorite breakfast spots to go to. We go to this location the most. Gets crowded at times but it's pretty spacious compared to other cafes. They have plenty of seating inside and outside. Depending on the time you go , we usually go on Sunday's , a little later in the am and have never had to wait no more longer than 10-15 minutes for a table. For as early as they have to be up, staff is always friendly and welcoming. We've had Andi and Steve several times as our server and do an excellent job but from what I remember all servers are awesome. They are very attentive and genuine. My favorite dish is the cordon bleu skillet. If you're like me and love to eat sometimes thats just not enough. I get the banana chocolate chip pancakes as well and can get just one or a two stack instead the 3 but you have to request for it I believe. Just check the menu. They are really great about meeting your requests on substitutions too! Highly recommended to try.

Hey it's a great breakfast place! The coffee cake is such a nice treat , great menu to please anyone breakfast and lunch ,salads etc...  service is hit amd miss but it won't keep me away.  it gets busy so go early!

Super quick service.  My coffee cup was continually full.  The food tasted good (pancakes were fluffy, chicken well seasoned and scrambled egg whites cooked perfectly) and it was definitely a fair price.

At last: edible breakfast in Las Vegas.  Husband and I have tried so many breakfast spots in Vegas that it's not even funny, and they have ranged from "meh" to "OMG no." This is the first time we've really enjoyed the breakfast foods we ordered.  I am aware some of you will immediately reject this review because you think Vegas breakfasts taste just like breakfast anywhere else. I love you, but this review is not for you.  For those of who you KNOW that tasty breakfast isn't really Vegas' *thing*, come HERE. This place is good.  The pancakes, etc. were NOT tasteless. The fruit was actually ripe. The Hollandaise was delicious and generously given. The coffee was actually good!  Literally the only thing that might be annoying is the condescending signage. (They actually have the "There is no Wi-Fi. Talk to each other. Pretend it's 1995." To which I say: https://mostlysignssomeportents.tumblr.com/post/92606477500/dunebat-coldswarkids-edwardspoonhands  )  It is with a SPIRIT OF TRUE IRONY that I leave this review for them online, which is where we FOUND this place, and which would not have been possible in 1995. Ha!
Easy to find and easy parking.  Good prices.  The coffee was just ok.  I got the joes scramble and it was good but not great.   Service was very good

Amazing place for breakfast! Staff is excellent,  on top of everything and quick worth every request. Food is fresh and tastes great. Reading some of the other reviews and we think its hilarious someone would complain theres no TV monitors, if your looking for that type of atmosphere don't come here. Come here for great conversation with your friends or family. Put down the phone and get off Facebook cause there's no wifi. Enjoy your food! You'll be happy you did. This was our first visit and we will definitely be back!!

My favorite breakfast spot in henderson. I've been coming here for at least 10 years. The food and service is always good. Wish they had better coffee and that they dropped the check soon after your meal was served. Most of the time I have to ask for it. Come early on weekends or expect to wait as this restaurant gets very busy.
This place gets two stars because the service was good. Our waitress was accommodating. But the food wasn't that great. The food feels like something frozen and got microwaved.

The coffee cake!!  My only issue was on Memorial Day/Veterans day they would only give military discount if in uniform... Most of us don't go around in uniform to eat!  Overall it was a good experience and the service was quick

We are working in the area and saw the 3.99 brakefast sign. So decided to have some brunch there few days ago .food is good .our server was a little bit confused but she end up doing good job. Recommended.
Food was great and came out super fast. The entire staff was friendly. I will come back

Their food here is so flavorful, I always enjoy everything I order and so does my boyfriend. Only reason they don't get 5 stars is because the service always kinda sucks. Servers always seem irritated, I'm sure they know how busy it's going to be on a weekend by now.

Waitress was very nice, and they refill your coffee frequently. Plenty of seating too. I wasn't very impressed with the food. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either. The pancakes were good. Very typical diner food and feel. I'd recommend it if you're looking for an old-fashioned American breakfast.

this has always been my go to breakfast spot. one of the only places in vegas with gluten free blueberry pancakes! the service is always friendly and their coffee is super good. great for take out as well.

Finally! A place with gluten free blueberry pancakes. my 2nd all time favorite food :) I've been here like 5 times in the past two weeks and its so good. The side of fruit is amazing too. grapefruit slices, blackberries, raspberries, strawberries, and sliced melon!  Fresh squeezed orange juice is the cherry on top to an amazing meal. The staff is very friendly and accommodating as well. My new favorite breakfast spot :)

Some of the worst service ever ! We have a large family so we understand that waiting for table is almost always a must. We arrive to we're told 20 minutes . We waited over an hour and when we finally heard out name and hostess (a guy) was rude and less then welcoming . The first attempt was to sit my large family of 7 at a table that fits 4! Seriously??? In the mean time try sit a party of 2 in a corner booth that would fit our family. We finally get a table that still only seat 4 comfortable only to get our drinks messed up. The coffee cake was cold and it took 10 minutes to get an extra plate!   I'm disappointed in this location !! Never again

The Cracked Egg. I looked up nearby breakfast places and came across this one. For some reason I felt like eating eggs and how appropriate.  Walked in and was seated pretty quickly. Sat down and was immediately greeted by our server. She quickly let us order our coffee and we browsed the menu. I ordered the Cakes & Eggs Combo while the husband ordered the Huervos Rancheros. Waited for a little bit as the entire restaurant was pretty busy. I like basic breakfast. Nothing heavy or I would have to roll out of the restaurant. Cakes, eggs, and bacon were good. My husband didn't speak for a straight 15 minutes while he was wolfing down his breakfast. We were FULL.  Overall pretty good food and decent prices. Our server was pretty helpful and she didn't stress us to leave even though it was super busy. Nice place to grab breakfast.

Management soured my experience.  Typically I love this place, but usually eat at Egg Works (my friend prefers it)  However, I had purchased a Groupon to The Cracked Egg so I needed to use it.  The catch. I accidentally purchased a groupon that I could only use Mon-Fri.  Since I am always at work M-F, It ended up expiring.  If anyone knows anything about Groupon it states right on the page that the value you used to purchase the groupon never expires.  So I figured taking it in on a Sunday, at least I would be able to use the original amount towards my meal.  The server curtly told me that they would not accept it.  When I asked to see a manager, she came over with an attitude and refused to acknowledge my explanation or even listen to anything I wanted to say.  She kept repeating we will not take it.  I felt that she was incredibly rude and will unfortunately not return to this location because of her.  It is really unfortunate for me, because the food was absolutely delicious.  Probably one of the better breakfasts I've eaten.  But I refuse to go to a restaurant where the management will not even listen to what I have to say.  I also feel that it would not have effected the store if she would have honored the original groupon price.  Thank goodness for me I can still go to Egg Works.  They have always treated me with respect and smiles.

Good breakfast place, really nothing special, but not horrible either.  Wife's tropical french toast was dry and overly sweet. The place was full of diner's so they do have a following. The coffee is strong and good. Sugar dispenser and more creamers would be nice. We will have to try again sometime, but probaly not likely.
Since I moved to Vegas 3 years ago This place has always had great service and food. They are quick, efficient and very friendly. I recommend this place to everybody!

This place is clearly popular since the wait to get in is usually 20 minutes. The problem is their inability to keep track of who is waiting and for how long. I took two friends here today, was told a 20 minute wait. After 35 minutes, I asked the girl at the desk who said "there's just two people in front of you." I sat on a bench in front of this person for the next 20 minutes as they sat group after group. After seeing at least 5 groups get seated, I asked again, only to be met with confused looks and NO apology. I could see the panic as the front end staff tried to figure out what they could do, which should have been seat us immediately. That didn't happen so we left. I won't be going back to this place ever again.

Laid back basic breakfast place. Inside it reminds me of a breakfast place in So. Cal. I like the feel of it. Have had a variety of dishes. After trying different meals, I usually stick with one of the basic eggs + dishes. Hot links and Eggs are my fave right now. Spicy! Not too too spicy though.   Was not impressed with the coffee cake. Was expecting something denser, with a crumble but this was like Angel food cake with strawberry jam and a drizzle of icing. Not my thing. Coffee was pretty good, they could have kept it coming but were quite busy.  All in all, they deliver just what I expect of a breakfast place, though I would prefer to be happily surprised.
By far my favorite breakfast place! The service was great and food is delicious! I can't wait to go back!

i love the whole wheat pancakes...they have a delicious cinnamon flavor to them.  they're best with bananas baked in!  i also love that you can order just one if you want; and that you can get a side of straight berries.    there's usually a wait, which is the only bummer, but it's worth it.  and once you sit down, they don't rush you, which is nice.

OMG!!!!!!!!! If you give this place anything less then 4 stars then you need your head checked. Unless there was a bug or hair or some other foreign object in your food, or the service was completely rude or terrible, then you've got NOTHING to complain about. Banana walnut pancakes are incredible.

On vacation & looking for something other than a buffet.  Found this place on yelp & it didn't disappoint.  We walked right in with no wait to sit.  We ordered kids chocolate chip pancakes with a side of bacon (3 slices) and scrambled eggs w/cheddar cheese & bacon with (not so) season potatoes & coffee cake.  The coffee cake came out warmed right away.  This is not your average coffee cake.  Its light and fluffy similar to an angel cake with strawberry & apple inside.  Apparently the flavor changes day to day - surprise.  We played 4 games of tic tac toe & the food arrived - that was quick.  The eggs were cooked perfectly.  The potato were very bland.  My son gobbled up his pancakes but was full about 1 1/2 cakes through.  He said he was glad we chose this place - score.  Also the waitress was great.  Prices are about average.  I would definitely come back.
Bestest breakfast spot in Vegas! Their coffee cake is amazing and the service is always great

The Cracked Egg is traditional breakfast food, but nothing special in my opinion. Yeah it's a smaller location compared to IHOP and Cracker Barrel and whatnot, but it's still decent food. Nothing special or something to remember, but I did enjoy. If I'm in the area I'll be sure to stop by again, but again it wasn't over the top!

Some of the best breakfast in town! The hostesses are young and ditzy sometimes, but the waitress we usually get is always super nice and attentive. The coffee cake NEVER fails and is always delish, no matter what flavor! I highly suggest the Taylor's scramble, build your own skillets, and the oatmeal. It's not your average oatmeal. Comes with half and half, raisins, granola, fresh berries, brown sugar, etc. It is the best oatmeal I have ever eaten and the ingredients and so fresh. If you join their breakfast club, they send you coupons in the mail all the time too. There really isn't a bad thing to say about this place, except that if you get there between 9-10am, you are going to wait a while for a seat! My boyfriend and I visit at least twice a month!

Visiting from out of town and decided to check this breakfast spot out. We were not disappointed! We are pancake lovers and the cakes here are delicious!! We tried out the chocolate chip pancakes and the blueberry pancakes both were super fluffy and packed full of chocolate chips and blueberries. The coffee here is also great! Service is outstanding, I was never left with an empty cup of coffee! We will be back next time we're in town! Thanks for a great breakfast!!

The Cracked Egg is a solid breakfast restaurant that also serves lunch items as well. My husband and I don't go here often as we prefer other breakfast places around town.   Let's start with the service - I've never gone into The Cracked Egg and had a negative experience. The staff is always friendly and polite. Also, they're very attentive and your drink cup is seldom empty. Sometimes there is a bit if a wait to get seated, especially on weekends.   Now let's get into the grub - Their food is good. I wouldn't call it delicious, but it's pretty tasty. I ordered the Benedict Ole for $11.40. This breakfast includes two eggs benedict, but instead of ham, it comes with chicken and green chiles. I got to choose between shredded hashbrowns or seasoned potatoes; I chose the hashbrowns. As I said, the meal was pretty good, but the flavors were nothing that left me wanting more. The hashbrowns were also pretty standard.   Overall, The Cracked Egg is a solid breakfast joint, but if you want to give other places around town a chance, I think you can find better. Also, their prices aren't really competitive when compared to other eateries. For two egg benedicts with hashbrowns, I paid almost $12.00. You can get more bang for your buck elsewhere.

Excellent service-the waitress was exceptionally sweet and pleasant. Food came out fast and fresh. The coffee cake with cherries is so yummy! We both had terrific egg dishes-it would seem weird to come to an egg place and try a sandwich however, after we try more breakfast dishes we hope to try some lunch dishes as well! Please put a restaurant in North Vegas!!! We can't wait to run into Nicholas Cage here as we read he is a fan!

This review is kind a tale of two aspects of the restaurant.  Let's start with the positive - the food (which is what you come here for in the first place).  And it was awesome.  Our group had the breakfast croissant sandwich (with scrambled eggs and ham), the eggs benedict and a short stack of pancakes. Everything was great.  The sandwich had perfectly prepared eggs with melty cheese and flavorful ham.  The croissant was huge and delicious.  Just the right amount of flakiness. The short stack of pancakes were perfectly done and delicious.  As for the benedict, it was awesome.  The hollandaise sauce was excellent, the eggs were perfect.  Just delicious.  With the exception of the short stack, the dishes came with excellent seasoned potatoes.  Easily five-star food and one of the top two breakfast meals we've had since moving here last year.   Now the negative - the service.  Our waitress was really clueless, while drinks were served promptly, after our order was taken the waitress disappeared for like 10 minutes and then came back to tell us she forgot to put the order in.  We got a half-hearted apology, but clearly it amused her too because she giggled throughout.  So she walks over to the machine and starts typing in the order, then has to flee back because she can't read what she wrote down for one of the order.  Our food did come out fairly quickly after that, but she dropped the plates off in a hurry and wandered off before I could even tell her that we had no silver ware. So we had to wait for her to wander back to get that.  I realize that everyone has bad days and mistakes happen, but the sheer volume of screw ups here was unacceptable.  One-star (at best) for the service.    Given that great food and abominable service, I'm going to split the difference and give Cracked Egg 3 stars.  I'm sure we will be back at some point, because the food was great, but the service was certainly concerning.

It was fair.  Waitress was sort of rude.   Got a Mexican skillet.   Nothing too exciting.  Egg should have been inside not sitting on top cheese.  Egg and I is much better.   Asked for tea but waitress couldn't tell me the types.     Last year went and they had red velvet.  It was awesome.   Today they had an apple one.  Blah.

This is one of my go to breakfast places in the valley. Unfortunately there is almost always going to be a semi long wait to be seated. The foods always good and the customer service is great. The coffee cake is amazing and makes the wait worth it.
The service was great and the food was delish! I had the croissant egg sandwich with hash browns, coffee and orange juice. I would go here again for sure.

Went here for breakfast after dropping my little dude off to preschool. Not crowded at all so I took a seat at the counter. The menu was quite extensive and I REALLY REALLY wanted the Peanut Butter French Toast with honey and bananas....however...I had a hot yoga class at 10 am and didn't want to puke in the middle of it. I opted for an egg white omelet, seasoned potatoes and sourdough toast. Also I decided to throw in a coffee and fresh squeezed grapefruit juice (no joke...it was fresh squeezed). It was delightful. Perfectly cooked, seasoned and yummy. Will be back there many times when I have to take the kids to school.

I'm very impressed. I've owned my owned a restaurant before, and I appreciate excellent service. These folks provide friendly (always with a smile) and lightning fast service, along with.perfectly prepared food every time. A pleasant experience every visit. HIGHLY recommend.

I am a fan.  The fruit was tasty and sweet. The eggs were fluffy and light. The service was way above average, loved our server. Prices are fair, around the $10 range for most Breakfasts on the menu, give or take a few bucks. This location is over in "the linn "... the yuppie watching was excellent, see them uptight even as they try to relax, catch snippets of conversation that will linger long after breakfast is done :D Most definitely, will be back for more tasty dishes to be served up.

I had the Green Scramble with egg whites, no cheese, and chocolate chip coffee cake ($11.00). I also had two banana chocolate chip pancakes with sugar free syrup.  The scramble was good. The seasoned potatoes are nothing special, just heavily seasoned fried potatoes, basically french fries in a different shape.   The coffee cake was great.  Though I'm not sure I've ever had bad coffee cake.  When will sugary bread not taste good?  Downside is you have to have whatever kind of coffee cake they have for the day, but that can also be a good thing because it takes out having to rack your brain to decide.  Would love to try their other flavors.  The banana chocolate chip pancakes were excellent! They were made just right. And I had sugar free syrup.  I also used a 2 for 1 coupon. Without it, it's a tad pricey, but so is every other good breakfast place I suppose.

This remains the best breakfast place I have ever dined at. They proudly display their many restaurant awards around the restaurant-- awards which are well earned. The atmosphere is pleasant and comfortable-- the decorations aren't overly fancy but the interior is fairly well maintained.  Service tends to be pretty good here--even when it gets busy. The girls at the front can get pretty swamped during the Sunday rush but they always get the bill worked out right in the end. The waiters are pretty friendly and they know their menu pretty well. Subsitutions can be usually be made without much fuss. The coffee is pretty good, and the coffee cake is heavenly ( you need to try it at least once.)  The seasoned potatoes do definitely stand out here-- they are easily the best I've ever tasted. They aren't overly seasoned, arent too greasiy, and they have a satisfying crunchiness to them. Portions here are pretty hefty--maybe not Hash-House-A-Go-Go big, but respectable. Bring a decent appetite to make your trip here worthwhile.  I've tried a number of their dishes, from their fluffy and satisfying pancakes to their wide variety of egg dishes. Waffles are heavenly here--much better than you would find at IHOP or other large corporate spots. There aren't too many skillet options but I suggest you try  the vegetable egg skillet with chicken. The signature egg dishes go well with a side of cholula sauce but most are so well seasoned that you may not find you need it. The omelettes are fluffy and cooked just right. They never skimp on avocadoes or meat here. The wheat toast always arrives lathered in real butter. I recently enjoyed their unique pesto scramble. The french toast is rich and flavorful. This place simply does breakfast right and has earned its keep as one of the elite breakfast destinations in Clark County.

The one in Henderson was my favorite breakfast spot! This is my first time at this location. I ordered the chicken fried steak with eggs. The refs were delicious and he seasoned potatoes are my favorite food item they make!  The chicken fried steak was also delicious but my minor complaint is there isn't enough gravy! I'll order an extra side of it next time.  Come here, get the seasoned potatoes.  The service was fast and decent as well.  I'll be back for sure.

Disappointing at best! Overall, my breakfast had little flavor (SW Scramble). I love jalapenos, but this dish is way too overloaded and it didn't appear to add flavor. The chorizo was sour and my guess is there was 1 egg and about 4 cups of cheese. Potatoes appear to be out of a bag from the freezer and in turn were extremely dry. I even tried drenching them with salsa. Still not good. After a few bites I pushed my plate away. Waitress came by and asked how everything was. I said "terrible". Her response (obviously wasn't really listening)....ok great, enjoy! I had to ask for coffee refills each time. And keep in mind that we were sitting at the bar. When we left, the cashier asked how our meals were. My boyfriend told him....mine was just OK but my girlfriend was only able eat a few bites of hers. His response....glad to hear it. Disappointing meal and clueless staff. We definitely won't be back. Lots of other options in Vegas.

Always busy, but always worth the wait. If you want to sit right away, try and snag a stool at the counter.  Coffee cake is always amazing, and I have yet to order an item that wasn't amazingly delicious. The pesto scramble though, WOW!  The service is always great and the staff does a gear job balancing their time with all the different customers.  If you don't like eating in a crowded restaurant or enjoy solo dining, this is maybe not the place for you. Lots of families, but because of the crowded atmosphere, they have nowhere to run or cause a scene aside from the table they're sitting at. (I'm clearly not a parent).  Please check this place out!!

I am a repeat customer. Although there have been minor issues on previous visits, I can honestly say that I had the best breakfast that I have ever had at the Cracked Egg, today. Today, they got everything right. My eggs were over medium, as ordered. My bacon was soft and my hash browns crunchy, again, as ordered. White toast was perfect and the coffee cup was kept full. The service was terrific as well. Thanks Cracked Egg. Good job.

Stick to ordering the basic breakfast items, and arrive at the butt crack of dawn if you don't want to wait. Those would be my suggestions.  As much as I enjoy devouring their simple, yet tasty bowl of oatmeal, I would probably have to stick with that option if I were to return to The Cracked Egg. On my last visit, I tried the GVP omelette, which is served with a choice of potatoes or hash browns, and a choice of toast or coffee cake. The coffee cake arrived piping hot, which seemed like it came right out from the microwave. I couldn't stomach the omelette. Maybe it was the mushrooms and spinach combo, or just too much of the stringy Munster cheese, but it just didn't taste good.   So long, Cracked Egg. From now on, I'll be heading up the road to IHOP.

Fan of this location when I am in Henderson area on business. Always friendly prompt service and the prices are fair. Typically a short wait between 830AM and Noon or so, its always goes fast. Like options for both breakfast or lunch .  I think the scrambles are really good. Had a new one recently, could not decide between breakfast or lunch, so I had the cheeseburger scramble.  Eggs, potatoes and a cheeseburger all in one.
