Great place I had great service both times I had  better service the first time I was there although last time I came close to closing. Food great both times gyro skillet fabulous and Irish eggs Benedict was  also fabulous. Free ice cream with your meal served after 11 am which is pretty cool.

The experience was off from the start. To begin with we asked for a high chair which the waiter gracefully went off to get. 5 minutes of waiting with an empty restaurant surronding us I asked again and she finally went to actually get it. I wasn't upset though busy minds are okay but then I asked for an Iced Coffee and never got it and couldn't remind the server again because once she dropped off our food she left to never return. I wad still perfectly okay with everything didnt mind the poor service but then once our check was given to this time around she seemed frustated and upset which threw me off? I wondered why she was so upset towards us but I ignored it once more. After I handed my card to her I asked for a box and oh boy did she not deliver once again. Then my husband turns to me and says "wait did anyone get a coffee?" I asked for one of course but throughout the whole mean never received it so why ask? Well he said I think there was a coffee on the receipt. Which I hoped their wasnt but oh and behold there it was! She not only gave me vad service and lacked at everything but she charged me for something I didnt even receive so now here I am done and frustrated at a waited we had done nothing to asking for a refund for the coffee I didnt even get. She angrily gave me back 3 dollars bills and was silent to us until we left. The food was decent but not worth the awful service.
This place is mediocre. There's nothing unique about it. I ordered a croissant french toast and it was stale. The side of eggs were horrible. Customer service was okay. Overall, jst one time try.

2 locations, amazing breakfast choices, what more could you ask for? Oh wait, and they offer lunch options too? Whenever I have friends in town or I can't get a girl to leave the morning after I make sure to take them to the Cracked Egg. I think the employees may be on to me based on the disheveled appearances of my guests during breakfast.  Right, I forgot there's actually food here too. The banana walnut pancakes are basically the nuts and their fresh fruit plate is ACTUALLY fresh fruit unlike most breakfast places. I approve of everything the Cracked Egg does including their reasonable prices and friendly wait staff.

My love affair with The Cracked Egg started at this location and migrated to the Cheyenne location when I bought a home in Summerlin.  I'm still partial to this location mainly because it is more spacious and has a really light, fun ambiance to it. Their food is always fresh and interesting and I've never had a bad meal here. I tried the Vaquero omelet which had green chilis, chorizo, salsa, and lots of cheese, sour cream, and salsa smothered on top. This was one heavy, flavorful dish but the eggs were still fluffy and made me want to nom nom nom all day. The sourdough toast was also really interesting and I'd definitely get that again, that's for sure! If you are looking for something lighter you need to try the banana walnut pancakes because they are heavenly.  If you are in search of a solid, inexpensive breakfast with a fun atmosphere and friendly waitstaff then eat at The Cracked Egg and thank me later.
Favorite breakfast joint with best sausage links I've found!  Coffee cake of the day, good java nice folks.  Did I say sausage link is great!

Good portions with good flavor.  My family lives nearby and when I visit, we like to come here.  The coffee cake is interesting with the apples baked into the bottom.  I usually get a scramble and the sides of salsa that come with it are good!  There are plenty of options for everyone regardless of what you're in the mood for.  The pesto scramble had a good pine nut flavor and the green scramble is just as tasty!
What a place and what a price!  Just great service, food and atmosphere!  People were very friendly and food was just fabulous! Will visit again when we are in town!

So delicious!!!!! If you come here better try their seasoned fries they are the best. I had the garden omelette with broccoli, spinach, tomatoes and cheese so good! My husband had philly chicken sandwich so good too!! I really recommend this place! Oh and one other thing out bill was like 20 bucks!!

The breakfast here is so good! We have our favorites like the big bad wolf and the pesto scramble but, make out a point to try new things too! The coffee cake is to die for and is always freshly made. The staff is so friendly, giving it a down home flavor. Definitely one of our favorite breast places!

Breakfast, breakfast, and more breakfast! If you want breakfast, and want it done well, go to The Cracked Egg!  THE FOOD: With my usual craving to devour everything on the menu, it's always a challenge to decide on what to order, especially at breakfast because it's my favorite meal of the day. I ended up ordering the Cakes & Eggs Combo so I could get a little bit of everything. The eggs were cooked to perfection, and the sausage patties were flavorful. DON'T get the sausage links, the waiters/waitresses even recommend against it, hahaha. The pancakes were really good too! The right amount of fluffiness drenched in an ocean of syrup (I did that myself, of course).   The Cracked Egg also serves coffee cake, and it's apparently somewhat popular. I had the opportunity to eat some of this coffee cake, and it was...chocolate...coffee cake? I really don't know how to explain it any better than that. It was okay, it just tasted like a dry chocolate cake with coffee cake crumble on top. Other people have told me they have had other types of coffee cake, so I'm guessing The Cracked Egg likes to change things up. If you're curious, I would ask the staff.  The staff is another topic. I didn't think they were very friendly. The woman who seated us (my mom, my stepdad, and I) practically threw our menus and utensils on the table without saying a word, and returned to the front of the restaurant. Our waitress was also very quick in wanting to get us to leave when the restaurant wasn't even half full.  THE VERDICT: Overall, the food is fantastic. The staff, not so much. I'll go back for the food, especially since I love a place that does breakfast well.

My wife placed an order for pickup today and the lady who answered the phone became very rude and dismissive when asked about an item which is somewhat vague in its description on the menu. Everyone has a bad day, I get it but as a first time customer giving you our business it's very distasteful and disappointing.

My wife has been here several times but this is my first. She was craving the Monte Cristo. I love a good Eggs Benedict. After other reviews, I got mine with the sliced avocado on the side. That just put it over the top. Very good seasoned potatoes. See my picture to see what I thought of it.  My wife loved her Monte Cristo. I don't think it's anything special. It wasn't greasy at all, which it is at some places. A little on the small size if you ask me. Served with maple syrup instead of the traditional fruit compote or jam.   A great breakfast spot for sure.

This place is the reason why I finally opened a Yelp account...  I wanted to take my boyfriend to breakfast for his birthday so I looked up some places since we are from out of town, and I decided to come here. The menu had a bunch of delicious options from peanut butter French toast to croissant egg sandwich. The variety of egg Benedicts caught my eye so I decided on the Veggie one with avocado, spinach and grilled tomatoes and my boyfriend chose the Pastrami Benedict and an order of chocolate chip pancakes.  My order was a beautiful display and tasted even better than it looked. I enjoyed every single bite! My boyfriend loved his dish as well and we could barely get into the pancakes since we were quite full with our benedict plates. Price was reasonable for the amount of food and service was great, very friendly waitress and bright, welcoming, cute decorative setting.  After leaving I believe I said out loud "that was the best breakfast I've had in a long time" about 5 times! I will definitely be back the next time we are in Vegas and recommend it to many others.  Thank you for a wonderful experience!

Have been here twice. Having had a hard time finding a decent breaky in the area, was happy to find. Typical breakfast place with extremely friendly and attentive service.   Both times got the eggs benedict with spinach added. Was perfect for what I was looking for. I'll return.

This place is so gooood! Huge selection so whatever ur craving - they have it! The coffee cake is sooooo moist & so tasty, it's addicting ..Beware! Service was great, time from order till when food arrived was a little lengthy but well worth it :)

Food was great, service was friendly without being overbearing and ended up chatting with the other people at the counter. Exactly what a great diner is. Breakfast is my favorite meal and these guys got it right.

Ordered here while on a vacay in Vegas while staying at a nearby airbnb. Good solid breakfast food at reasonable price. Good variety of omelettes gluten free, high protein, vegetarian - something for everybody! , Love that most breakfast items cane with a choice of coffee cake which we all ate as breakfast the next day.

A great place for Breakfast.  My wife and I...tired of the expensive Las Vegas Strip foods...and the cheap buffet's off strip buffet's, decided to give "The Cracked Egg" a try.  We were not disappointed!  The menu is extensive...and most dishes are priced an average of $11.  We are skillet crazed and the Egg delivered! I had the "Bacon-Cheeseburger Skillet" and my wife had a build your own skillet with sausage, tomato's, onions and cheese.  Cheeseburger for breakfast you say?  It was just chock full of ground beef, plenty of cheese, home style potatoes and fresh bacon galore.  I added a side of hollandaise to top my perfectly cooked eggs over easy and voila...taste perfection.  No skimping here.  The place was typical strip mall diner style seating...the staff friendly and helpful...all in all a great place to catch a great hearty breakfast!    Hungry for lunch...check the backside of the menu for sandwiches, burgers etc.  But the breakfast is the draw..I mean...it is called "The Cracked Egg" afterall.
This place sucks the service is horrible and so was the food......the managers on duty didn't  care if we had a good experience..... Never again I give them a negative 5 stars

I ordered the Classic French Toast and the Cakes and Egg combo. I really enjoyed the French Toast, Eggs, Turkey Sausage but NOT the Pancakes so much. I like the cozy, pretty quiet tucked away brunch spot. Overall it was a good inexpensive, decent food great service type of place.   I'll Be Back (in my Terminator voice)!!
Awesome Breakfast!!! I had the Western Scramble.  We also had the Eggs Benedict and Huevos Rancheros - All was GREAT!!!  The warm Coffee Cake is to Die for - A must try !!!!

I like coconuts. I like french toast. I like fruit. So, the tropical french toast was an obvious pick. Loved it. The portions were huge and enough for two people. Other stuff i've tried on previous visits include:  - croissant french toast: not my favorite, the french toast croissant was too mushy  - raspberry stuffed french toast: delicious  - chocolate chip pancakes: good, but nothing spectacular  - philly cheesesteak: surprisingly good, a little on the small side, chicken was very tender, plenty of onions and peppers, bread was nice and chewy and fresh  The service tends to be on the slow side no matter the day or time. The last time I went was a Monday morning and there were maybe 2 other groups in whole place. It still took a while to get my order in. Didn't see my waitress again until we flagged her down to get the check. But, you're not paying for the service or ambiance. Just good breakfast and lunch food.

Good customer service is as crucial as good food. Although the food was quite delicious, the bad service we experienced left a horrible taste in my mouth.  My husband and I went for Sunday brunch and the hostess told us the wait would be about 20 minutes. The wait area inside was full so we waited outside with about 15 other people. We figured with this many people waiting that this place had to be good. About 25 minutes later, my husband checked with the hostess and she said she called his name about 20 minutes ago. Funny thing was that while my husband was inside talking to the hostess, a party of 5 next to me complained that they were never called and the hostess insisted she called them. They were more bothered (as was I) that the hostess insisted she called their name and didn't apologize for the inconvenience. A group of 4 who just paid walked out and were complaining about the rudeness of the hostess! Three groups complaining about the bitchiness of the hostess is not a coincidence!  When we were finally seated, the hostess dropped our menu and our silverware on the table, didn't say a word and walked away. WOW. We waited a while for our waitress and she also had a sour attitude! I even asked my husband if I was just imagining things but agreed that she was not pleasant at all.  As I was making mental notes about what I should rant in my Yelp review, the coffee cake came out and managed to bring what was supposed to be a 2 star review to a 2.5/3. It was moist and heavenly!  My husband ordered the Chicken Fried Steak and it was decent but not the best we've ever had. I ordered the Eggs Benedict and I loved the hollandaise and the thickness of the ham. The seasoned potatoes were the perfect complement to the eggs.  Note to the management of The Cracked Egg: Bad attitude can really ruin a customer's service. On busy weekends, please ensure your hostesses and wait staff are smiling and friendly.  I would suggest to invest in pagers because it can be difficult to hear the hostesses when there are 15 people waiting outside and planes flying overhead. With Egg Works opening up down the street in Fall 2011, I doubt I'd come back here because of bad attitude I encountered even though the food was good.

This place is great! I always enjoy my visit here because of the great service and skillet's. You can make your own skillet or get whats on the menu, great to have a choice. I tried their Country Benny for fathers day and it was great!

This was ok, the coffee cake was great, but we didn't get our drinks refilled even once.  I wouldn't avoid this place but I wouldnt go out of my way to go there regardless of how hungry I am.   Croissant french toast, wasn't that great, it kind of tasted like only the heels of a standard loaf of bread.
My girlfriend found this place and it was great.  I had an omelette that was perfectly done and the coffee is perfect.
This little gem was a delight.   The food and the portions were great.  Also, Bambi she was very personable and attentive.  Keep up the great work!!

One word...UNDER-SEASONED!  We ordered the following on a Tuesday at 10:15 AM: 1.) Californian Omelet-has bacon, avocados and cheese.  Under-seasoned. 2.) Homemade Corned Beef Hash-Had to add salt.  I asked for a side of rice, but sadly, they don't make rice there.  C'mon, I am Asian.  I love rice with Corned Beef.  But that is not the reason why I gave them only 3 stars.  I asked the waitress to have my egg scrambled over easy, it came out non-scrambled, over easy. Under-seasoned.  We chose the seasoned potatoes, the hash brown, and the coffee cake to go with our food.  The coffee cake was warm and moist, with cherries at the bottom.  Tasted delicious with the coffee.  For the hash brown, I asked for it extra crispy, but didn't come out to how I would like it to be.    If I come back, I will probably just order the coffee cake and a cup of coffee.
The food is amazing! Had the California burger and hubby had the classic cheeseburger.  Definitely coming back!

Me and my family of six have been going to this place every weekend since we live next door.  Lately however, the food has been getting worse and worse and the last two times they got our order wrong.  Today we got a really rude waitress she brought the wrong order to my son again, never apologized, never came back for refills and when we complained about the bad service,  and asked if we can use a two for one coupon on a check for six people ($80) they told us NO.  Needless to say, we are never coming back again.   Yelp customers would be wise to stay away too! Way to treat your regular customers poorly Cracked Egg.  Shame on you!

Worse breakfast we've had  out.  Scrabble eggs...nothing great.  Ordered a croissant..waitress offered to heat it...the cook split it in half and grilled it in some disgusting grease.  Ctoisssnt sre dupposed to be light n flaky.  The jam is prepackaged heinz sugary cheap stuff.  The hot chocolate was made w package mix and water. ..very watery so waitress gave me another packet to mix myself.  Coffee was like water.  If uou have a breakfast place...better have great coffee.  Maybe we ordered the wrong thing but if you can't get a basic simple breakfast right. ..we wouldn't try for more.

YUM! This place has never disappointed! The coffee is on point, the coffee cake is different every time and is like heaven no matter the flavor. We've only done breakfast/brunch, but this is an absolute favorite restaurant. There's plenty of menu options and seems like there's always something new and delicious to try.

Family owned and operated restaurant. For our first time in Phoenix for Dodgers spring training we were looking to eat at a non chain related restaurant. Walked in and the restaurant was very busy which was a good sign and we were seated pretty quickly. . . . Decor was old fashioned themed non formal vibe made you feel at home. Because the restaurant was busy it seemed that they were short staffed because it took forever to get our order and drink refills. The food came out room temperature and wasn't that great in taste. We ordered basic breakfast   hard to go wrong. Pancakes were cold and potatoes were over cooked . To make matters worse the bill came to $53 for 1 kids meal and two adults. Needless to say I was very disappointed, however the staff was extremely friendly. That being said I won't be back.
Great place to have a excellent breakfast the menu is great with different varieties just a great place to go when looking for a great sit down breakfast brunch din in

Okay, my boyfriend and I are big breakfast fans. This is our favorite casual breakfast place. I've probably eaten here about 40 times and I have never been let down. I have tried many things but my two favorites are the Country Benny..its Eggs Benedict with a biscuit and sausage and gravy on top. I'm sure its about 5,000 calories but well worth it especially when you are hung over. My other favorite is the El Vaquero...its a chorizo omelette with salsa and cheese on top. Amazing! I know they are owned by the same people, but this one is far better than the one on Rainbow.

Pretty decent! Typical breakfast food.......omelets, scrambles, bacon and eggs, pancakes, etc.  The highlights: ~PUMPKIN walnut coffee cake.......moist and fluffy! ~Build your own skillets........ingenious! ~Lots of booths.  I'm not a table and chair kinda girl.  My complaints: ~The coffee tasted stale and it wasn't really HOT. ~My husband and I weren't greeted or even acknowledged for about 10 minutes after being sat.........NO BUENO! ~The set up of the restaurant at this particular location is pretty poor......front door, hostess stand, people waiting/people eating all in the same small area.  CLAUSTROPHOBIA!
The food was great, the eggs cooked perfectly. I'd give 5 stars but my waiter was not on the ball.
Service was ok, but I loved my California Omelet and there potatoes.  A lot of food, I couldn't fininsh it all.

I'm just gonna start by saying i think they should re-name this place, "the crack-egg" because its probably more addicting than crack. (j/k i wouldn't know). But really. I love breakfast. I love eggs benedict. I love dessert first. I love the Cracked Egg.   I came here this past weekend with a friend and we decided to share a RED VELVET COFFEE CAKE to start. Amazeballs. And it was definitely worth sharing, cause that thing was HUGE. Then we tried the peanut butter french toast. A little too sweet and not peanut-buttery enough for my taste, but it was good. I'll try the croissant french toast next time. And then I had an eggs benedict. By myself. It was delish! I know, i eat like hungry hippo.  Service was alright, nothing to write yelp about. Atmosphere was pleasant. Price was appropriate. I'll definitely be back to eat my way through the rest of the menu :)  The missing star is because of the wait.. Not their fault , but what can i say, i was feelin the HANGER. :/

One star cause the waitress was nice. But I will say that it's not worth it. Way over priced and staff doesn't care that how your meal was.  For starters we waited at our table for a good 5-7 minutes. I get it, it's Saturday morning and it's busy. We already knew what we wanted but she took our drink orders and left. Now worries we could order when she returns. Having worked at a breakfast joint before (the Egg and I) I get my favorite corned beef hash. My husband orders the burrito enchilada style but the waitress insisted that torri's tortilla was better and she would just get his enchilada sauce on the side for him. Our food came in a decent amount of time. But, well I've Never been to a breakfast restaurant where they do not serve hollandaise sauce with corned beef hash. And my husband saw they had a pork green chili sauce and wasn't too fond of the enchilada sauce. Well......we waited and waited literally 10 minutes for our waitress to finish taking orders for the other table (she's quite friendly and a chatter box) and asked if mine comes with hollandaise and she said she could get some for me and I asked her for some pork green chili sauce and she said sure. Couple minutes later she comes back and the green chili is literally diced green chili. At this point our food has gone cold and I was busy eating my side of hash browns that I was filling up. When I took a bite of my corned beef hash, it tasted like just hash browns. I removed my egg and I was surprised that there were a few strips of corned beef. The rest was hasbrowns and bell peppers. $12.25! Really? Our meal came to &45 for party of 3 where 1 was a kids meal. And when asked how was everything and I replied not too good. They said oh. Want a box! Our plates literally still were full with food. Ridiculous. Not coming back and for this prices not recommending them either. Bye Felicia

BUGS!!!! All over the booths! My aunt got bit all over her arm took an hour to get our food horrible service, it was very hot in the restaurant thermostat in there said 89. Worth driving to a different location.

2 hours at the cracked egg is not how I wanted to spend my morning.  The food is not as good as Eggworks and the staff is extremely disorganized.  Waited almost an hour as we watched multiple empty tables never being filled and then multiple two top tables being filled ahead of us even though we were in the restaurant at least 30 minutes earlier.    And then finally we paid more for this meal then we have for many good dinners.  This restaurant is just bad.

Had a great working breakfast at the cracked egg. Very complete menu, but was surprised at how well it was prepared and fresh ingredients. I had an Eggs Benedict, it was to perfection. The rest of the food on the table looked magnificent, and the service was very friendly. Would recommend they improve their coffee however in this day and age. Otherwise a fantastic experience overall.

Immediately greeted upon entering and seated. Waitress was attentive to us and provide excellent customer service. We had several staff approach us immediately after seated to get our drink order.  Food was fresh, hot and arrived quick. We waited maybe 10 minutes for our food once we order. Our coffee cup was never empty. Highly recommend this place

The Cracked Egg is a great spot for breakfast if you're looking for that local, homey feel. I went on a weekday and the restaurant was full. There was about a 5-10 minute wait. which was tolerable. It went by very quick though especially since I spent my time looking over their extensive egg menu.  So extensive that I still needed time to look over the menu even after I was seated, but then again I'm really slow when it comes to ordering food so that could have been the reason why.   I ended up with an egg white "Garden Patch" omelet. It was fully loaded with spinach, broccoli, mushrooms, tomatoes, and cheese. It was so huge that I couldn't even finish it, but it was delicious!! Also, my dish came with hash browns (or seasoned potatoes if you want) and coffee cake (or toast).   It was a great breakfast and a great way to kick off the morning! I recommend checking this place out!

The food was so good. I had 2 eggs, hash browns, corned beef hash and a huge fluffy biscuit. My husband had the French toast.  The serving size is huge and the prices are great. They were busy on that Sunday morning but we only waited 5 minutes. The waitress was fast and knew what she was doing. We will be back for sure.
I've been on this earth for 23 year and finally found the best French toast I ever had!! Get the Peanut butter French toast!! You'll be in peanut heaven!!

Stopped in for breakfast on a recommendation from some friends. The place was crowded but we were seated within 10 minutes of checking in. I had the eggs Benedict. My first time ever trying the dish and I will need to try it elsewhere to see if i still dislike it. I could say that without ever having it before, I'm sure it is suppose to have some flavor. The holandaise sauce was just a visual effect, nothing to it. Every bite tasted like egg yolk and that's it just bland as could be. The potatoes did have seasoning and flavor and are worth ordering. I felt it was overpriced as well. My wife had pancakes and 2 eggs(sunnyside not over easy as ordered) with bacon coffee and one orange juice( i would of had another but the no one came back until we were finished) and it was over $30. No urgency on returning here.

With tons of other breakfast spots in town, this ones pretty overrated and on the pricey side for what they offer. Nothing worth coming back for. I'd rather take the drive to Du-Pars, where they do breakfast right...ALOHA!!!

In the mood for IHOP or Denny's? Go here instead. The quality in both food and service is much higher. Complimentary coffee cake before your meal is really good. Would come here more often if it were closer to me.

Made a to go order from here. Food was fresh and portions were very large. Food was ready about 15 minutes after we placed our order over the phone.    The country fried steak was okay though we weren't a big fan of the gravy. The gravy was a little bland. The country potatoes were also lacking a little flavor in my opinion. The kickin' potatoes were good though perhaps because they were covered in crispy bacon and cheese. Can't go wrong with bacon and cheese.   I did enjoy the Mexican skillet and the scrambled eggs were cooked just right. Probably would've been great with flour tortillas but the rye toast was a sufficient side. Overall not bad. Next time I'll have to try their eggs Benedict.
Favorite breakfast place in town! Great service and food every time, and I go at least once a week.

Friendly service and pretty good food definitely gets an A-OK in my book. Bigger portions especially when it comes to the "Big Bad Wolf" omelet would have earned an extra star or two. The omelet itself was stuffed full of meat but was small by all standards (took up less than half my plate and was half an inch thick).  Coffee cake was absolutely delicious so I am glad I read the reviews and knew to order it. Four dollars for orange juice was pretty steep when the entree itself cost ten dollars. Lesson learned though.   Overall 10$ for a small omelet and 4$ for orange juice leaves me wanting a lot more for the price.  I would go back for the coffee cake but that's really the only thing pulling me back.
I just called in an order the girl was rude on the phone hopefully the food makes up for it.

Appreciate the gluten free menu . Although ... If you are a bit sensitive or have celiac's like me , watch out for the seasoned potatoes & gf pancakes . The cross contamination usually gets to me. . I usually get the build your own skillet. , ask for extra crispy hash browns or they will come out undercooked . The coffee is good , and everyone says the house made coffee cake is amazing . Also my husband loves the veggie croissant sandwich . Service is always pretty good too .

This place is egg-tacular!!! Their food it's awesome!! They are pretty packed throughout the weekend, but if you are dying for some really good home cooked breakfast or lunch, this is your place!! Their turkey pesto tomato is on point! Their cheeseburger skillet is heaven in your mouth! The service is awesome but slow, but it's understandable when it's packed!! Pretty much order anything and you will be flying high on a cloud straight to food heaven!!!
One of my favorite breakfast spots! I work nights, and come after I get off of work. Everyone is friendly, food is always good. If you haven't had the raspberry French toast, you're missing out!

We eat breakfast here often, the food is great!  The staff is so nice.  It is our go-to breakfast spot.  They are cool about customizing orders and it always comes out perfectly. Guests from out of town have enjoyed it as well, the coffee cake is always a hit for them.

Great service and food! They have gluten and diary free pancakes which is something I can never find at a restaurant. They were amazing!! Plus their seasoned potatoes are full of so much flavor. Definitely would recommend and go back!

I have eaten at the cracked egg in Summerlin location.  We were very disappointed with the food and service at this location.   Our waitress was rude and didn't come back after our food came.   The omelette was dry. The ruebin sandwich was a swamp of grease. Fries were burned. When we got the waitress attention and told her the omelette had no cheese she said it was on top and walked away.  Won't go back to this location

Was not very impressed . It's got 3 starts only because the service was fast we didn't have to wait long to be seated or our food. I was a lil disappointed with our waiter she only checked on us once and that's was to give us the check.  The food was ok I expected a lil bit more originality. They do give a good portion and prices are reasonable.

We wanted a breakfast away from strip and found this place on Yelp. We only waited 3 minutes and seated outside.  At 11 am, it was nice and in shade.  Our party had an omelet and skillet breakfast.  Husband had senior special. The overall experience was great.  The food was good and and satisfying.  The service was exceptional starting with the adorable hostess, who looked like she may have been an owner.

Now this is a breakfast house! Great quality, Great taste, and a creative menu make for a good time. I believe one would be hard pressed to leave here hungry with the portion sizes too. The eggs benedict comes in many creative varieties, all of them delicious. They also have skillet platters that are sure to fill you up. Lastly, a large slice of crumb cake comes with most breakfast platters. The enviroment is noisy, as its usually filled with customers ( Usually a good sign ) but it is clean and well kept. You can find this place on Cheyenne and Buffalo in the food court. Enjoy!

Went to this place to grab a lunch with my niece but we will course ordered breakfast food.  Our server is a little slow and I'm not sure if my order was correct or not but my wheat toast never came. But I did have the order yourself omelette with spinach, sausage and cheese.  It came with country potatoes. It was pretty good.
Their food is to die for! I cannot find anywhere that has my favorites breakfast as delicious as this place. It's a little pricey, but well worth the cost!! The fresh squeezed OJ is amazing too!

Was here on Sunday. Waitress was fantastic. However we had ants all over our table & had to move. In addition the main reason we went there was to use the $8.00 credit that was on the rewards card I registered for.  However the manager informed me at check out that the credit would have to be used at a different time once the rewards company had mailed it out. Not only that but she was all but rude in how she explained it and was not even apologetic for the ant situation. You would think that under the circumstances she would have at the minimum offered to buy our drinks or something. So very disappointed with how this was handled.

We have eaten here many times and the food is great, today was also great! Unfortunately the hostess today was absolutely the crabbiest!!! When we arrived she was on the phone, which appeared to be a personal call. It took her a few minutes to complete her call, never making eye contact with us. When we asked to be seated outside she opened the door and just pointed to a table. She did not smile at all plus made us feel as though we were a huge inconvenience to her. When paying for our meal she never asked if everything was ok, never smiled, just in general very rude. This type of behavior for the employees at this restaurant is very unusual as they are always very nice at the Charleston location. Not sure if we will return! We visited on 4/11/2018, paid our bill at 8:45am.

I really love this place, once we found this gem we've been going back every time we are in Vegas.  The avocado Benedict is my absolute favorite thing to eat there.  Just an awesome place to get breakfast!

I've had the pleasure of eating here a couple times and I had a great experience both times.   There is several reasons why I love this place and gave it 5 stars. The staff is very friendly and attentive, they have a huge selection of delicious good quality food and their prices are good. I ordered the cakes and egg combo it comes with pancakes, 2 eggs any style I got scrambled with cheese and also your choice of bacon or sausage I got sausage. Now I know it sounds basic but it was probably the best pancakes and sausage I have ever had from a restaurant the pancakes were fluffy goodness and the sauce was nice and juicy I ate every bite of my plate which is rare for me.   My bf got the chicken fried steak which he devoured in a blink of an eye luckily i grabbed a bite before he finished it off and that too was also delicious ill be getting that next time we go here.   This place is a winner for sure!
The most outstanding Huevos Rancheros I've ever had. Great service and atmosphere too!

My husband and I stopped in to have brunch today. We have not previously been to this restaurant. We are glad we came in. We were greeted by a friendly waitress, Dorothy, whom seated us promptly.  We were each handed a menu that is quite extensive with both breakfast and lunch items in which to choose from. My husband chose the Western Scramble, with an English muffin, and I chose the Californian Eggs Benedict with crispy hash browns, and coffee and ice water for both of us.  We didn't have to wait long before the food arrived at our table. The food was hot, and fresh. You can tell that this restaurant chooses and uses only the finest and freshest ingredients.  Dorothy, our waitress, was excellent. She checked on us frequently and always made sure she topped off our coffee. She was friendly and helpful. At the end of our meal, she asked us if we would like a free scoop of ice cream. They have vanilla, chocolate or strawberry. Its the "REAL" deal, not out of a machine. The ice cream was perfect. We will definitely be back to this restaurant. It is a wonderful place to eat and it is family owned and operated.

I love this place. I found it on a whim a few years ago while staying on the strip. During this trip to Vegas, I've been twice. The gluten free pancakes are amazing, the service is always good, and the coffee is fresh. I really enjoy my food and the time I have! Apparently, the coffee cake is great. The smell is incredible. Thanks for having such amazing gluten free pancakes.

Mmmmmyeah no. I don't know how this strip mall spot has such amazing reviews because there was not a thing stand out or special about this greasy spoon. Sure? You have the option of coffee cake in lieu of toast.... But it's basically angel food cake with apples in it, so I'm not sure what's exciting about that. Two people in my party excitedly ordered the corned beef hash and neither were excited about or finished their plate. I had the sweet potato and apple skillet which would've had potential if it were a) seasoned even a little b) someone had enough knife skills to properly dice an onion. I really don't need an apple-slice sized piece of caramelized onion. Lastly, the Munster cheese melted on the top just turned into a congealed mess before it even made it to the table. 1 star for pleasant service, 1 star for perfectly Poached eggs.

Ok. This is a traditional breakfast restaurant. They open early and close early, so no breakfast at dinner time for you Las Vegas night shift workers. The servers here are friendly. The meals come in heaping portions. Great breakfast restaurant if you are really hungry and ready to eat!!
Places like this will put Denny's and ihop out of business. 5 stars is not enough to explain how amazing this place is. Delish.

One of my favorite places to grab breakfast, and I always drag my dad here when he's visiting. I'm a fan of their Joe's Scramble and the Garden Benny; my husband likes the corned beef hash and the southern style eggs benedict. I've also enjoyed their seasonal items like pumpkin pancakes.  They always take great care of us when we visit, almost always with my kiddo in tow. It can get a bit crowded, especially on weekends, but it's always worth the wait.

Why on gods green earth do they only have 4 seater tables? There would be no wait at all at this delicious restaurant if they had two seater tables. Instead, my significant other and I were forced to watch couples and mother-and-son duos eat at large tables for upwards of ten minutes before being given our own overly large table on which to enjoy our meal. Just peeved!  I would say that our waitress was an angel and the food tasted good. Beware the coffee cake-- quite sweet!
I have to have breakfast here every time I visit! This place does breakfast right! The French toast is amazing, the coffee is delicious , the service is great!

"GVP"- seasoned potatoes were definitely our favorite. Crunchy and delectable! Perfectly seasoned! The omelette itself was good. A lot of avocados which was a plus. I just wish the omelette was a little more juicier per se. Typical omelette though, nothing outstanding.. The potatoes were def the best thing about this dish.   Tropical French toast: really good! Sweet. Lots of sweet fruits. This definitely caught my attention and was pretty unique.   Coffee bread: overhyped! But it's still good, but our least favorite dish of our selection.  The service was pretty good. Atmosphere was nice as well!

Great place usually but this morning went in.   Was next to get a seat.   Cashier was staring right at me and waiter gave table to people who came in after us.   Will never go again.   I can't stand rudeness.

My fiance and I have been coming here almost every Sunday for the past three years. I love everything about it. The waitstaff is extremely friendly and they're always smiling and upbeat. The service is great, even when it's extremely busy, which it usually is on Sundays. I've never had to worry about someone coming to refill my coffee, they always come around and offer refills at the perfect times. The coffee itself is GREAT. Best coffee at a restaurant I think I've ever had, and it's always served hot and tastes fresh. The food has never been disappointing. I tend to order the same two menu items frequently, but any time I try something new it's always good. The only remotely negative thing about this place is it's very popular so there does tend to be a wait time when we come in. However it's usually only 10 minutes tops and I think it's well worth the wait.  I will continue to come here every Sunday for as long as it's open.

I've been coming here for about 5-6 months since I started working at the building nearby. This place has great food and a big menu to choose from. There have been a few times when they make mistakes with the order, but that's fine, mistakes happen sometimes.  What really upset me today, is since I started coming here, I signed up for the rewards program, which was just a paper that you fill up and you hand to them and they give you a card. When I handed them the filled out paper, they said I'm all set, and they even scanned my card that day so I can get the points for my order.   Today, I decided to log in to the rewards card site to see how much points I have, I was shocked as it said, "No e-mail is associated with this card number." I went and ordered food, and when I got to the restaurant, I mentioned the card issue, and the girl said, "You were suppose to verify your e-mail from the e-mail that was sent to you."  I checked my e-mail and there was never an e-mail sent to me. Does this mean that you guys never even activated my card? All those times that you "inserted" my card so I can get my points were all fake? That's not right! and That's not nice!   That means all the points I should have had for the past 5-6 months, was nothing! I literally order here once or twice a week! I could have accumulated a lot of points already!   I am very unhappy and wish for this to be fixed. Other than this situation, this place is great! I will re-write a review if this is fixed.

Wonderful breakfast! Very hearty portions for the price and tastes as good as it looks. I definitely recommend the French toast and I am not normally a huge fan of French toast. The omelette and the French potatoes were also good options.

Love this place! It's our go-to breakfast place in summerlin. The service is always excellent, quick and friendly. The food is fresh and delicious every time. It's reasonably priced. Can't say enough good things about the Cracked Egg!
Staff is super friendly! The device is amazing and the manager interacts with customers and is super friendly. The food comes in big servings and is so delicious! Love this place!

We wanted to grab a solid brunch to start our day and this place gave us just that. We arrived about 11:20am on a Sunday. It was just 2 of us, the hostess was better than great with her wait estimate of 10 min, we got seated in about 7 min. We both really like bacon and avocado, so we ordered the Californian omelette with Hash. I opted for the coffee cake which was a nice, sweet, fluffy cake with chocolate and glaze. It's a good substitute to have as a side than pancakes for me. What was awesome was their no holds barred policy of no WiFi, and challenging patrons to be human again in an age without a mobile device and have a verbal conversation.

The Cracked Egg has been a staple in my life for more than a decade. The food is excellent; I have never had something I didn't like. I usually get a typical American breakfast with eggs, meat, potatoes, and/or pancakes. However, the Country Benny is probably the best item on the menu in my opinion (but bring a big appetite cuz it's huge). The manager Armando is a close friend of mine and I liked the place so much I got a job there in high school. They treat their employees very well and it shows in their high quality service. Also, they have a very good loyalty program. You can't go wrong in choosing The Cracked Egg!
Good food, good service. I will be back to try them again. Food came out fast and there server was very attentive. Yummy breakfast place!

Went for the first time yesterday after working out. The service was great. The menu has plenty of choices. My wife ordered a skillet which was great. I ordered the Chili Verde Rancheros and the regular hash browns. I am glad they serve regular hash browns.  The coffee cake was tasty however, have you ever microwaved coffee cake and it is really hot in the center plus has a feel that screams microwaved? It was kind of like that. I would rather have a piece of warm coffee cake that did not pass through a microwave(just seems like it did).  My meal was very tasty but the shredded pork in the Rancheros had hard edges like it had been sitting out.  Lastly, when we walked in and asked for a booth, the hostess gave us a gas face as if by asking for a booth we were throwing off the table rotation by not taking a two top.  But...we will be back. If I did not like the place it would get less then 4 stars
I stopped in while having my car serviced next door.  Clearly a fairly large contingent of regulars!  I didn't have any fancy.. just sausage,eggs and coffee but the service was fast and friendly.

Not many places are open after i get off work at 5:30am, but this place is!  Always used to pass it on my way to my old job but never thought about trying it. I ate there the other day and the food was amazing! The service there is also very good. The atmosphere is relaxing, the last thing i want to hear after a long night of work is loud music and yelling. I would definitely recommend this place to everyone, the menu choices all sound delicious!  Minus 1 star for price. I don't like paying 3 dollars for a glass of milk, when i can get a gallon for that price

Went on holiday weekend, just had to wait about 20 minutes, so not bad.  Had the verde Rancheros.  Not sure if I would order it again.  I did like how the eggs were runny under all if the cheese and meat.  Service was excellent.  Seem to have an extensive menu, but did not see chiliquiles on the menu, which is one of my favorites.

Best breakfast place I've been to here!! I got the southwest omelet and it was YUMMY! Wow who thought of that one? I will be trying this at home.   5 stars on service  5 stars on food 5 stars on cleanliness   I can't say much else!
After my yoga class with my gf, had a pretty decent breakfast here... I like the feel of the restaurant, laid back!!  Definitely will go back again!

Great local spot in Vegas. This is our second time here. We came for breakfast here the other morning, service was awesome, food was awesome- so much so that we came again for breakfast today. Only bummer about this morning there is a wait to be seated, the entire waiting area is full of people waiting - so my husband and I waited outside.... Summer, 100 degree weather at 11:00 am- ugh. If you do come- try the coffee cake. It's a very light airy type cake. Not your typical dense coffee cake. Plus, this one has peach;)  But the French Toast is delicious, compared to other places I eaten. The Eggs Benedict too. Just a super cute little spot to grab breakfast.
I love the corn beef hash and its very FILLING  me and my friends left very satisfied

We had a party of 6 and was told it would be 15 minutes for a seat.  As we waited I watched 3 or 4 parties of 6&7 seated before us.  When we nicely asked what was going on the ignorant host snapped at us and we walked out.  They have horrible customer service skills.  We used to frequent the Cracked Egg often. We will not be eating there any longer. Just because your busy and have high volume that's no excuse for snippy attitudes. Learn how to speak to customers.  0 stars.

This place is amazing! We tried for the first time recently and it was delicious. The chorizo was the best I have ever had. The service was very good and quick. All workers were warm and friendly. We will definitely be back!
Simply yummy! The scrambles are so good, especially when you get them with the seasoned potatoes and coffee cake.

Super cute and delicious! Love when you can enter a restaurant and feel like you are truly in a family kitchen. The atmosphere vibe is laid back and homey. The food portions are very generous and oh so delicious! If your looking for an awesome breakfast waffle or an amazing salad for lunch this is the hidden gem! The service is great too! My only complaint is that they are only open for breakfast and lunch! Wish they were open for dinner too!

F* b-i-t-c-h waitress gave us the worst service. I was nice about it, signed for the bill and still gave her a standard 15% tip. Guess what this b-i-t-c-h did? she changed the tip amount, and my credit card statement just came and she charged me $2 more for tips. wtf? That's fraud!  Food was absolutely nasty. Everything was fried in lard and my throat was scratchy from all that oil. I asked for eggs over easy, and guess what? they broke the yolk! I really wanted to through it in her face, but had to work really hard to apply Confucious' anger management skills. argh!  Absolutely terrible experience. Don't ever go there!

This place doesn't believe in seasoning any of their food. Super greasy food. I asked the server what kind of steak was on their steak and egg dish. Nobody knew. She asked all of her co workers. First they said it was New York then some guy sitting in the office said it was just random pieces of random steaks. Try menu testing your staff once in a while. It would be easier for the customer to know what we're getting if the server knew what they are selling. You might want to train your cooks to use gloves while cooking and your servers to not grab the toast I'm about to eat with their bare hands.
I had an incredible experience here once again! I had bacon and eggs. They were very good. The food got on the table in literally 5 minutes. Service was good.

You could make this food yourself. It just wouldn't be this good.  The Good: It's exactly what you'd expect: charming breakfast food. Only it comes with amazing hash browns and toast. Also the non-breakfast food here is great too: good burgers, sandwiches, etc... I think of this as the original egg based breakfast joint in Vegas. I'm sure they didn't invent the concept, but it's great, fast, and consistent.  The food isn't 'creative' per se, it's exactly as diverse as it needs to be. They have specials that are usually pretty excellent in and of themselves.  The bad: Well, they close at three and they serve jelly in the standard little containers measuring 1/20th of a teaspoon. You need like thirty for one piece of toast.   WTF: GREEN AND BLACK MINTS ARE NOT DELICIOUS. KILL THEM WITH FIRE.  Suggestion: pancakes are an untapped creative medium. Please consider.

I love YELP!!   While staying in Las Vegas, went looking for a good place to have breakfast.  I have to admit I'm very picky about where I eat.  The restaurant has to be clean, have good food, creative menu, and great service.  Extra bonus to a family owned restaurant and not a chain.  This place fit the bill.    I had ham and eggs, and the ham was big and thick, not bone in, but very flavorful.  Eggs cooked just right, seasoned potatoes were perfect.  Was a great place to stop for breakfast.  They also have a senior menu which was perfect for my family members traveling with me.

I love this place! It's always packed but the wait time isn't that long. If you're in prison on death row, unsure of what you should choose as a last meal, try the peanut butter stuffed frnech toast. Scrumptious.

One of my FAVORITE breakfast places. The staff is super friendly and makes sure everything is perfect. I ordered the Mexican skillet and added spinach and it was delicious! They amount they give you is a lot too so I had left overs to take home.   I do believe it's a family owned business and they make you feel so welcomed .  I always recommend this spot for delicious breakfast.

Not sure what the high demand is about. Food wasn't bad but wasn't that good. We had great service from the front desk and waitress. Very efficient considering how busy they are. Nothing special. Wont be back. I ordered the enchilada omelette and my fiance ordered the Greek omelette. He agrees this place is OVER RATED. But again the atmosphere is upbeat and friendly.

This was our first experience here. We arrived on a Saturday morning around 7 and beat the normal crowds we have seen seated on the benches outside the restaurant.  We had a 4-year-old and 4-month-old with us, so we are always on edge about how eating out will be. The staff was friendly and efficient. They brought our older son his pancakes out first so he could get started (always appreciated!).  Food was excellent- crunchy hash browns, melt-in-your-mouth chocolate chip pancakes, amazing Mexican-style Eggs Benedict, and juicy A-1 Steak Scramble. Definitely will make this a monthly excursion!

Consistently good. I came here once in 2011 before I lived in Vegas and remembered it when I moved here and have come back many times.  I had the chili skillet, seasoned potatoes, chili, over easy eggs and I added jalapeos and onions because I love spicy. The season coffee cake was strawberry which was excellent however I've come to the conclusion their coffee cake isn't really coffee cake, it's more like a hybrid angel food cake but it's still delicious. The last few times I've visited the coffee cake has been a fruit that I'm allergic too so it was great to finally have a piece that wasn't mango or peach. I think they should have a regular like crumb/brown sugar coffee cake as an option as well, I feel like they'd do a great job at it.   Go eat breakfast here, it's delicious
I cannot lie I come here for the coffee cake. Pretty standard breakfast menu, nothing special. If it weren't for the coffee cake I probably wouldn't come.

Really nice staff and great service. The menu has lots of options. I just think it's a bit pricey compared to some other breakfast places that are similar. It's nearly $7 for just a 2 egg breakfast which is a bit excessive. Again, nice staff and I'd probably go back.

Love this place. Changed hands a couple times. Gets even better every time. It's definitely a brighter place in Glendale. They serve wonderful home-cooked meals and a super price and smiles from other servers.

Every time my boyfriend and I come here we get amazing service and the food is the bomb. The restaurant is always clean and the staff makes you feel like family. Never have I come here and not liked everything about this place. A++

Definitely a good place to grab a quick breakfast. Also a decent meeting spot for business breakfasts and lunches. Personally, I think you can do better with the food but all around it is a bad joint.

Breakfast was delicious,  I ordered build your own omelet and a side of corn beef hash. Coffee was non stop and our waitress penny kept checking on us.. I recommend this place to anyone who wants a big breakfast and good service

Mom and I stopped in to my favorite breakfast joint on the way to the airport.  I decided to try something I haven't tried before, so I went with the Peanut Butter & Cream Cheese stuffed French Toast w/Bananas.  After a short wait, our oder came out.....their portions are enough to feed two people!  I wish they offered a 1/2 order.  Oh well, I did my best to finish this thing, but it proved to be too much for me.  The combination of Peanut Butter and Cream Cheese was awesome!  It was so good I didn't need any Syrup or Butter added to it. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/74pWjFssgqyhaVg-YCUo3A?select=sJ_90yVfA6dYgPpZs5qXQg  Another great breakfast experience!  Return Factor - 100%

Met a business associate here for a breakfast meeting the other day.  I rarely come to this Cracked Egg location, but it was convenient at the time.  I ordered the Short Stack (2 giant Pankcakes).  They were very good, as usual.  The Cracked Egg rarely disappoints.  This location was very busy when we were here on a Friday morning.  However, the server kept up with the craziness and we were well taken care of.  We also took our time since we were there to discuss business matters....not once were we felt unwelcome because we were taking our time.  Overall, great service, great food.  Will I return?  You bet.

Excellent customer service from waitress Penny. I can't say enough about waitress Penny's great service!! When I commented about the food, she readily replaced it. The fried potato were bad. And they slightly tasted of freezer burn. I did not finish them. And I will not be taking them home.  The omelette was excellent it was best thing I had for my meal. The sourdough toast I told her to put extra butter on it and she did. That was great! However it is it highly of salt so I guess I should've asked for non-salted butter. The biscuits and gravy where OK. The gravy was good but the biscuits were hard as rocks. Hard to cut into. They crumble when I would try to eat them. Did expect a little bit better for the biscuit and gravy due to the reviews that I read about them. Showed the consistency of the biscuits and gravy to the waitress and she replace them for me.  The second time around was better :-) restroom cleanliness was ok. Could be better. No handicap restroom. Hmmm.... overall not bad. I'll go back for their excellent customer service and great prices!!

I was desperately needing to get away from the strip. I couldn't take the cigarette smoke, or the need to resist cheap alcohol at every turn, or the expensive food. I really just wanted a quiet, peaceful gluten-free brunch before attending a family wedding. And we got just that.   It was perfect weather outside when we came. There was a nice breeze and just the loveliest kiss of warmth from the sun. Service from all staff was welcoming and friendly. To top it off, they had a separate gluten-free/celiac-friendly menu! I was immediately drawn to the gluten-free pancakes, toast, and muffins. I got myself a delicious corned beef hash with a warm chocolate muffin! I couldn't be happier with my morning, especially when prices were under $10.   I am glad to have a found a local breakfast joint that is not too far from the strip. Now I have a go-to gluten-free diner whenever in Vegas.

Nothing special. Seems family owned and operated with people there who might not be too experienced. Had a simple French toast was okay and upon seeing the workers there. I noticed most of them had an assembly line going on. Someone specifically cutting the bread there. Putting things in and out of microwaves. Their pumpkin bread cake. Pancakes even microwaved. I probably could have made the same quality of food in my kitchen. It's just goes to show if you have a market and your in there at the right place, at the right time.

We really like this place. It is much better than Fast Eddies was and the selection of food is terrific. They have good burgers and breakfasts. I have had the gyro platter as well and enjoyed it. The only reason for the 4 stars instead of 5 stars is that the service can sometimes be spotty. We have had great waitresses and then horrible waitresses. Happily the food sees us through it and we always hope for the best with the servers.

We have been here a couple of times. Every time has been great. One of our favorite breakfast spots in Vegas. They always get you seated fast even on weekends. The omelets are huge and filling. They have different types of coffee cake depending on the day, raspberry has been my favorite so far. They also have a great menu for people with gluten allergy which is nice.

This is a good breakfast spot. Be prepared for a wait on weekend mornings, as they are usually very busy.  I usually end up ordering the same thing: Chicken Fried Steak Skillet. It is a chicken fried steak over a bed of house potatoes, smothered in delicious gravy and topped with copious amounts of cheese. I usually order the two eggs that come with in on the side rather than on the skillet.   I am not a fan of their omelettes. I think they lack a little flavor and flare, especially for the cost.   One thing that is great here is their coffee cake. They usually have a different flavor every time I go.   My main complaint about this place, aside from their omelettes (I like omelettes with meat, and their big bad wolf omelette (or whatever it is called) is definitely not laden with meat as you are led to believe) is that their service is slow. While I don't work there so can't know for sure, I would attribute it to how busy they are and a staff that is not large enough to handle everything. They also have a waitress there who never seems to like what she is doing. When I go out for breakfast, I don't want to deal with other people's problems and bad moods. That needs to be checked at the front door when the waitress comes in to work.   Aside from that, I do like this place, especially their chicken fried steak skillet.     Would I recommend this place to others? Yes.  Would I come back here myself? Yes.

Best breakfast I've had in a long time!!  My husband and I met a friend here over the holidays while we were in Vegas and talked about the place to everyone the rest of the trip!  They do a great job but get there early so you don't have a long wait!

Love, love, love this restaurant.  The food is great and the staff works together like a well-tuned machine to make sure service is always excellent.  Great locals spot but you often see celebrities dining here!  TIP:  the portions are large but often come in half portions - ask your server.
Excellent food!! We come here a lot have tried most everything from breakfast to lunch. The coffee cake is awesome. Service is always friendly and quick.

Food is home made, fresh and fabulous!! Coffee cake to die for!! Come hungry and leave with a to go box. The staff is amazingly friendly constantly, and take the time to learn your name likes and dislikes.

Went to visit family in Vegas, they suggested trying the Cracked Egg. Nice clean place. Serving staff were very good, attentive, and helpful. Their dishes are plentiful and we were not disappointed with any of the dishes we ordered. The food came out quickly. You get a choice of coffee cake or bread. I chose cake my wife the bread, we shared and it turned out perfect. I'll be back when I'm back in town.

Was here yesterday with my husband and just stopped by because of the stars. My husband ordered a chorizo meal with avocado. I ordered pan cakes. It looked like a manager who brought our food out to us. He drops it off without asking does everything look correct? So had to wait 15 minutes to flag waitress down to tell her we didn't get avocado or toast with his meal then my baby syrup covered like half my pancakes. By the time he got his avocado slices he was done with his meal. No apology or taken off. Food wasn't great or special so we will not be back or recommend.
Visiting from California and wanted the local experience and we were pleased the food was made in house and delightful

Someone wrote a positive review about their eggs Benedict so I tried it. Edible but nowhere close to what it should taste like. Server was pleasant and attentive. Good coffee. I would come back and have something else from the menu.
Slipped into a food coma halfway through the meal. Service is great. Food is even better. Wear your stretchy pants!

Good Portions and delicious fresh coffee cake. The eggs were off the chain! This is a very busy place and their waitress' provide excellent service. If you want a very filling breakfast, you're at the right place.

I thoroughly enjoyed my food at The Cracked Egg. The wait was a little long for how many tables they have in the restaurant. It looked like they had too many couples at booths and larger tables. My boyfriend and I were placed in a booth. Otherwise...  My Huevos Rancheros was so delicious! My boyfriend got the Chile Verde Rancheros. The pork looked amazing and my boyfriend couldn't even finish it all. I might be a fatty but I devoured the hell out of my huevos rancheros. So hard to resist the urge to gorge with amazing food set in front of me.  As far as the hash browns, I won't be getting them again. The seasoned potatoes that my boyfriend got were delightful and I tried not to eat them all. I will definitely be getting them in the future! I just hope that the line isn't as long as it was the first time we went. Good food is worth it though. :)

This was my first time eating at The Cracked Egg and I must say it left a great impression on me.   The hostess was very bland and straight forward. Although she wasn't rude, she wasn't very friendly either. Our waitress, Emily, was very friendly and attentive.   Now to the food ... I ordered a "build your own skillet" with pastrami, bacon, mushrooms, bell peppers, spinach, & broccoli. It was AWESOME; filled flavor and was very appealing to the eyes. My wife ordered the two egg combo with a waffle and potatoes; instead of eggs. I thought her food look great; she said it tasted average.   The eggs are definitely fresh but the potatoes are definitely from a bag.   Overall, the atmosphere was good, the food was delicious, & the service was great!

To start off, some of the complaints people have about this place are ridiculous. One person complained they don't have wifi. Is your company or ADHD really that bad that you can't hold a conversation with them? Is multi tasking really that much more important than sitting back and relaxing for 45 mins? What could you possibly be doing that's so important that you really need wifi for anyway? And no. If I'm there trying to enjoy a meal on the patio, I don't want someone's dog there, regardless of breed or size. Unless it's a service dog, why would you expect to bring it everywhere like an accessory? I'm sure they would rather lose the one customer that was butthurt they couldn't bring their animal to breakfast instead of losing three or four customers that would want a dog there. As for the service complaints, there are no complaints from me. I came for a quick breakfast with my mom. Everything came out fast and hot. We were asked if we had everything we need and if we needed anything else, let her know. Then we were left alone to eat and have a conversation without the server coming by every few minutes interrupting us asking if we needed anything. If I we did need anything, we would have gotten her attention and communicated with her instead of rearranging some dishes on the table and hope that she could read our minds that we needed something specific.  My mom got a veggie skillet which looked good, but not my type of thing. Plus I was craving their chocolate chip banana pancakes which definitely hit the spot. I also had scrambled eggs and sausage patties which you can't really mess up. If you think the food is bland, there is not much to do about that. It's all about personal preference and restaurants can't please everyone. They aim to please as many as they can, usually. Other places do what they do regardless of people's opinions. But that's usually certain types of food. Overall I've never had a bad experience here, and I would definitely go back. As for the price, meh, not too cheap or expensive. If you say you'd rather go to Mcd's then so be it. That's another case of opinion. Maybe you prefer that peculiar Mcd's flavor that's in all of their products. I'm not sure what that is, but I'm sure you know what I'm talking about.

I like that The Cracked Egg is a locally owned business.  It's always nice to support locals.   Whether sitting at the counter (no waiting) or in the main dining area (usually a wait), I have consistently experienced good service at the Cracked Egg.  At times it's a little slow, but they get very busy during weekend brunch, so it's hard to find fault with that.  You'll find typical American breakfast and lunch fare here.  Not much that would pique your interest to venture off the beaten path; but sometimes you're just looking for familiar comfort food.  Their omlettes, scrambles, and bennies are all tasty and hearty.  Their burgers are juicy and flavorful, and their salads fresh and cruchy.  Their pancakes are good too, but they're no Dupar's or Babystacks.  The space itself is large and clean, but could really use a decorator's touch.  Side benefit of The Cracked Egg is it's proximity to Popcorn Girl :).

Amazing waitstaff, Erin, being an outstanding waitress! The food was delicious. Don't leave without their coffee cake! The Joe's Scramble was spot-on--a recommendation from Erin. Wish we could take her back to Kansas with us!
I have been to the Cracked Egg twice now and it hasn't disappointed yet. A fun, simple and tasty breakfast. Both times I have gone have been on weekday mornings and the service is fast and efficient.
Good breakfast good coffee good people ! Get some grub before morning activities  Only one thing ...... No wifi arghhhhhhh!!!!!! All good though !!!
Great place to eat...fast service...excellent food.

Tried this place for the first time and loved it! Our new breakfast place! Talk about a delicious coffee cake! Sinful! My favorite is The Californian omelet ... And service is quick! You definitely don't sit hungry for long! The wait staff is friendly and overall a great environment!
Service and food were both AMAZING! The food was all fresh and cooked to perfection, Cory was so sweet with us! We will be coming back next time we're in Vegas, for sure!
I always get the Taylor scramble cream cheese and green onins ...YUM!!!!

You would think most restaurants these days would make there main business about why you come to restaurants in the first place, food and fellowship.  The wait was horrendously excessive.  After waiting 45 minutes to be seated, it took another 45 minutes to receive our food.  When I finally get my meal, it was all just pre made packaged food.  Look at the photo of my breakfast, those potatoes were pre-seasoned and nothing to brag about.  I will not be coming back for the simple fact, the wait was just so damn long!!!  Wasted two and half hours of my life.

We were looking for a breakfast place and found this via yelp.  Happy to see a place other than the chain IHOPS/Dennys that serves up a good breakfast.  Staff was friendly, prices were good, nice sized place so it handled our group of 14 easily.  We'll be back I'm sure.

I'm a breakfast junkie. If runny eggs and pancakes were a drug I would be serving a life prison sentence right now and cooking contraband fried eggs with my moonshine.  I've known the Cracked Egg was there, but I was sticking to what I knew. Alternatives in the area include the stellar fine dining of IHOP or Mimi's Cafe. I'm pretty sure those two places also serve as alternatives for nursing home field trips on the weekends.   We actually tried the Cracked Egg on the recommendation of a friend, which is funny since we don't actually have any friends. That is how good it is.   I like the portions and the food is much higher quality than IHOP. You can literally taste chicken suffering in IHOP's eggs, so the eggs with slightly fewer injected hormones are refreshing and appreciated by both my digestive system and my delicate pallet. The food has been good every time I've visited the Cracked Egg.   They also have a rewards card you can get and add to your ridiculous reward card collection, and they will send you a pretty good $8 coupon each month. It actually turns out cheaper than another breakfast place even without the coupon. And I enjoy it more, so it's a win either way. Except for my digestive system because it doesn't know me and it doesn't understand my life.  I gave 4 stars instead of 5 only because their service is sometimes on the "ignoring you" level of bad. I expect a minimum of mediocre service every time because I am such a demanding customer and stuff.

We stayed at red rock and wanted a quick breakfast before heading out. And found this place little over a mile away from the resort.  We got there around 8 on a Sunday morning. There was no wait. We got seated right away.  The service was great! There are a ton of menu selections yo choose from.  We got the corned beef hash, north shore scramble and the kids got chocolate chip pancakes.   I personally didn't like the corned beef. The corned beef was just ok. I got it with their popular coffee cake and seasoned potatoes.  The north shore scramble was ok, if you like onions then this is the one for you. We don't like onions THAT much so we didn't care for it.   The kids liked their chocolate chip pancakes. It tasted like any other chocolate chip pancake. Nothing special. It was just the pancakes, no fruit or meat option unless you order a side order.   Would we go back...probably not.     The coffee cake was light and arrived warm to the table. If I could sum up that coffee cake, it seemed like an angel cake with something (like an apple compote or jam) on the bottom and topped with an icing glaze.

I had this place bookmarked for a while and we finally got a chance to try It!  There was no wait when we got there (Black Friday 8 am). We got seated and was immediately greeted and our drink orders were taken. Shortly after that our friendly server took our order. Within 5-8 mins our food came out.   We ordered the homemade corned beef and the short stack chocolate chip pancakes (3 huge pancakes) for my kids to share.    The corned beef wasn't anything like I expected...the corned beef was thinly stripped with diced peppers, onions and hash brown potatoes mixed together. It also came with hash browns and their homemade coffee cake. Their portions are big so I shared with my husband.  All in all, it was good, service was good.   I would go back!

This place is absolutely delicious! Breakfast or lunch you won't be disappointed! Thereskillets, muffins, sandwiches, ranch, etc is ahhhh-mazing!  The staff is always super sweet and on top of their game!   Oh, and I love doing take out orders too. Quick and order always correct

I enjoy going to the cracked egg. I don't go often, but when I do--it's usually this location (although I've been to all of them), and they seem to always get it right here. I've never had to complain about my food (although I order the same thing every time for brunch-chicken fingers and hash browns with whatever coffee cake is being served). That's unless I get the BLT, which is great as well. The feel of the location is very "at home having brunch or lunch in your kitchen," it's small, usually packed, but the staff is great at getting people in and out in a timely and orderly fashion. Try to avoid the location off Ann/95--there's always issues there.
Great location...place is new and is nice. The service needs improvement. We waited. About 20 mins before anyone took our order...food is great on the other hand

This is my favorite breakfast spot in the city.  The food is great. I typically get the Joe's Scramble... eggs, ground beef, and cheese... oh my!  The food is reasonably priced with a large breakfast and lunch selection.  The service is always nice and the food comes out pretty fast. Of course like any good restaurant as it gets busy the service gets a little slow but for this place its not a problem. They still remain cool calm and pleasant under the pressure. My type of spot! I will most definitely be back!

This is by far my favorite restaurant spot!  The service is always friendly and the food is always delicious.  I typically get the Joes Scramble. Its ground beef, eggs, scallions, cream cheese delicious doesn't even begin to cover it. Their potatoes are good and their coffee cake is to die for.  This absolutely goes without saying I will be back!
Nice restaurant, friendly staff with great food. Large, appetizing portions. No complaints. Awesome!

This place is great! The service is quick and friendly, and the portions are huge. I ordered a soup and sandwich for lunch and the soup came in the biggest bowl I have ever seen. I was full before I even got to the sandwich! (But ate it anyways, I could never pass up a BLT)  I have been a few times now and they are always very accommodating with substitutions and special requests. The burgers and omelettes also have large portion sizes. I will definitely be returning!

This is one of my favorite breakfast spots in Vegas. Have been here for both breakfast and lunch. The servers are great and are always happy looking. To date I have tried the country Benni, homemade corned beef hash, the Mexican skillet, the enchilada omelette, chicken fried steak, Reuben, patty melt, bleu cheese bacon burger, and the open faced chili burger. The chili is excellent. The homemade corned beef hash was a bit disappointing. My go to favorite is the country Benni. Breakfast on the weekends is a bit of a wait.
The food was average.  We had to ask for a refill on the coffee and it was never offered again. This is not a place we will return to.

Wow, this place is great.  I was looking for some place for my sisters, friends and I to meet up with a relative that was near our hotel.  The Cracked Egg showed up on my google search, and I'm so glad it did.  We got there shortly after 9 on a Saturday morning with 6 people.  It took about ~20 minutes to seat us, which was expected.  I had looked over the menu while waiting, so by the time we sat down I knew what I wanted.  In fact, as soon as I saw it on the menu I didn't even have to keep looking.  Peanut butter stuffed french toast drizzled with bananas and honey.  This was one of my most favorite breakfasts ever.  It was like heaven on a plate!  All of the food we got was really good.  2 of the people I was with got coffee cake with their breakfasts, and boy was I jealous!  The type of coffee cake varies by whatever pan happens to come out of the oven, and they ended up with peach.  It was moist and warm and so good.  Breakfasts ordered:  Eggs Benedict, Monte Cristo, bacon cheeseburger skillet, and at least one other thing that I don't remember because I didn't taste it.  Everything was good.  I'm glad I got to taste a little bit of eveything, because they were all delicious.  I still stand by my decision of the peanut butter french toast.  yummy!  I can't wait until next Sept. when I'll be out there again for a repeat trip!

I have never had a bad meal nor a bad server here. Reasonably priced and delicious coffee cake. ALWAYS GET THE COFFEE CAKE! It changes daily and I pour some coffee over it and really enjoy before my entree arrives. My fiance and I often get the cornbeef and hash as well as the chicken fried steak and eggs and then share with each other.  Seriously my favorite breakfast place in town. There are plenty of options for lunch though I can never seem to get passed my favorites. I have tried a bite of other family members meals. The eggs Benedict and traditional French toast they ordered were enjoyed by all! Good portion size too.

Yummy! We eat here when we have family in town and don't want to destroy our kitchen to make 4 different breakfasts! They make homemade DELICIOUS coffee cake, and their own fresh salsa still warm from the stove....goes perfect on my eggs without making them cold! I love that they also have gluten free options too.
Great place to get food quality breakfast food for a great price. Off the strip so there aren't any touristy people. Just a good local spot to get stuffed!

First off, I am very dedicated customer of this establishment. I've been going to Cracked Egg for quite a long time, and tend to frequent it 2-3x a week.
